E aquo que es pus leugier en extraccio de arceria es que tu cauterizes la vena am aquest cauteri haventz dos cotels, pus que tu has senhat les dos locs am tenta, e depausa quascus, mot ignitz, entro que pervenguan al os e inscindan la vena en dos locs, per so que sia elonguat aquo que es entre las extremitatz de lu, quar no son consolidadas de tot am aquest cauteri.	And that which is lighter in the extraction of artery is that you cauterize the vein with this cautery having two handles, because you have marked the two places with a probe, and pause some, not ignited, until they reach the bone and cut the vein in two places, so that it be elongated that which is between the extremities of him, because they are not consolidated altogether with this cautery.
E aquesta es la forma del cauteri:	And this is the shape of the cautery:
E sia la acuitat dels dos cotels esemps.	And the sharpness of the two handles is also.
Mays empero si so mendres acuitat que dos cotels es milhor, quar si so agudas cum dos cotels propera a quascuna freg, e no enscideysso la carn am velocitat.	But however, if they are less sharp than two handles are better, because if they are sharp with two handles, it approaches to each wound, and does not cut the flesh with speed.
Donc cum en aquels es alcuna grossitut, es tenguda la calor del foc en aquels e la carn es abscindida leugierament.	Therefore, as in those there is some thickness, the heat of the fire is held in those and the flesh is cut slightly.
E aquesta obra es milhor en tota obra e pus leugiera.	And this work is better in all work and lighter.
E sia le spazi le qual es entre dos cotels la quantitat de la grossesa del dit.	And the spaces which are between two handles are the quantity of the thickness of the finger.
Capitol quart.	Chapter Fourth.
De la cura de cors de lagremas agudas e aciduas dels huels.	Of the cure of the bodies of acute and sour rheums of the heels.
Quan so lagremas aciduas, e es le cors de aquelas venas las quals so sobre le test del cap deforo, e no comfereys en aquo alcuna causa de la curacio de medicina, e vezes la cara del malaute ja enrogesir e sent en le sieu front deambulacio ayssi cum si era deambulacio de formiguas, e·ls huels de aquel so extenuatz, humitz enayssi que ja les pels de lor son conodutz, e las parpelas so scalfadas per la acuitat de las lacrimas, les antics agro mesties en la curacio de aquelas de aquesta operacio, e nompnero aquela curacio am spassa.	When the rheums are sour, and the bodies of those veins which are on the test of the head are inflamed, and do not confer any cause of the cure of medicine, and sometimes the face of the patient already reddens and feels on his forehead a walking as if it were walking of ants, and the heels of that are exhausted, humid in such a way that already the hairs of them are known, and the eyelids are scalded by the sharpness of the tears, the old remedies mixed in the cure of those of this operation, and numbered that cure with space.
E es que tu comandas al malaute rayre les pels les quals son en le sieu front, e aprop inscideys en le front tres fissuras engualment distans segon la longitut del front.	And it is that you command the patient to scrape the hairs which are on his forehead, and then cut three fissures equally distant according to the length of the forehead.
E si’ la longitut de la fissura cays dos ditz: la una fissura sia engualment distant a la longitut del nas en le mieg loc del front, e la segonda segon la longitut un petit del movement dels lacertz les quals so en le lacrimal, e la tersa del autre part.	And if the length of the fissure is two fingers: one fissure be equally distant to the length of the nose in the middle location of the forehead, and the second according to the length a little of the movement of the muscles which are in the lacrimal, and the third on the other part.
E guarda te de la incizio de las arcerias las quals so en dos latz, e elongua la tua ma de la continuacio de amdos las mandibulas.	And guard yourself from the incision of the arteries which are in two places, and lengthen your hand from the continuation of both the jaws.
E si’ l’espazi de quascuna inscizio la quantitat de tres ditz ajustatz.	And if the space of each incision is the quantity of three fingers adjusted.
E si’ a tu una pessa d’espongua apparelhada o draps seccatz motz am les quals exsiccas le sanc.	And if to you a piece of sponge dressed or dried cloths most with which you dry the blood.
E aprop entremet le spatum de dos agudas extremitatz, del qual aquesta es la forma de la inscisio de lu:	And then introduce the spatula of two sharp extremities, of which this is the shape of the incision of it:
que es de la partida des templas entro a la segonda inscizio.	which is from the part of the temples into the second incision.
Exxcorja am aquel tota la codena la qual es entre dos incizios am le ciphac le qual es sobre le os, e aprop fay aquo de la inscizio migera entro a la segonda inscisio.	Excoriate with that all the flesh which is between the two incisions with the chisel which is on the bone, and then do that of the middle incision into the second incision.
E aprop stratz ne aquest spatum e entromet en la primieyra inscizio autra vetz un autre instrument le qual es apelat cutellar, agut de una part e del autre no agut.	And then scrape with this spatula and introduce into the first incision another time an instrument which is called a cutter, sharp on one part and on the other not sharp.
E pausa le latz de aquel agut deves la carn annexa deves la codena, e le latz de lu leon dintz le os, e empelley aquel entro que pervengua a la fissura migera, e abscindeys am aquel totz les vaysels que descendo del cap als huels.	And pause the edge of that sharp of the flesh annexed of the flesh, and the edge of it along the bone, and push that until it reaches the middle fissure, and cut with that all the vessels that descend from the head to the heels.
Mays que sia continuada la inscizio ad aquo appar de la codena, e aprop fay aquo en la fissura migana entro al autra fissura.	But that the incision be continued to that which appears of the flesh, and then do that in the middle fissure into the other fissure.
E pus que corr del sanc quantitat engual, exprem les locs de las pessas del sanc congilat.	And since that blood flows in quantity equal, squeeze the places of the pieces of coagulated blood.
E aprop pausa en quascuna fissura calgua de coto vielh, e pausa sobre aquels polvils enbegutz en vi e oli e vi agre, e vegas que no endevengua apostema caut.	And then pause in each fissure a poultice of old cloth, and pause on those powders mixed in wine and oil and wine vinegar, and be careful that it does not become an abscess.
E en le tertz dia deslia le liament e aministra gran enfusio de aygua cauda o tebeza, e aprop cura aquo am enguent bazilicon am oli rozat e autres entro que las plaguas sian sanadas.	And on the third day untie the bandage and administer a great infusion of hot water or tea, and then cure that with an enguent of basilicon with rose oil and others until the wounds are healed.
Capitol .v.	Chapter V.
De la cura de lagramas per catartz e als huels descendentz de las partidas dedintz del cap.	Of the cure of rheums by catarrh and in the heels descending from the parts of behind the head.
Quan ad alcu veno catartz agutz e continuantz, e vezes les huels del malaute extenuatz petitz, e ja le reguardament de lor es debelitat, e las palpebras ulceradas e de lor cazo les pels, e en le preon del cap es dolor aguda ledent e extrenutacio consequent, lahoras sapias per aquestz accidentz que las materias e catartz no veno sino de motas venas de las partidas dedintz procedent.	When it comes to a certain catarrh acute and continuous, and sometimes the heels of the patient are exhausted small, and already the regard of them is debilitated, and the eyelids ulcerated and of their case the hairs, and in the forehead of the head is acute pain and exhaustion consequent, then you know by these accidents that the matter and catarrh do not come but from a few veins of the parts behind proceeding.
E la milhor curacio en aquels es aquesta: que comandes al malaute que raza lo sieu front, e aprop inscideys en aquel una fissura al mieg loc del front, un petit per la latitut (e comensa am la fissura del templar senestre entro al dextre templar; e sia inscisio entro al os; e eslongua la tua ma dels lacertz del templas lesquals son maugutz deves la mastigacio), entro que sia le os descubert.	And the best cure in those is this: that you command the patient to shave his forehead, and then cut in that a fissure in the middle location of the forehead, a little by the width (and begins with the fissure of the left temple into the right temple; and be incision into the bone; and lengthen your hand of the muscles of the temples which are bad of the chewing), until it be the bone uncovered.
Exsicca tot le sanc am espongua o am drap secc e aprop repleys entre las doas labias de la fissura am coto vielh o am draps de li.	Dry all the blood with sponge or with dry cloth and then refill between the two lips of the fissure with old cloth or with linen rags.
E aprop estrenh desus am polvils enbegutz en vi e oli per so que no endevengua apostema caut.	And then strengthen above with powders mixed in wine and oil so that it does not become an abscess.
E quan deslias aquo e veses que l’apostema ja es diminuit, lahoras cove que fregua le os entro que comensa en lu nayser carn, e aprop cura aquel am regiment exsiccatiu le qual fassa neysser la carn, ayssi cum si tu prenes de farina de froment dos partidas e de colofania quatre partidas e mescla o, e de lor sia fayt emplastre e sia aministrat en aquestas plaguas a de la carn nativitat.	And when you untie it and see that the abscess has already diminished, then cover the wound so that it begins to form flesh, and then take care of it with an exsiccative regimen which makes the flesh grow, as if you take two parts of wheat flour and four parts of colophony and mix them, and make a poultice of them and apply it to these sores at the birth of the flesh.
Capitol .vi.	Chapter VI.
De la cura de aquo que catz en las aurelhas.	Of the cure of that which catz in the ears.
Tota causa que catz en las aurelhas es una de quatre specias, quar o es peyra mineral o causa semblant a peyra, ayssi cum ferr e veyre, o es de planta ayssi cum ceze o fava, o es causa fluxtibla ayssi cum aygua e vi agre e a lor semblantz, o alcuna bestia.	Every cause that catz in the ears is one of four species, for it is either mineral or a cause similar to mineral, such as iron and lead, or it is of plant, such as saffron or bean, or it is a fluid cause such as water and sour wine and their likenesses, or some beast.
E donc quan peyra catz en l’aurelha o autra causa semblant de aquelas causas que no ajustan ne creysso en l’aurelha, e pausa la aurelha al solelh, e si vezes la peyra, lahoras distilla en aquela alcuna causa de oli violat o sizami, e aprop aministra la extraccio de lu, e fay le stornudar am condizi, e oppila las nars deve le aveniment de stornutacio.	And therefore when lead or another cause similar to those causes that do not adjust or grow in the ear, and put the ear in the sun, and if you see the lead, then distill in it some cause of violet oil or sesame, and then administer the extract of it, and make the patient sneeze with the condiment, and plug the nostrils to prevent the event of sneezing.
E aprop pausa en le circuit de la aurelha alscunas pessas de drap o lana, e dextendas la aurelha a las partidas desus, quar motas veguadas es foro-getada am aquestas causas.	And then put some pieces of cloth or wool in the circuit of the ear, and extend the ear to the parts above, for many times it is driven-out with these causes.
E si no n’es getada, lahoras aministra extraccio de lu am le instrument apelat gesti epicicarios subtil del qual aquesta es la forma:	And if it is not driven out, then administer the extract of it with the instrument called a delicate epicyclic gester, of which this is the form:
E si es foro-getada am gesti, bo es; e sino, lahoras aministra la extraccio de lu am onci subtil de pauca duplicacio.	And if it is driven out with the gester, it is well; and if not, then administer the extract of it with a subtle onci of little duplication.
E donc si no es foro-getada per aquo, lahoras fay una canula de aram e entromet la extremitat de la canula en le trauc de la aurelha e claus a l’enviro de la canula am cera e am oli mollificada per so que no sia ubert sino la canula.	And therefore if it is not driven out by this, then make a canula of brass and insert the extremity of the canula into the tract of the ear and close around the canula with wax and softened oil so that it be not open except the canula.
E aprop extratz am le tieu vent am fort atraccio, quar tropas veguadas cum aquo que havem recontat.	And then extract with your wind with strong suction, for many times like the water that we have recounted.
Mays si no es foro-getada en aquesta manieyra, lahoras pren de halka alumbat o de vecz aparelhat am le qual son preses les ausels una patita quantitat, e pausa aquel en la extremitat de ray, e aprop envolopa sobre aquel coto decentment pausat.	But if it is not driven out in this manner, then take some halka illuminated or a vecz apparelled with which the birds are taken a small quantity, and put that on the extremity of the ray, and then envelop it over that well-placed cot.
E aprop entromet aquel en le trauc de la aurelha am facilitat, e aprop excicca la aurelha de la humiditat.	And then insert that into the tract of the ear with ease, and then exsiccate the ear of the humidity.
E donc si no es foro-getada am totas las causas las quals havem recontadas, lahoras tu coyta a talhar aquela denant que endevengua apostema caut o espasme.	And therefore if it is not driven out with all the causes which we have recounted, then you should resort to cutting that before it becomes an abscess or a spasm.
E la manieyra de talhar aquela es que tu al comensament sancnes le malaute de la vena sephasica e extratz del sanc segon la mannieyra de la vertut de lu, e aprop fay aquel cezer entre las tuas mas e converteys l’aurelha a las partidas desus, e fen am petita fissura en la razit de la aurelha deves lo greys de lu en le loc be premegut de lu.	And the manner of cutting it is that you at the beginning lances the patient from the cephalic vein and extract the blood according to the manner of its virtue, and then make that cezer between your hands and turn the ear to the parts above, and make a small fissure in the root of the ear, above the gray of it, in the well-premeditated place.
E sia la fissura de figura lunar entro que pervengua a la peyra, e, la peyra atrobada, osta aquela si podes am instrumentz apropriatz; e aprop cos la fissura en aquela hora am velocitat, e cura aquela entro que sia sanat.	And let the fissure be of a lunar figure until it reaches the lead, and, the lead being reached, you can remove it with appropriate instruments; and then close the fissure in that hour with velocity, and cure it while it is healing.
E si la causa cazent en la aurelha es un dels gras que creysso e so inflatz, lahoras aministra la curacio e la extraccio de lu; mays si no obezeys a tu ad eyssiment, lahoras tu pren spatum teune subtil segon aquesta forma:	And if the cause catz in the ear is one of the greases that grows and inflates, then administer the cure and the extract of it; but if you do not obey my advice and so, then you take a subtle teune spatum according to this form:
e aministra am aquel la abscizio de aquel gra lo qual es cazut en l’aurelha.	and administer with that the abscess of that grease which is catz in the ear.
E no fassas aquo quan cogitas que aquel ja es humectat per la vapor del aurelha, e pausa aquel en motas pessas, e prop extratz ne aquelas am les oncis o am gesti subtil, o ab inscizio ayssi co dit havem, quar es alleujada la extraccio de lu.	And do not do this when you think that it is already moistened by the vapor of the ear, and put that in several pieces, and prop extract it with the oncis or with a subtle gester, or with incision as we have said, for the extract of it is alleviated.
Mays en l’aygua la qual es intrada en l’aurelha cove que·l malaute use de sternutacio am condizi al comensament, e omple la sieua aurelha am alcu coto vielh, e jagua sobre aquela aurelha en la qual es l’aygua, e si per aquo es foro-getada, bo es; e sino, lahoras pren tropas peyras teunas e leons segon la longitut del dit, e calfa aquelas en le foc un pauc, e le pacient entrometa una de aquelas en le trauc de la sua aurelha e saute sobre la un pe sieu de aquela partida e percussia am una autra peyra sobre la peyra la qual es dintz la aurelha.	But in the water which is entered into the ear, cover that the patient uses sneezing with condiment at the beginning, and fill his ear with some old cot, and jagua over that ear in which is the water, and if by this it is driven out, it is well; and if not, then take many small lead weights and leons according to the length of the finger, and heat those in the fire a little, and the patient inserts one of those into the tract of his ear and jumps on one foot of that part and percussion with another stone on the stone which is inside the ear.
Donc no cesse aquo am peyra entro que tota l’aygua sia foro-getada.	Therefore do not cease this with lead until all the water is driven out.
E ja l’aygua sira foro-getada enayssi que tu prenguas de papier o de gonc .i., e met la una extremetat de lu en l’aurelha e estendas l’autre extremitat am foc entro que sia comburit le may de lu.	And already the water is driven out, so that you take paper or of gonc, that is, and put one extremity of it in the ear and extend the other extremity with fire until it is burned most of it.
E prop met i autre gonc e fay aquo tantas veguadas entro que tota l’aygua sia foro-getada, e stratz aquel am canula ayssi co desus es dit de la peyra extrasadora.	And then put another gonc and do this so many times until all the water is driven out, and stract that with a canula as it was said above of the lead extractor.
Mays en la extraccio de bestia intrant en aquela aurelha, si es a petit cos, ayssi piussa e a lu semblant, cura aquel ayssi cum havem dit en la divisio; mays si es de gran cos la qual causa apar al sen del vezement, lahoras aministra la extraccio de lu am gesti e oncis, e la causa de lu es pus leugiera de totas las autras causas que cazo en l’aurelha.	But in the extraction of beast intrant into that ear, if it is a small thing, as small as it is similar, cure it as we have said in the division; but if it is of a large thing which causes appearance in the front of the vessel, then administer the extract of it with gesti and oncis, and the cause of it is less weighty of all the other causes that catz in the ear.
Mays en la extraccio de verm engendrat en la aurelha, quan tu curas aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e en le tractat de distillacios e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu reguardes la aurelha al solelh.	But in the extraction of worms generated in the ear, when you treat that with what we have said in the division and in the treatment of distillations and do not compare your treatment, then it is necessary that you guard the ear in the sun.
E donc si apar aqui alcuna causa dels verms, lahoras extratz aquel am gesti o am onci subtils, mays si no apar deguna causa, lahoras pren una canula dejos streyta e desus ampla de la qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And therefore if there is any cause of worms here, then extract them with tweezers or with subtle instruments, but if no cause appears, then take a cannula, which is narrow and wide at the top, and this is its shape:
E entromet la extremitat subtil en la aurelha segon la quantitat la qual suffertar puesca le malaute; e aprop sucgeys am aquela per succio fort, e fay aquo motas veguadas, entro que totz les verms sian foro-gitatz.	And introduce the fine extremity into the ear according to the amount which the patient can suffer; and then suck with that by strong suction, and do this several times, until all the worms are expelled.
Mays si no obezeysso a tu al ayssiment, lahoras tu opila e claus en le circuit de la canula am cera ayssi cum havem dit; lahoras aministre distillacios las quals han ja esproadas les antics en la curacio dels verms, e atrobaras aquo en le tractat de distillacios.	But if you do not obey this, then you plug and close the circuit of the cannula with wax as we have said; then administer distillations which have already been prepared in the treatment of worms, and you will find this in the treatment of distillations.
E sia la tua efusio am la qual efundas les olis medicinas en la aurelha am aquest strument del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And it is your effusion with which you pour the medicinal oils into the ear with this instrument, the shape of which is:
E fay aquela de argent o de eram, dejos streyt, en le qual sia un petit trauc, e am pla desus.	And make it of silver or of brass, narrow at the bottom, with a small hole, and flat on top.
E donc sia cum empellent a que es en la conquavitat de la canula de continent aqui on sira necessari.	And therefore it is as if they were pushing it into the concave part of the cannula, which is necessary here.
E si vols, pren le ray e envolveys en la extremitat de lu decentment coto, e aprop gieta oli en la concavitat del auziment, o suc de alcuna herba, o aquo que vols de aquestas medicinas en la canula — e aquela es en la aurelha —, e aprop entromet le ray am coto desus e exprem am la tua ma aquel am compressio temprada de lu entro que l’oli sia expellit en la concavitat del auziment e le malaute senta le oli dedintz.	And if you wish, take the reed and wrap it decently in the extremity of it, and then pour oil into the concavity of the ear, or juice of some herb, or water that you wish of these medicines into the cannula — and that is in the ear — and then introduce the reed with the cotton on top and press with your hand with moderate compression until the oil is expelled into the concavity of the ear and the patient feels the oil inside.
E aquo que sia enfundut en la aurelha sia ja scalfat am foc un petit.	And that which is infused into the ear should already be scalded with fire a little.
E guarda te que la causa la qual distillaras en l’aurelha no sia trop frega, quar las medicinas de aurelha no suffertan aquo.	And guard yourself that the cause which you distill into the ear is not too cold, for the medicines of the ear do not tolerate that.
Capitol .vii.	Chapter .vii.
De curacio de opilacio de aurelhas.	Of the cure of earwax.
Alcunas veguadas alcus enfantz yeysso dels ventres de lors mayres no-perforatz, e aquo ja accideys en alcus homes, opilacio en le meat de la aurelha per plagua o per carn nada en aquela; e aquesta opilacio alcunas veguadas es fayta en le preon del trau de la aurelha la qual no consiec le vezement, e alcunas veguadas es en las partidas defora.	Sometimes babies are born from their mothers' wombs unperforated, and this happens to some men, earwax in the ear canal due to plague or flesh that has nothing to do with that; and this earwax sometimes is made in the front of the ear canal which does not allow the passage, and sometimes it is in the outer parts.
E aquela que accideys en le preon de lu, la qual no comprehen le vezement, es en las majors disposicios de dificil sanacio.	And that which happens in the front of it, which does not allow passage, is in the greatest dispositions of difficult healing.
E en aquela en qual consegueys le vezement, cove que tu pauses la aurelha del malaute al solelh e reguarda en aquela.	And in that one in which you achieve passage, then you should place the ear of the patient in the sun and watch it.
E donc si vezes oppulacio apparent, obre aquela am espatum subtil del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And therefore if you see earwax appearing, open it with a subtle spatula, the shape of which is:
Si’ la extremitat de lu en la qual sia petita la latitut, del qual la una partida sia aguda e l’autra no; e le spatum sia de dos latz leon per so que no fassa lizio al aurelha.	If the extremity of it, in which the width is small, one part is sharp and the other is not; and the spatula is of two lengths, so that it does not cause damage to the ear.
E donc si la opilacio es per carn nascuda en la aurelha o en le meat de lu, lahoras te aquela am oncis subtils e incidiys aquela vehement facilitat entro que sia ostada tota la carn.	And therefore if the earwax is due to flesh born in the ear or in the canal of it, then you take that with subtle instruments and cut it vehemently with ease until all the flesh is gone.
E si opilacio es en le preon de la aurelha, lahoras pren ray subtil leon e escalfa aquel am foc un pauc, e aprop met aquel en le meat de l’aurelha.	And if the earwax is in the front of the ear canal, then take a subtle reed and scald it with fire a little, and then put it in the ear canal.
E donc si as scentit oppulacio am aquo que le malaute atroba am facilitat, per gravetat de ausir, esforsa la oppressio de lu am facilitat; e guarda te que no plagues les nervis del aurelha.	And therefore if you have felt earwax with that which the patient feels with ease, due to the gravity of the ear, you will increase the pressure of it with ease; and guard yourself that you do not damage the nerves of the ear.
E aprop pausa en l’aurelha drap de li segon la quantitat del ample del trauc lo qual tu as envolvutz en l’enguent egipciac; e fay aquo per alcus jorns entro que sias segur de la consolidacio de la plagua; o que prenguas qualgua e enfon aquela en ayguaros e pulveriza sobre lu segi trissat e usa de lu; e si vezes la aurelha ja esser apostemada, lahoras cove que tu estraguas la qualgua e permutes aquela am autra qualgua la qual tu envoloparas en cerot que sia fayt am oli rozat, entro que sia le apostema caut cedat; e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And then place in the ear a cloth according to the amount of the width of the tube which you have wrapped in the Egyptian ointment; and do this for several days until you are sure of the consolidation of the plague; or take some and put that in water and pulverize it over it, following the advice of the wise, and use it; and if you see the ear already suppurating, then you should extract the pus and replace it with another one which you have wrapped in a cloth that is made with rose oil, until the pus has subsided; and then cure it until it is healed.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc, lahoras submergeys esponga o drap en aygua frega e pausa sobre la aurelha, e usa del autra curacio la qual restrengeys le flux del sanc, la qual es dita en le tractat de distillacio.	But if there is a flux of blood, then submerge a sponge or cloth in cold water and place it over the ear, and use the other cure which you restrict the flow of blood, which is mentioned in the treatment of distillations.
Capitol .viii.	Chapter .viii.
De cura de athezil le qual endeveno a las palpebras.	Of the cure of the itch which develops on the eyelids.
Athezil les quals endeveno a las paupebras dels huels alcuna veguada so humitz, alscunas veguadas son secs.	The itch which develops on the eyelids of the eyes sometimes is wet, sometimes is dry.
Donc cove que tu tenguas aquels am tenhalhas o am onci, e inscindas aquels am espatum de las suas razitz, e aprop pausa sobre les locs segi trissat.	Therefore, you should have those with tweezers or with a knife, and cut them with a spatula at their roots, and then place on the places according to the advice of the wise.
Mays si dolor am flux de sanc veno, lahoras tu cauteriza aquels am cauteri lanticular subtil.	But if there is pain with a flow of blood coming, then you cauterize those with a subtle lancet cautery.
E la milhor cauterizacio es aprop las inscizios e tropas veguadas retornam quan reman alcuna causa de sas razitz; e quan so cauterizadas am foc, aquelas razitz son comburidas e no retornan.	And the best cauterization is to do it after the incisions and several times return when there is any cause of their roots; and when they are cauterized with fire, those roots are burned and do not return.
Capitol .ix.	Chapter IX.
Cura de grandeyssa que veno a las palpebras dels huels.	Treatment of a large swelling that comes to the eyelids of the ankles.
Motas veguadas endeve en las palpebras dels huels alcuna causa la qual es asemblada a grandissa en sa fortalicia e duricia, e per so grandissia es apelada.	Often a swelling appears in the eyelids of the ankles, some cause of which is assembled to a large hardness and rigidity, and by its largeness it is called.
E es agreguacio de humiditat grossa en la palpebra dejos e desus.	And it is an accumulation of thick humidity in the eyelid below and above.
Donc la opperacio en lor es que consideras lahoras si la grandissia es procedent en lu en aquo que apar de la palpebra e es mauguda a tota partida; e la causa de lu es leugiera.	Therefore the operation in them is that you consider this, if the swelling is proceeding in it that appears apart from the eyelid and is bad to all parts; and the cause of it is lightness.
Donc fen sobre aquela am fissura per la latitut, e aprop escorga aquela de tota partida am facilitat entro que evasesca, e aprop suspen aquela am onci e abscindeys aquela.	Therefore, cut on that with a fissure along the width, and then drain that from all parts with ease while it is escaping, and then suspend that with a bandage and cut off that.
Mays si a tu no es apparelhada la incizio de lu si no pus que penetras la palpebra am inscizio pauc a pauc, lahoras aquo no notz en deguna causa.	But if to you it is not prepared the incision of it, if not that you penetrate the eyelid with an incision little by little, then that you do not notice in any cause.
E si la figura es gran, lahoras tu l’ajusta am sutura; e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.	And if the figure is large, then you adjust it with suture; and care for that while it is healing.
E si es pauca, a tu no sobrevindra mal per aquela quar l’anguent de lu restaura aquela e encarna.	And if it is small, to you it will not come to harm for that, because the ointment of it restores that and it heals.
E si la grandissia es declinant a las partidas dedintz de la palpebra deves la superficia dedintz, lahoras evesa la palpebra e suspen la grandissia am onci, otra que tu indigescas de incizio, e prem aquela de tota part, e si la palpebra per inscizio es alonguada, aquo no notz en deguna causa.	And if the swelling is declining to the parts of the inside of the eyelid, then you open the surface of the inside, then you open the eyelid and suspend the swelling with a bandage, another that you do not dig into incision, and press that from all parts, and if the eyelid by incision is lengthened, that you do not notice in any cause.
E aprop la incizio, lava le huel am aygua salada; e cura le loc am aquo que encarna entro que sia sanat.	And then the incision, wash the ankle with salt water; and care for the place with water that heals until it is healed.
Capitol .x.	Chapter X.
De la cura axcirnah en la palpebra desus del huel.	Of the cure to be applied to the eyelid above the ankle.
Axcirnath es grays le qual es engendrat en las tunicas de la palpebra desus, e majorment endeve als enfantz, agrava les huels de aquels et accideyso a lor catartz le mayti; e no podon reguardar la claror del solelh per aquo quar lagremas se coytan ad aquels.	The ailment is gray that is generated in the tunics of the eyelid above, and mostly in children, it aggravates the ankles of those and it accides to their cataracts the most; and they cannot look at the brightness of the sun because of that, because tears are collected to those.
E per so tu vezes aquels jaser sobre les lors caras tot temps, e sobre les lors caras dormen; e so a las palpebras de lor dejos les sobrecils humidas, las quals ja ha cuberta imflacio, e iminencia de accernac apparent es en l’uelh; e que quant tu premes le loc am les tieus ditz, tu centes accernac entro aquels.	And because of that, those times make them rub their faces all the time, and on their faces they sleep; and on the eyelids of their below the eyebrows are humid, the ones that already have covered inflammation, and imminence of acne appears in the eye; and that when you press the place with your fingers, you feel acne within those.
E alcuna manieyra de opperacio es en aquel que le malaute pausa le sieu cap en le tieu se, e aprop pausa drap de li e de lu fay calgua, e fay de lu cercle segon la quantitat la qual contena arthernach de tota partida, e aprop pausa aquel sobre aquela e prem am les tieus ditz de tota per que sia agreguat arcernac en le mieg del cercle, e aprop fen en le mieg de aquela humiditat am spatum inscident am fissura per la latitut, e la fissura no sia major que la fissura que es fayta en flaubotomia.	And some manner of operation is in that which the patient lays his head in your lap, and then you lay cloth on him and make a poultice of it, and make of it a circle according to the quantity which contains the abscess from all parts, and then you lay that on that and press with your fingers from all sides so that it may be aggregated abscess in the middle of the circle, and then make in the middle of that humidity with a spatula incision with a fissure along the width, and the fissure not be larger than the fissure that is made in a falotomy.
Mays en le preon cove que tu fendas la codena tota entro que pervenguas ad arcernach, quar en las mays desposicios proceseys arcernach per fissura segon la forma de grayseza blanca.	But in the pressing cover that you make the incision all while you arrive at abscess, because in the most serious processes abscess by fissure according to the form of white grayness.
Donc extratz aquela am draps los quals tu as envolopatz entre les tieus ditz a las partidas deforo e revolv entre la ma dextra e sinistre entro que sia dispargut.	Therefore extract that with cloths the ones which you have enveloped between your fingers to the parts of the outside and revolve between your right and left hand until it is dispersed.
E guarda te que no ajustes en la fissura per so que am le spatum no pervenguas al huel e ladescas aquel.	And guard yourself that you do not adjust in the fissure for that, with the spatula, you do not reach the eye and scrape that.
Mays si no apar a tu arternach en le comensament de la fissura, mays que tu ajustes en la fissura un petit am fecilitat entro que procesisca arternach; e aprop extratz aquela ayssi quo havem dit; e aprop submargeys draps de li en aygua e vi agre e pausa les sobre le loc e estrenh aquels am polvils.	But if there does not appear to you abscess at the beginning of the fissure, but that you adjust in the fissure a little with ease until it processes abscess; and then extract that as we have said; and then submerge cloths of it in water and wine and lay them on the place and strengthen those with powders.
E so alcus que trissan sal e pausan aquel en la conquavitat de la fissura per so que aquo que es remas de aquela humiditat.	And if some that mix salt and lay that in the concavity of the fissure so that that which is remade of that humidity.
E aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And then care for that until it is healed.
Mays si accideys en le loc apostema caut, lahoras cura aquel am emplastres cedatils entro que sia sanat.	But if it happens in the place abscess caut, then care for that with poultices until it is healed.
Capitol .xi.	Chapter XI.
De manieyras de tactimi del huel.	Of manners of touching the ankle.
Quan en las palpebras dels huels so natz pels ajustatz dejos les pels naturals e so antiquatz, lahoras aquels noso al huel e fan endevenir manieras de malautias ayssi cum lacrimas assiduas e mollificacio de palpebras e tela entro que aquo sia causa de destruccio del huel que s’apela tactinir del huel, e cura se en quatre manieyras: o per cauteri am foc; o am medicina acuta segon que denant es dit en le capitol de cauteri; o es fayt atactini per inscizio e sutura; o per cannas segon que yeu diyre.	When in the eyelids of the ankles there are hairs that are natural and are old, then those ours to the ankle and make become manners of ailments as such as continuous tears and softening of eyelids and web until that is a cause of destruction of the ankle that is called touching of the ankle, and care for it in four manners: or by cauterization with fire; or with acute medicine according to that it was said before in the chapter of cauterization; or it is made touching by incision and suture; or by canes according to that I have said.
E donc cove que tu pauses le cap del malaute en le tieu se; aprop converteys la palpebra del uelh am la tua ma sinistra, e si es convertida, bo es; e sino, entromet agulha en aquela en la qual sia fiel de la partida pus dejos de la palpebra, e fay penetrar la agulha am fiel desus, e aquo sia — prop del marge de la palpebra en le qual naysso les pels — prop dels pels, e tira le fiel a las partidas desus am la palpebra, e converteys aquela am le ray.	And therefore, cover that you lay the head of the patient in your lap; then turn the eyelid of the eye with your left hand, and if it is turned, it is well; and if not, introduce a needle into that in which it is firm of the part below of the eyelid, and make penetrate the needle with firm below, and that be — near the edge of the eyelid in which there are the hairs — near the hairs, and pull the thread to the parts below with the eyelid, and turn that with the ray.
E aprop fen en la partida dedintz de la palpebra dejos les pels ajustatz am spatum inscidentz del lacrimal major entro al lacrimal mendre; e aprop extratz le fiel e pausa dejos la palpebra polvilhs petitz de coto o de drap, e aprop senha sobre la palpebra am tenta, e sia ayssi cum figura de fuelha de mirt.	And then make in the part of the inside of the eyelid below the hairs adjusted with a spatula incision from the lacrimal major into the lacrimal minor; and then extract the thread and lay below the eyelid small powders of cotton or of cloth, and then send over the eyelid with a tent, and be as such as figure of a leaf of myrtle.
Mays empero cove que sia la figura segon la quantitat de helevacio de la palpebra, quar aquo ja es diversificat en les homes, quar de aquels es le quals indigeys que sia inscidit de la palpebra gran quantitat segon la quantitat per la qual la palpebra es mollificada.	But however, the figure should be according to the amount of elevation of the eyelid, because this is already diversified in men, because some of those who are indigenous that should be incised of the eyelid a large quantity according to the amount by which the eyelid is softened.
E aprop fen am le spatum sobre las doas linhas las quals has senhadas, e comensa del lacrimal major entro al lacrimal menor.	And then bring the spatula over the two lines which you have drawn, and begin from the lacrimal major into the lacrimal minor.
E si’ la tua fissura prop dels pels naturals ayssi cum es la grossetut del rey.	And if your fissure is near the natural hairs as is the thickness of the king.
E aprop met le onci en un dels dos angles de la codena, e aprop excoria aquela tota, e aprop ajusta am la scitura las doas labias am gula o fiel de lana subtil, e abstergeys le sanc, e fay adherir aquo que superflueys dels fiels sobre dos sobrecils am alcunas causas enviscans, si voles far aquo, e sino, non cures.	And then place the ounce in one of the two angles of the code, and then exfoliate the whole, and then adjust with the scitur the two lips with a thread or a fine wool thread, and wipe away the blood, and make adhere what is superfluous from the threads on the two eyebrows with some viscous causes, if you want to do this, and if not, do not care.
E aprop leyssa la sutura dels fiels entro a tres dias o quatre, e aprop cura aquo.	And then remove the suture of the threads within three days or four, and then take care of it.
E si vols, layssa la plagua ses sutura, e cura aquela am aquo que exsicca e constrenh, quar la palpebra es alevada deves la sigillacio de la plagua e la agreguacio de lu; mays sutura es milor E donc aysso diysso les antics de taxanir.	And if you want, leave the plague its suture, and take care of it with what dries and constricts, because the eyelid is elevated, it needs the sealing of the plague and the aggregation of it; but suture is better, and therefore I say so as the ancients did to taxanir.
Mays empero en lu sia sollicitut sobre le malaute, e es de bona operacio, e no es en lu temor.	But however, there is solicitude over the patient, and it is of good operation, and there is no fear in it.
E es autra manieyra en taxmir, e es que senhes sobre la palpebra figura ayssi cum fuelha de mirt, e aprop eleva la palpebra am tres uncis segreguatz e congreguatz segon aquesta forma:	And it is another manner in taxmir, and it is that the figure on the eyelid is like a myrtle leaf, and then elevate the eyelid with three unci segregated and congregated according to this form:
Mays si no es possible aquo, tener les uncis, e aquo no es engualhat, lahoras pren una agula en la qual haia fil e met aquela en le mieg de la figura, e entromet le autre fiel prop le lacrimal major, e·l fiel segon prop le lacrimal mendre, e ajusta entre les tieus ditz les fiels am equalitat, e aprop am aquels eleva la tua ma am elevacio engual, eleva tota la codena sobre la qual es senhat ayssi cum havem recomtat.	But if it is not possible, have the unci, and that is not equal, then take a needle in which there is a thread and put it in the middle of the figure, and introduce the other thread near the lacrimal major, and the other thread near the lacrimal minor, and adjust between the two said threads with equality, and then with those elevate your hand with equal elevation, elevate the whole code on which it is drawn as we have recounted.
E aprop ajusta las doas labias de la plagua am sutura, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And then adjust the two lips of the plague with suture, and take care of it until it is healed.
Mays si accideys apostema deves la tua inscizio o la tua fissura, seda aquel apostema am cerot e a lu semblantz, e am enguentz.	But if an abscess happens from your incision or your fissure,  dress that abscess with cerot and to its semblance, and with enguentz.
E alcunas veguadas endeve a la palpebra que·ls sieus pels sian convertitz, adonc cove que tu uses en aquela de aquo que havem dit de inscizio; mays sutura en quascus es mays artificial.	And some times it happens that the eyelid's hairs are converted, therefore it is necessary that you use in that of what we have said of incision; but suture in some is more artificial.
Ataxinir am cannas es segon aquesta forma:	To taxinir with canes is according to this form:
e es que tu convertas la palpebra e scindas la figura qu’es dedintz segon que he recontat; e aprop per art fay doas cannas o doas astelas subtils de las quals longitut sia segon la longitut de la palpebra e la latitut de lor sia mendra de la latitut del spatum.	And it is that you convert the eyelid and split the figure which is dedintz according to what I have recounted; and then by art make two canes or two subtle astelas of which length is according to the length of the eyelid and the width of them is less than the width of the spatula.
E tu ja has inscidit en las extremitatz de quascunas partidas, la on tenes les fils.	And you have already incised at the extremities of each part, where you have the threads.
Aprop agregua quascuna am subtilitat subre aquo que superflueys de la palpebra del huel, e constres las cannas de quascunas partidas am fort strictura, e layssa aquela per alcus jorns, quar la codena per la strictura morira e sira denegada e se poyrira entro que per si meteyssa cayra.	And then add each with subtlety over what is superfluous from the eyelid of the heel, and constrict the canes of each part with a strong constriction, and leave it for some days, because the code by the constriction will die and become denied and will be able to enter while by itself it will fall.
Mays si es tardat, lahoras trenca la am las toroyras, e aprop cura la plagua entro que sia sanat.	But if it is late, then break it with the toroyras, and then take care of the plague until it is healed.
Donc cum es solidada, la palpebra es elevada e les pels no pungo.	Therefore, as it is solidified, the eyelid is elevated and the hairs do not sting.
E aquesta es la forma de doas cannas las quals faras segon aquesta forma:	And this is the form of two canes which you will make according to this form:
e haia la quantitat de la longitut e de la latitut ni mays ni mens.	And have the quantity of the length and width neither more nor less.
Capitol .xii.	Chapter .xii.
De elevacio de pels pungentz en le huel am agula quan le pel es dur.	Of elevation of stinging hairs in the heel with a needle when the hair is hard.
Quan son pels no-naturals, durs e aspres e pungentz les huels, lahoras la operacio en lu es que tu prenguas agula subtil e pauses en aquela fiel de ceda subtil e leon, e aprop que tu ajustes las extremitatz de lu e nozes quascu en manieyra mot subtil.	When the hairs are unnatural, hard and rough and stinging the heels, then the operation in it is that you take a subtle needle and place in it a thread of fine cedar and lion, and then that you adjust the extremities of it and nuts in a way very subtle.
E sia la longitut dels fiels de quantitat de una palma.	And let the length of the threads be the quantity of a palm.
E aprop tu compon2 autre fiel subtil dejos lu en breu, e nuza las extremitatz de aquel si tu·t vols.	And then you compose another subtle thread below it in short, and use the extremities of that if you want.
E aprop pause le malaute le sieu cap en le tieu se, e sia prop del solelh per que la tua obra sia declarada, quar es operacio subtil e menuda.	And then place the patient his head in your lap, and be near the sun so that your work be declared, because it is a subtle and delicate operation.
E aprop intromet la agulha en la razit del pel ajustat la qual ha necessitat de engen, e fay aquela penetrar en la palpebra festinantment entro que extraguas aquela desus le pel natural.	And then introduce the needle into the root of the hair adjusted the one which has needed of engen, and make it penetrate into the eyelid carefully until you extract that out of the natural hair.
E aprop tire le pel entro desus e intromet aquel en alixati, e sian les pels un o dos o tres e no mays.	And then pull the hair out and introduce it into alixati, and let the hairs be one or two or three and no more.
E aprop tira la tua ma am aquel entro que·l pel sia fora-gitat am alixolati en la palpebra am le pel natural.	And then pull your hand with that until the hair is removed with alixolati in the eyelid with the natural hair.
Mays si es atirat alixalati e non es gitat le pel, atiraras alixati a las partidas dejos am le fiel le qual tu has compost am aquela, entro qu’en sia gitat alixalati del trau sobira.	But if it is thrown alixalati and the hair is not removed, you will throw alixati to the parts below with the thread which you have composed with that, until in it be thrown alixalati from the top.
E vegas aquela am la visio del huel, quar lahoras tu gitaras alixati e lo fiel, e grotan quascu e clautz le huel, e laysse le claus per dos dias o tres, entro que·l pel adheresca al sieu loc e nasque sobre aquel bona carn.	And see that with the vision of the heel, because then you will throw alixati and the thread, and grotan some and close the heel, and leave the clauses for two days or three, until the hair adheres to its place and is born over that good flesh.
E si es mays breu le pel, lahoras tu ajusta un pel lonc dels pels naturals, e es elevat am aquel, o que·l leysses entro que sia alonguat aprop alcu spazi, e lehoras tu eleva aquel.	And if the skin is too short, then you adjust a longer skin from the natural hairs, and it is elevated with that, or that you let it enter until it is lengthened in a certain space, and then you elevate that.
Capitol .xiii.	Chapter .xiii.
De la cura de ehacratir la qual ve en la palpebra desus.	Of the cure of the cataract which occurs in the upper eyelid.
Quan ve en le huel ehacratir, e es contraccio de la palpebra quan es contrayta en sus, o a dextra o a sinistra partida, per mala consolidacio de plagua o de seccio o de cauteri, e es apelada leporina, e aquesta ahercrati o es natural o accidental, e es fayta per consolidacio de plagua o de seccios o de cauteri, o per semblantz a lor malcuratz.	When it occurs in the eye and is a contraction of the eyelid when it is contracted upwards, or to the right or to the left part, due to bad consolidation of a plaque or of a cautery, and it is called leporina, and this cataract is either natural or accidental, and it is made by the consolidation of a plaque or of cauteries, or by things similar to their malcuratz.
May la manieyra de la operacio en lu es que tu fendas aquela consolidacio e que separes las labias de lu, e pauses en lu en aquo que es entre aquelas una meca de drap de li, e ligues aquelas entro que sian sanadas.	The way of the operation in it is that you break that consolidation and that you separate the lips of it, and put in it in that which is between those a piece of cloth, and tie those together until they are healed.
E no cove que tu uses de curacio de lu de las causas las quals exsiccan, constrenho; quar si tu fas aquo retorna alixacratir pus mal que nulh temps no foc habantz.	And no cover that you use of cure of it from the causes which dry it, constrict; because if you do that it returns cataract worse than any time you have not had.
Usa en aquela de causas que mollifico ayssi cum es fenugrec, e embroca am la aygua en la qual son coytz altea e semensa de li, o enguent dyaquilon, le qual sia liquefayt am alcu dels olis, e submergeys en aquel la meca, e cura am aquel.	Use in that of causes that soften it as is fenugreek, and embroca with the water in which they are cooked the root and seeds of it, or a decoction of dyquilon, which is liquefied with some of the oils, and submerge the cloth in that, and cure with that.
E lo tesaur de la tua curacio es que tu perforsses am tot engen que no sia consolidat segon la forma que foc al comensament.	And the treasure of your cure is that you perforate with all engine that is not consolidated according to the form that you had at the beginning.
E aquesta operacio la qual havem dita, no es sino alcuna rectificacio de ehalixacrati que no retorna la forma del loc segon que foc denant.	And this operation which we have said, is not but any rectification of cataract that does not return the form of the place according to what you had before.
Capitol .xiiii.	Chapter .xiv.
De la cura de ehacrati le qual es fayt en la palpebra dejos.	Of the cure of cataract which is made in the lower eyelid.
Aquesta alxacrati la qual es fayta en la palpebra dejos, la qual es nompnada vertadierament alxacrati; e es de lu alcuna natural, autra accidental.	This cataract which is made in the lower eyelid, which is truly named cataract; and it is of it some natural, other accidental.
Mays accidental es fayta per plagua o per scissura o per cauteri o per autres semblantz.	More accidental is made by plaque or by scissura or by cautery or by other things similar.
E la via de la operacio de lu es que tu prenguas una agula en la qual haga fil doble, e fiques aquela en la carn, e que la fassas passar del lacrimal de senestre entro al lacrimal dextre, entro que·l fil pervengua en las doas extremitatz de la carn.	And the way of the operation of it is that you take a needle in which make double thread, and fix that in the flesh, and that you make it pass from the lacrimal of the left into the lacrimal right, until the thread reaches the two extremities of the flesh.
E aprop exten la carn a las partidas desus am la agula e cus aquela am la agula, e inscideys am spatum ample.	And then extend the flesh to the parts above with the needle and stitch that with the needle, and incise with a wide spatula.
E donc si retorne la figura de la palpebre segon que cove, bo es; e sino, pren le ray e pausa aquel en la figura fenduda, e am aquel converteys la palpebra, e fen las doas fissuras en le latz de la palpebra dejos.	And therefore if it returns the figure of the eyelid according to what cover, good is; and if not, take the ray and put that in the figure broken, and with that convert the eyelid, and make the two fissures in the side of the lower eyelid.
E sian las extremitatz de las doas fissuras de dos angles de la inscizio, la qual has fayta entro que concurren, e sia de lor fayt angle entro que quan se congreguan sia fayta figura de lor.	And be the extremities of the two fissures of two angles of the incision, which you have made until they meet, and be of their made angle until when they meet be made figure of them.
E aquesta figura es letra greca: la landa.	And this figure is Greek letter: the lambda.
E aprop osta la carn aquela per la quantitat que es le latz de lu agut dejos de lu, aquo que siec la palpebra.	And then place the flesh that for the quantity that is the edge of it sharp below of it, that which  seals the eyelid.
E aprop ajusta las partz seperadas e cos aquelas am le fil de lana; e aprop cura aquelas am aquo que havem dit de las medicinas mollificativas e de las calguas entro que sia sanat.	And then adjust the separated parts and stitch those with the wool thread; and then cure those with what we have said of the softening medicines and of the poultices until it is healed.
E si alxacrati endeve per fissura o sutura o cauteri, lahoras cove que tu fendas am fissura plana sobre les pels de la palpebra segon que es precedit.	And if cataract arises from fissure or suture or cautery, then cover that you make with a flat fissure over the hairs of the eyelid according to what is preceded.
E aprop separa am la calgua entre doas labias segon que havem dit.	And then separate with the poultice between two lips according to what we have said.
En la suma del sermo de la cura de alxacrati quan es desus o dejos, que corra en lu operacio, segon que es preparat de la forma de alxacrati, e aquela es en forma de motas diversitatz.	In the sum of the sermon of the cure of cataract when it is above or below, that run in it operation, according to what is prepared of the form of cataract, and that is in form of motas diversity.
E le artifexs savi totz temps prepara engen en quascuna manieyra la qual es possibla a lu entro que fassa retornar la figura a la forma natural, o prop de aquela, e aquel malaute segon que a lu conveneys de la operacio e dels strumentz en las majors disposicios.	And the artificers wise all times prepare engine in any manner which is possible to it until it makes return the figure to the natural form, or near that, and that patient according to what it convenes of the operation and of the instruments in the major dispositions.
Capitol .xv.	Chapter .xv.
De la adherencia de la palpebra am la conjunctiva o am la cornea.	Of the adhesion of the eyelid to the conjunctiva or to the cornea.
Quan accideys aquesta consolidacio a motz homes enayssi que sia solidada la palpebra pus desus am le album del huel, e sia prohibida de la facilitat del movement e de las suas obras naturals, donc cove que tu entrometas la extramitat del ray dejos la palpebra, e eleva en sus aquela, o exten aquela am le unci.	When this consolidation happens to many men in such a way that the eyelid is more above with the album of the eye, and is prohibited of the facility of movement and of its natural works, therefore cover that you enter the extremity of the ray below the eyelid, and elevate that upwards, or extend that with the unci.
E aprop tu inscideys la adherencia am spatum subtil, le qual no sia am acuitat de las inscisios, habantz obtus un petit per so que·l malaute no sia inquietat deves la operacio, e remau le spatum que no ledesca le huel am la sua acuitat.	And then you incise the adhesion with a subtle spatula, which not be with the sharpness of the incisions, have obtuse a little for so that the patient is not troubled during the operation, and remove the spatula that it does not damage the eye with its sharpness.
E sia la tua inscizio quays excorjan aquela adherencia am facilitat entro que sia retornada la palpebra segon la sua forma natural e que sia sanada tota la adherencia.	And be your incision which excoriate that adhesion with facility until it is returned the eyelid according to its natural form and that it is healed all the adhesion.
E aprop tu met en le huel aygua salada am la qual tu laves; o distilla en lu de zunia dissolvut en l’aygua.	And then you put in the eye salt water with which you wash it; or distill in it of zunia dissolved in the water.
E aprop separa entre la palpebra e l’huel am calgua de li, e pausa sobre le huel lana infuza en album de huou, e aprop le tertz jorn usa de causas consolidativas entro que sia sanat.	And then separate between the eyelid and the eye with poultice of it, and put over the eye wool infused in album of egg, and then the third day use of consolidative causes until it is healed.
Capitol .xvi.	Chapter XVI.
De inscizio de ungla e de eminencia de carn dels lacrimals.	Of the incision of the nail and the prominence of flesh of the tear ducts.
Sapias que ungla es segon dos manieyras, quar o es nervosa, e es semblant a ciphac dur subtil; o es no-nervosa, semblant a humiditat blanca congilada, la qual quan ferr la toca, o es forsat aquela prendre am onci, es abscindida e le onci no es ficat en lu.	Know that the nail is of two kinds, either it is nervous, and it is like a hard, fine, chip; or it is non-nervous, like white, congealed moisture, which when you touch it, or it is forced to take on an incision, it is cut off and the incision is not put into it.
E amdos las specias no comensan sino del lacrimal major entro que va petit a petit que cobre la vista e prohibeys le lum e·l movement de huel.	And both kinds do not begin until the larger tear duct, which goes little by little that it covers the sight and prohibits the light and the movement of the eye.
Mays la manieyra del obrar en la inscizio de lu es que·l malaute pause le sieu cap en le tieu se, e aprop obre les huels de lu, e eleva la palpebra am la tua ma, e aprop colligeys la ungla am onci de pauca duplicacio e exten aquela a las partidas desus.	But the manner of working in the incision of it is that the patient puts their head in the low position, and then opens their eyes, and elevates the eyelid with your hand, and then collect the nail with an incision of little duplication and extend that to the upper parts.
E aprop pren una agula e entromet en aquela un pel de cavalh o de buou o de vaqua, o de semblantz, o de fiel fort, o duplica la extremitat de la agulha petit a petit e fica aquela en le mieg de la ungla, e penetra aquela am la agulha, e lia am fiel la ungla; e exten aquela a las partidas desus, e excorja am le pel le latz de la ungla lo qual siec la pupilla.	And then take a needle and introduce into it a little bit of horse, or cow, or boar, or something similar, or a strong thread, or duplicate the tip of the needle little by little and place it in the middle of the nail, and penetrate it with the needle, and tie the nail with thread; and extend that to the upper parts, and scrape with the thread the side of the nail which lies near the pupil.
E ayssi tu sieguas aquela am le pel entro al derier de lu.	And thus you follow that with the thread, entering it at the back of it.
E aprop tu inscideys le romanent en la razitz del lacrimal am spatum subtil o am petitas forfexs, e leysa la carn del lacrimal natural per so que per inscizio de aquela no endevengua fluxs de lagremas continuabla.	And then you incise the remaining part in the root of the tear duct with a subtle spatula or with small scissors, and leave the flesh of the tear duct natural so that by incision of it, there does not become continuous flow of tears.
E alscunas vetz la ungla am le sol onci estenduda o am fiel, ayssi co havem dit, e aprop sia excurjat am spatum leon del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And sometimes the nail, with the sole incision extended or tied, as we have said, and then it is scraped with a spatula lion of which this is the form of it:
E guarda te que am le spatum no toques la tunica cornea e que avengua en lu ruptura, e que la pupilla sia perforada.	And guard yourself that with the spatula you do not touch the cornea and that there comes a rupture in it, and that the pupil is perforated.
Aprop la inscizio geta en le huel un pauc de sal trissa o di cief fayt de siniar, e leyssa aquel entro al autre dia; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que cove entro que sia sanat.	Then the incision is put in the eye a little bit of salt or a bit of chief made of sulfur, and it is left there until the next day; and then cure it with water that covers it until it is healed.
E si la ungla no es nervoza e no podes metre la agulha, ni es ficada en aquela le onci, lahoras motas veguadas aquesta specia de ungla es curada am medicinas, e es sanada ayssi cum yeu e recomtat en la divisio.	And if the nail is not nervous and you cannot put the needle, nor is it put into it the incision, then many times this kind of nail is cured with medicines, and it is healed thus as I and recount in the division.
E si tu vols inscindir aquela, lahoras tu obre le huel del malaute e pren spatum subtil leon de freul acuitat segon aquesta forma:	And if you want to incise it, then you open the eye of the patient and take a subtle lion spatula of sharp steel according to this form:
am subtilitat.	with subtlety.
E si vezes que aquela es rarificada e es confugida e empren en aquela razit, lahoras distilla de la tua ora en le huel de cief fayt de siniar o am cief rog o am sal trissat, e opila le huel entro a l’autre dia.	And if you see that it is rarified and confused and put into that root, then distill from your own hour into the eye of chief made of sulfur or with chief rog or with salt trissat, and close the eye until the next day.
E aprop itera sobre aquela la operacio entro que sia remaugut tot aquo que es de lu, sino que·l contrari apostema caut sia en le huel, quar lahoras tu leyssa aquela, e cura al comensament la apostema entro que sia sanat.	And then repeat over that the operation until it is removed all that is of it, otherwise that the contrary abscess comes to be in the eye, for then you leave it, and cure at the beginning the abscess until it is healed.
E aprop itera la tua operacio sobre aquela am razo entro que sia sanat.	And then repeat your operation over it with reason until it is healed.
La emenencia de la carn lacrimal, si notz en le huel per gran nocument, sia suspendut am onci; e inscideys aquela de aquela una partida, e no ultimes la inscizio per so que no inscidesqua fluxs de lagremas.	The prominence of the lacrimal flesh, if noticed in the eye for great harm, be suspended with thread; and incise it from that one part, and do not finish the incision so that it does not incise the flow of tears.
E aprop distilla en le lacrimal cief rog e fayt de siniar entro que sia sanat.	And then distill into the lacrimal chief rog and made of sulfur until it is healed.
Capitol .xvii.	Chapter XVII.
De inscizio de alguazardenic e de aquo que es nascut de carn ajustada en le huel.	Of the incision of the alguezardeinic and of the water that is born of flesh adjusted in the eye.
Alcunas veguadas en les huels de alcus es nascuda carn roga, e es sobre-pausada entro que cobre la pupilla, o apropinqua o estrenh sobre las palpebras e fort leu comprem las palpebras a las partidas deforo e es assemblada a roza de balaustra.	Sometimes in the eyes of some, flesh red is born, and it is over-laid so that it covers the pupil, or it approaches or stretches over the eyelids and very much compresses the eyelids at the sides and is assembled to a rose of balustrade.
Mays la operacio en lu es que·l malaute pausa le sieu cap en le tieu se; e aprop obre les huels de aquel e colligeys tota aquela carn am oncis convenientz ad aquo, e te aquo am una forcep o am cesti; e aprop inscindiys la carn el comensament entro que tot sia finit am le encisori, e guarda te del huel que no ledescas aquel deves la tua operacio.	But the operation in it is that the patient puts their head in the low position; and then opens the eyes of that one and collect all that flesh with convenient threads for water, and take water with a forceps or with a basket; and then incise the flesh at the beginning until all is finished with the scissors, and guard yourself of the eye that you do not cut it during the course of your operation.
E sia la tua inscizio am la qual inscides aquelas o am espatum le qual nos havem recomtat en la inscizio de la ungla, o am petitas forfexs am las quals es colligit ascebel segon que vindra la forma de lu aprop aquest capitol.	And let your incision be with which you incise those or with the spatula which we have recounted in the incision of the nail, or with small scissors with which it is collected ascebel according to how it will come the form of it in this chapter.
Donc cum es complida la tua inscizio e es remauguda tota aquela carn, lahoras omple le huel de sal trissa, o destilla en lu polvera roga e semblantz a lu de las medicinas corrossivas, e pausa sobre le huel deforo coto am album de huou entro que sia asegurat de apostema caut.	Therefore, as is completed your incision and all that flesh is removed, then fill the eye with salt trissat, or distill into it powdered rog and similar to it of the corrosive medicines, and put over the eye outside a cloth with album of egg until it is assured of abscess caut.
E si roman alcuna causa de alguardenici e es senhoragat sanc caut, e temes apostema caut, lahoras leyssa le huel e cura aquela apostema am aquo que ceda aquela apostema, e aprop itera sobre aquel am operacio entro que sia sanat, e semblantment fay en la carn ajustada la qual accideys en le huel de aquesta especia.	And if there remain any cause of alguardenici and is lordly blood caut, and you fear abscess caut, then leave the eye and cure that abscess with water that yields that abscess, and then repeat over that with operation until it is healed, and similarly do in the flesh adjusted which happens in the eye of this kind.
Mays empero tu cove que alienes tota curacio del huel freul per via natural o per via accidental, obran am ferr, e no metas la tua ma en alcuna de aquestas operacios entro que veges que aquel membre sia suffertant aquela operacio.	But however you cover that all cure of the eye frail by natural or accidental way, operate with iron, and do not put your hand in any of these operations until you see that that member is suffering that operation.
Capitol .xviii.	Chapter XVIII.
De colleccio de sabel en le huel.	Of the collection of pus in the groin.
Sabel so venas rogas las quals son testudas sobre le huel e prohibeysso al vesement la sua operacio, e develican le huel am longitut de dias.	Pus veins are seen which are situated on the groin and prohibited by the garment its operation, and the groin is lengthened over days.
Donc necessari es al comensament que tu consideres si le huel en le qual es sabel es fort e en lu no es autra malautia que sabel, lahoras tu colligeys aquel sabel.	Therefore it is necessary at the beginning that you consider if the groin in which is pus is strong and in it there is no other ailment than pus, then you collect that pus.
E es que tu comandes al malaute que pause le sieu cap en le tieu se, e aprop suspen aquelas venas am un onci o am dos segon la tua prudencia; e sia aquel onci de subtil duplicacio segon aquesta forma:	And it is that you command the patient to place his head in your lap, and then suspend those veins with a bandage or two according to your prudence; and let that bandage of subtle duplication according to this form:
o so dos oncis gradantment en un cos segon aquesta forma:	or two bandages gradually in one body according to this form:
E aprop sian colligidas aquelas venas am forses subtils, am subtilitat, e abstergeys le sanc hora aprop hora, entro que vegas aquelas venas esser remaugudas del huel e sian revolgudas.	And then they are collected those veins with subtle forces, with subtlety, and remove the blood hour by hour, while those veins are being pulled away from the groin and are being rolled up.
E guarda te que tu no ledes le huel am las extremitatz del spatum; e si’ la tua operacio en le miegjorn denant le solelh, e sias mot ferm en la tua operacio que no inscidas sino aquelas venas.	And guard yourself that you do not lead the groin with the extremities of the spatula; and if your operation in the best part before the sun, and be firm in your operation that you do not injure but those veins.
E quan tu auras complitz, lahoras tu distilla en le huel cief vert o rog per que am sa acuitat corrodesca aquo que es remaugut del sabel.	And when you will have finished, then you distill in the groin chief green or red for that with its sharpness corrodes that which is pulled out of the pus.
Mays si aquo no es a tu possible colligeys tot en aquela hora, e lahoras tu emplastra tot am aquo que cede la dolor de lu, e leyssa lu per alcus dias entro que sia sedada la dolor de lu e que sia asegurat de apostema caut.	But if that is not possible for you, collect everything in that hour, then you plaster everything with that which gives relief from the pain, and leave it for some days until the pain is subsided and that it is assured of a cauterized abscess.
E aprop itera sobre lu segon que la mateyssa manieyra entro que sia sanat.	And then repeat over it according to the same manner until it is healed.
E aquesta es la forma de las forfexs:	And this is the form of the shears:
Capitol .xix.	Chapter XIX.
De reduccio de arizati al nas.	Of the reduction of arizati to the nose.
Quan tu curas arisati am cauteri o am medicina aguda comburent segon que es precedida la narracio de lu e no es sanat, lahoras no es engen en lu sino que fendas sobre le apostema deves la maturitat de lu, e que extraguas tota la humiditat la qual es en lu e·l poyre entro que sia descubert le os.	When you cure arisati with cautery or with sharp medicine according to what is preceded the narrative of it and it is not healed, then it is not generated in it but that you make on the abscess you remove the maturity of it, and that you extract all the humidity which is in it and the power while it is uncovered the bone.
E donc cum es descubert le os e vezes en lu corrupcio o negror, lahoras tu ratz lu am un sturment del qual aquesta es la forma:	And therefore when it is uncovered the bone and times in it corruption or blackness, then you root it with a instrument of which this is the form:
E es nompnat de aspre cap, e sia feyt de fer indi, e sia le cap redon ayssi cum asir le qual sia fayt punctat per punctacio de lima o aliskalfati per punctacio subtil (ayssi cum es en la forma seguent).	And it is called aspre cap, and it is made of iron, and it is the head rounded as if it were to grip the one which is made pointed by the point of a file or by the point of a rasp subtly (as it is in the following form).
E pausa aquel sobre le loc corrumput del os, e aprop revolveys aquel entre les tieus ditz, e prem la tua ma petit a petit entro que sapias que aquela corropcio es rasa.	And place that over the corrupted place of the bone, and then roll that between your fingers, and press your hand little by little until you know that that corruption is scraped.
E aquo sia fayt alcunas veguadas, e aprop restaura le loc am causas exsiccativas e stipticas.	And that is done several times, and then restore the place with drying and astringent causes.
Donc si·l loc es consolidat e es en lu nascuda bona carn e es abscindit le cors de la sania e roman per xl dias, e no es renovat e no es apostemat e no accideys en lu accident, lahoras tu sapias que es sanat.	Therefore if the place is consolidated and there is born good flesh in it and the body of the wound is separated and remains for 40 days, and it is not renewed and it is not abscesses and you do not happen in it accident, then you know that it is healed.
E sino, lahoras no es en lu engen sino reduzir la fissura a la forma del nas, e segon aquesta manieyra: e es que tu descuebras de segon os am ferr o am medicina acuta, e cum sira descubert le os, lahoras tu pren tribo segon aquesta forma:	And if not, then there is not in it generated but to reduce the fissure to the form of the nose, and in this manner: and it is that you uncover the second bone with iron or with sharp medicine, and when it is uncovered the bone, then you take tribo according to this form:
Sia la extramitat de lu ferr triangulada, e·l fust de lu sia prim extenuat entro a la extremitat ayssi cum vezes assi.	Let the extremity of it be triangular, and the shaft of it be prim extended to the extremity as if it were so.
E aprop pausa aquel sobre le os, e sia aquel prop del lacrimal; e alongua la tua ma un pauc del huel, e aprop revol la tua ma am le tribo entro que penetre tot le os, e aquel sente le malaute per asso que atroba vent yssir per so quan te la sua ma.	And then place that on the bone, and let it be near the lacrimal; and extend your hand a little from the groin, and then roll your hand with the tribo until it penetrates all the bone, and that feels the patient as soon as it finds air coming out of it when your hand.
Donc lahoras restaura le loc am medicinas stipticas exsiccantz ayssi cum t’e eyssenhat.	Therefore then restore the place with astringent and drying medicines as you have been taught.
Donc cum nays la carn e·l loc es endurazit, lahoras la materia la qual effundia a las partidas deforo retorna al nas, donc aquo es pus leugier sobre le malaute.	Therefore as the flesh and the place are hardened, then the matter which flowed to the foreparts returns to the nose, therefore that is pus lighter on the patient.
Capitol .xx.	Chapter XX.
De reduccio de la eminencia del huel.	Of the reduction of the prominence of the groin.
Quan le huel emineys am la sua totalitat e no accideys en le vezement nocument ni diminuacio, lahoras cove que laxas le malaute, e aprop que·l segues, e aprop que pausas ventozas en le cervitz ses scarificacio e succa per bona succaccio; e aprop pausa sobre le huel liniment le qual sia fayt de acatra e aloe e enses e sarcocolla, e aprop strenh le emplaustre sobre le huel am motz polvils.	When the groin prominences with its totality and does not happen in the garment harm or diminution, then cove that relaxes the patient, and then that you follow it, and then that you place windy scarifications in the neck its suction and good suction; and then place on the groin liniment which is made of aethel and aloe and incense and sarcocolla, and then strengthen the plaster on the groin with motz powders.
E la manieyra dels polvils es que prenguas draps de li leons motz, e quascun drap sia duplicat en quatre plecs; e fay de aquels motz.	And the manner of the powders is that you take cloths of lion's motz, and each cloth be duplicated in four folds; and make of those motz.
E aprop pausa aquels la un sobre le autre segon la quantitat de la qual ha le huel necessitat.	And then place those one upon the other according to the quantity of which the groin has need.
E aprop strenh sobre aquels am drap dur am fort strictura; e itera las ventosas am succio ses scarificacio; e aprop osta las ventosas e leyssa le huel streyt le dia e la nueyt.	And then strengthen upon those with hard cloth with strong structure; and iterate the ventosas with suction its scarification; and then remove the ventosas and leave the groin straight the day and the night.
Mays si entretant le liguament es mollificat, lahoras cove que sia mot streyt.	But if meanwhile the ligament is softened, then cove that it be mot streyt.
E aprop osta le liament aprop le dia e la nueyt ayssi cum havem dit.	And then remove the ligament aprop the day and the night as we have said.
E si vezes le huel ja esser redusit, bo es, e sino, lahoras itera le emplastre am les polvils e la strictura e las ventosas entro que sia sanat.	And if you see the hernia already be reduced, it is good, and if not, then repeat the plaster with the powders and the stricture and the leeches until it is healed.
Capitol .xxi.	Chapter XXI.
De la inscizio de la eminencia de la tunica uvea.	Of the incision of the eminence of the tunic uvea.
Quan endeve disrupcio en la tunica uvea, e aprop es eminent e procezeys fora las palpebras ayssi cum un gra de rasim, e es orrazada la forma de home per aquo, e vols aquo inscidir, lahoras la operacio en lu es ayssi cum havem recomtat, que tu entrometas la agula en la razitz de la uvea de la partida dejos en la partida desus, e aprop met la agula autra en la qual sia fil doble de la part del lacrimal, e fay aquela penetrar e leyssa la primieyra agula segon la sua disposicio; e aprop inscideys le loc del fiel doble e leva am aquel la partida de la uvea en le circuit de la agula, e strenh aquela mot.	When there is a disruption in the tunic uvea, and it is prominent and proceeds outside the eyelids like a grain of rasim, and the shape of a man is formed by it, and you want to cut into it, then the operation in it is as we have recounted, that you introduce the needle into the root of the uvea from the side below to the side above, and then put the other needle, which has a double thread, from the lacrimal side, and make it penetrate and leave the first needle according to its position; and then cut the place of the double thread and lift with it the part of the uvea in the circuit of the needle, and tighten that knot.
E aprop extratz la agula e pausa sobre le huel lana infusa en album de huou e leyssa entro que cayha le fil am la uva.	And then extract the needle and place it on the wool soaked in egg white and leave it until the thread falls into the uvea.
E aprop cura le huel am aquo que conforte aquel entro que la plagua sia sanada.	And then cure the wound with water that comforts it until the plague is healed.
E alcunas veguadas aduna de tota partida am cercle de drap entro le huel ajuste eminencia gran, e aprop sia perforat am le spatum subtil que vengua al preon del huel, e corra la humiditat albuginea, e descen le huel e intra tantost.	And sometimes, gather a whole piece with a circle of cloth around the wound, adjust the prominent eminence, and then pierce it with a fine spatula that comes to the root of the wound, and let the albuminous humidity run, and lower the wound and enter quickly.
E aprop strenh entro que sia sanat.	And then tighten until it is healed.
Capitol .xxii.	Chapter XXII.
De curacio de alconati.	Of the cure of alconati.
Aquesta malautia que es apelada alconati no es sino sania la qual es ajustada en le huel semblant a aygua dessendent e no es aquela.	This illness that is called alconati is nothing but a swelling which is adjusted in the wound resembling a descending water and it is not that.
Mays la manieyra del obrar en ela es que fasses le malaute sezer sobre la sela aparelada e dreyta, e aprop pren le cap sieu en las tuas mas de doas partz e mau aquel entro que veias la sania pervenir a las partidas dejos, e aprop sia siccada e no descenda, e sia ostat le lum, e·l malaute veia las causas ayssi cum vezia.
