E la manieyra del eyssiment de la urina per aquel es que prenguas le fiel doblat e lies en la extramitat de lu lana o coto per bona liadura; e entrometas las extramitatz del fiel en la partida dejos de la ciringua, e inscideys am las forfexs si superflueys alcuna causa de la lana, mays intromet la en la canula am vehemencia E aprop enongeys la ciringua am boder e am album de huou.	And the manner of the emission of urine by this is that you take the faithful double knot and tie it in the middle of it wool or cloth for good ligation; and insert the extremities of the knot in the part below the syringe, and cut with the forceps if any cause of the wool is superfluous, but introduce it into the tube with vehemence and then tighten the syringe with border and with album of cow.
E fay cezer le malaute sobre la selha, e embroca la vesiqua de lu e la vergua am olis umitz, e oli de oliva e ayguaros.	And make the patient lie on their side, and rub the bladder of him and the vagina with humid oils, and olive oil and water.
E aprop entromet la ciringua am facilitat entro que pervengua a la razit de la vergua; e aprop dobla la vergua desus a la partida del embelic; e aprop empelleys la ciringua dintz aquela; e aprop empelleys aquela entro que pervengua a la vesica, e aquela centa le malaute esser pervenguda a la causa vuoda, e no es fayt asso segon aquest orde, sino le meat en le qual va a tortuositat.	And then insert the syringe with facility until it reaches the root of the vagina; and then double the vagina above at the part of the navel; and then push the syringe into that; and then push it until it reaches the bladder, and that the patient be brought to the desired cause, and it is not done according to this order, but the meat in which it goes to tortuosity.
E aprop exten le fiel am la lana petit a petit, quar la urina siec la lana.	And then extend the knot with the wool little by little, for the urine seeps the wool.
Aprop extratz aquela e fay per curacio urina, e usa ciringua, no cesses fer aquo e usa ciringua entro que sia evacuada la vesica e le malaute atrobe alleviacio.	Then extract that and do for the cure of urine, and use the syringe, do not cease to do water and use the syringe until the bladder is evacuated and the patient recovers relief.
Capitol .lix.	Chapter .lix.
De qualitat de clisterizacio de la vezica am clampcedra e am semblantz instrumentz les quals sian acordants ad aquo.	Of the quality of clysterization of the bladder with clampcedra and with similar instruments which are according to water.
Quan accideys en la vesica ulceracio o apostema, o sanc congilat en aquela, o es coartat poyredura, e vols en aquela destillar ayguas e medicinas, lahoras sia fayt am instrument le qual es apelat clampcedra, e aquesta es la forma de lu:	When there occurs in the bladder ulceration or abscess, or congealed blood in that, or it is constricted by a tumor, and you want in that to distill waters and medicines, then it is done with an instrument called a clampcedra, and this is the form of it:
sino que en la extramitat de lu es sorda, so es clausa.	...but in the extremity of it is closed, so it is closed.
Et en aquela so tres traucs: dos de la una partida , ayssi quo vezes.	And in that there are three straps: two on one side, so many times.
En le comensament es loc concau, en le qual es aquo que es enpellit, e sia segon quantitat que oppile aquel, ses addicio, entro que quan alcuna causa es ab aquel tirada de las humiditatz, sia atirada, e quan es expellida, am aquo sia atirada, e quan es expellit lonc, segon que fa clampcedra am la qual es phicat naphta en las batalhas de mar.	At the beginning is the concave place, in which is what is called the navel, and as much as it is filled, it is added, until when any cause is drawn from the humidities, it is drawn, and when it is expelled, it is drawn, and when it is expelled long, according to what is clamped with the which is phicat naphta in the battles of the sea.
Donc cum tu vols prohicir humiditatz en la vesica, entromet la extremitat de clapcedra en la humiditat, e atira am aquel aquo que es empellit a las partidas desus, quar la humiditat es atirada en la conquavitat de clapcedra.	Therefore, as you want to prohibit humidities in the bladder, introduce the extremity of the clamp into the humidity, and draw with that what is expelled to the upper parts, so that the humidity is drawn into the concavity of the clamp.
E aprop entromet la extramitat de clapcedra en la vergua segon que havem recomtat en la ciringua; e aprop empelleys la humiditat am aquo que empelleys, quar aquela humiditat perve a la vesica tantost, e le malaute cent aquela.	And then introduce the extremity of the clamp into the vagina according to what we have recounted in the ciringua; and then expel the humidity with that which you expel, so that that humidity reaches the bladder immediately, and the patient feels that.
Forma del cristeri subtil am le qual la vesica es cristerizada, e es aquela la forma:	Form of the subtle cristeri with which the bladder is sterilized, and it is that form:
E sia fayta de argent o de lato, de la qual le cap pus aut sia semblant a petita pluma, e dejos lu cana dedintz liament.	And it is made of silver or of lat, of which the head is more or less like a small feather, and below it a canal is led into it.
E aprop pren vesica de moto, e pausa en aquela la humiditat que vols cristirizar en la vesica, e aprop lia aquela entre dos am fort liguatura am fiel doble, e escalfa aquela humiditat sobre le foc.	And then take the bladder of the motor, and put in it the humidity that you want to sterilize in the bladder, and then tie that between two with a strong double ligature, and heat that humidity over the fire.
E aprop entromet la extremitat del cristeri en la vergua.	And then introduce the extremity of the cristeri into the vagina.
E aprop estrenh la tua ma sobre la vesica am la humiditat am strectura descent entro que·l malaute centa que aquela humiditat ja es pervenguda a la vesica.	And then tighten your hand over the bladder with the humidity with the structure descending until the patient feels that that humidity has already reached the bladder.
Mays si a tu no es present vesica, lahoras tu pren una pessa de parguames e fay de aquel cercle; e perfora aquel de tota la sua retonditat; e aprop entromet fiel fort en aquels traucs, ayssi quo so revolgut; e aprop agregua le cercle ayssi quo es agreguat alsofatur, pus que tu pausas en aquel aquo que tu vols de las humiditatz, e olis e ayguas.	But if you do not have a bladder, then you take a piece of parchment and make a circle of it; and pierce that of all its roundness; and then introduce a strong thread into those holes, so that it is rolled; and then add the circle so that it is attached to the sofatur, because you put in it the water that you want of the humidities, and oils and waters.
E aprop tu lia aquel en le instrument e fay am aquel ayssi cum has fayt am la vesica, e exprescio am la tua ma entro que la humiditat pervengua a la vesica.	And then you tie that to the instrument and do with it as you have done with the bladder, and express with your hand until the humidity reaches the bladder.
Capitol .lx.	Chapter .lx.
De extraccio de peyra.	Of extraction of stone.
Nos ja havem dit en la divisio las specias de peyra e curacio de lu am medicinas, e la diferencia entre peyra engendrada en los ronhos e peyra engendrada en la vesica, e les senhals de aquela.	We have already said in the division the species of stone and cure of it with medicines, and the difference between stone generated in the kidneys and stone generated in the bladder, and the signs of that.
E havem dit la peyra en la qual catz operacio am ma, e seccio.	And we have said the stone in which catz operation with hand, and section.
E la peyra engendrada en la vesica propriament es aquela que es ficada en la vesica.	And the stone generated in the bladder properly is that which is fixed in the bladder.
E yeu so narrant aquel am exposicio manifesta e abreviacio.	And you so narrating that with manifest exposition and abbreviation.
Donc dic que peyra engendrada en la vesica majorment ve als enfantz; e dels senhals de lu es que la urina que es eyssida de la vesica es semblant a aygua en la sua subtilitat, e apar en aquela arena; e le malaute fregua la sua vergua, e motas veguadas pen, e aprop es dressada; e am aquo yeys foro le cul en motz de aquels.	Therefore, I say that stone generated in the bladder mostly comes to children; and of the signs of it is that the urine that is excreted from the bladder is similar to water in its subtlety, and appears in it sand; and the patient feels his vagina, and many times it aches, and then it is straightened; and with that, there is a hole in the anus in many of them.
E es laugiera la sanacio dels enfants de aquela entro que han conseguitz xiiii ans; e es dificil curacio en les viels.	And it is easier the healing of children of those who have reached fourteen years; and it is difficult cure in the old.
Mays en les joves es migiera per aquo quar es entre aquels.	But in the young it is milder for that which is between them.
E de aquel del qual la peyra es major e la curacio es pus leugiera; E si es pauca, es contraria ad aquela.	And of that from which the stone is larger and the cure is easier; And if it is little, it is contrary to that.
Donc cum pervenem a la curacio de aquela, cove al comensament de aquela que mondifiquem le malaute am cristeri le qual extragua tota la fenda la qual es en les sieus budels; quar aquela fenda alcunas veguadas prohibeys la envencio de la peyra deves la inquisicio de lu.	Therefore, as we come to the cure of that, cover at the beginning of that which we modify the patient with the cristeri which extracts all the fissure which is in their bowels; because that fissure sometimes prohibits the entrance of the stone, and the inquiry of it.
E aprop sia pres le malaute am les sieus pes e sia contosit e maugut enjos per so que la peyra descenda al preon de la vesica, o que saute de loc aut alcunas veguadas.	And then be present the patient on his feet and be counted and maugut in a way that the stone descends to the bottom of the bladder, or what jumps from there sometimes.
E aprop fay aquel cezer entre las tuas mas preparat, e las mas de lu sian dejos las coysas de lu, per so que la vesica tota sia fayta declinant a las partidas dejos.	And then do that cezer between your hands prepared, and the hands of it be below the things of it, so that the bladder is entirely made declining to the lower parts.
E aprop perquier aquela e tota aquela deforo.	And then pierce that and all that from there.
Donc si sentes la peyra en l’espazi, lahoras tu te coyta tantost am seccio sobre lu.	Therefore, if you feel the stone in the space, then you take care immediately with section over it.
E si no catz de tot dejos le tieu tocament, lahoras cove que tu untes am oli le tieu dit indic de la ma sinistra, si malaute es enfant, o le dit miga si es jove complit, e entrometas aquel en le sieu cul.	And if you don't catch all of it with your touch, then cover that you anoint with oil your said index of the left hand, if the patient is a child, or the said middle if it is a young complete, and introduce that into their anus.
E perquier de la peyra entro que stia dejos le tieu dit.	And pierce of the stone while it stays below your said.
E converteys aquela petit a petit entro al col de la vesica.	And convert that little by little into the neck of the bladder.
E aprop prem sobre aquel am lo tieu dit, e expelleys aquel a las partidas defora ves le loc del qual vos la seccio.	And then press on that with your said, and expel that to the parts outside ves the place where you made the section.
E comanda al ministra que prema la vesica am la sua ma; e comanda a un autra ministra que am la sua ma dextra extenda les genetius a las partidas desus, e am la sua autra ma remaugua la codena la qual es dejos les genetius, en partida del loc en le qual se fa la seccio.	And command the minister that presses the bladder with his hand; and command another minister that with his right hand extends the genitals to the upper parts, and with his other hand restrains the vagina which is below the genitals, in a part of the place where the section is made.
E aprop entromet espatum be inscident del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And then introduce a spatula well incident of which this is the form of it:
e scindeys en lu aquo que es entre·l cul e·ls genetius, no en le mieg loc, abantz al latz de la coyssa sinistra; e sia la seccio sobre aquela peyra e·l tieu dit sia en le cul, e sia fayta seccio transversa, per que la seccio defora sia ampla e dedintz streyta segon la quantitat que egrecio de la peyra sia a lu possibla, e no major, quar fort leu comprem le tieu dit le qual es en le cul la peyra deves la seccio, e es foro-getada ses defacultat.	And divide in him that which is between the anus and the genitals, not in the middle place, to the left side of the thigh; and let the incision be over that bone and your finger be in the anus, and let the incision be transverse, so that the incision outside be wide and inside narrow according to the quantity that comes out of the bone to him possible, and no more, because very strong compresses your finger which is in the anus the bone must the incision, and is forced-thrown its faculty.
E sapias que de la peyra es alcuna a la qual so angle e margers, per que le eyssiment de lu es fayt deficil per aquo.	And know that of the bone there is some to which its angle and margins are, so that the incision of it is made difficult by this.
E de aquela aquo es leon semblant a glan, e es redonda, e es fayt de lu leugier eyssiment.	And of that which is like a gland, and is round, and is made of it light incision.
Donc si es aquela al qual so angles e marger, ajusta en la fissura.	Therefore if it is that one to which its angles and margins are, adjust in the fissure.
E si no es ayssi foro-getada, lahoras cove que tu engenes sobre aquel, o que strenguas sobre aquel am gesti decentment, la extremitat del qual sia ayssi cum lima am le qual strenguas sobre la peyra, e no evasesca de lu; o que entrometas dejos lu instrument subtil de curvada extremitat.	And if it is not so forced-thrown, then cover that you engage upon that, or that you grasp upon that with a decent gesture, the extremity of which is like a file with which you grasp upon the bone, and do not escape from it; or that you interweave of it a subtle instrument of curved extremity.
Mays si tu no podes sobre aquel, lahoras tu amplifica le trauc un petit, e si tu veus flux de sanc, abscindeys en strenh aquel am vitriol trissat.	But if you cannot upon that, then you amplify the tract a little, and if you see flux of blood, abcise in strength that with vitriol trissat.
Mays si la peyra es mays de una, lahoras al comensament tu impelleys la ma a la boca de la vesica, e aprop inscideys sobre lu; e aprop impelleys un petit aprop aquo; e semblantment fay si son motas mays de doas.	But if the bone is more than one, then at the beginning you impel the hand to the mouth of the bladder, and then you incise upon it; and then you impel a little upon that; and similarly do so if there are more than two.
E si es peyra mot gran, lahoras ignorancia es que tu inscidas aquel am gran seccio, quar accideys al malaute una de doas causas: o que mora o que endevengua a lu destillacio de urina continuabla, per aquo quar le loc no es de tot consolidat.	And if it is a very large bone, then ignorance is that you incise that with a large incision, because you inflict upon the patient one of two causes: either that it dies or that it devours to it the distillation of urine continuous, because of that the place is not of all consolidated.
Mays aministra expulcio de lu entro que sia fora-getada, o engenia en la fractura de lu am las forfexs entro que extragua aquela en pessas.	But administer expulsion of it while it is forced-thrown, or engage in the fracture of it with the forceps until you extract that in pieces.
Donc cum tu auras cumplit la tua opperacio, lahoras omple la plagua de enses de aloe e de sanc de drago, e strenh aquel.	Therefore, as you will have completed your operation, then fill the wound of incenses of aloe and blood of dragon, and strengthen that.
E pausa sobre aquel drap enfus en oli e vi, o en oli rozat e aygua frega, per so que apostema caut sia cedat.	And pause upon that cloth dipped in oil and wine, or in rubbed oil and water, so that abscess caut be ceded.
E aprop resupina le malaute sobre le sieu col, e no deslias le liament entro al tertz dia.	And then turn the patient upon his neck, and do not untie the ligament until the third day.
E cum aquel auras desliat, embroca le loc am aygua e mot oli, e aprop cura aquel am enguent diafinicon e am enguent diabazilicon entro que sia sanat.	And as you will have untied that, embroca the place with water and a little oil, and then cure that with an enguent diafinicon and with an enguent diabazilicon until it be healed.
Mays si en la plagua accideys apostema caut, adhust e corrosiu, e de aquel semblantz ayssi cum si le sanc es en la vesica congelat, e per lu es la hurina prohibida (e aquo es conogut per la egressio del sanc am urina), a donc entromet lo tieu dit en la plagua e extratz aquel sanc, quar si roman provoca la vesica a corropcio de la vesica e de lu putrefaccio.	But if in the wound there occurs an abscess caut,  adherent and corrosive, and of that semblance as if the blood is in the bladder frozen, and by it the urine is prohibited (and this is known by the egress of blood with urine), then therefore interweave your finger in the wound and extract that blood, because if it remains it provokes the bladder to corruption of the bladder and of it putrefaction.
E aprop lava la plagua am vi agre, aygua e sal, e am opposicio a tota specia, am aquo que conveneys a lu de la curacio entro que sia sanat.	And then wash the wound with vinegar, water, and salt, and in opposition to all species, with that which you convene to it of the cure until it be healed.
E cove en las horas de tota la curacio que tu lies amdos las coyssas e ajustes las medicinas las quals so pausadas sobre le loc.	And cover in the hours of all the cure that you lie both the thighs and adjust the medicines which are placed upon the place.
E si la peyra es petita e es en le meat de la vergua, e es ficat en lu, e eyssement de urina es prohibit, lahoras cura aquel am aquo que yeu recomti denant que pervenguas a seccio, quar tropas veguadas per aquesta curacio yest acusat de seccio; e ja yeu e esproat aquo, e es que tu prenguas un perforador de ferr alfelut, del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And if the bone is small and is in the middle of the vagina, and is stuck in it, and the egress of urine is prohibited, then cure that with water which I recommend before you arrive at incision, because troops of times by this cure it is accused of incision; and already I have spoken of this, and it is that you take a perforator of iron blunt, of which this is the form of it:
de triangulada extramitat, agut, ficat en fust.	of triangular extremity, acute, fitted in a shaft.
E aprop pren fiel, e lia am aquel la vergua dejos la peyra per so que no retorne a la vesica.	And then take a thread, and tie with it the vagina below the bone so that it does not return to the bladder.
E aprop entromet le ferr en la vergua, perforant am fecilitat entro que·l perforador vengua ad aquela peyra.	And then interweave the iron into the vagina, perforating with facility until the perforator comes to that bone.
E revolveys le perforador am la tua ma en aquela peyra petit a petit, e tu perforsa la perforacio de lu entro que fassas aquel del autra part penetrar; quar la urina tantost es absolta.	And revolve the perforator with your hand in that bone little by little, and you perforate the perforation of it until you make that of the other part penetrate; because the urine is immediately absolved.
E aprop prem la tua ma sobre aquo que es romas de la peyra de la partida deforo de la vergua, quar aquela es trinquada, e es foro-getada am la urina, e le malaute es sanat.	And then press your hand upon that which is broken of the bone from the outside part of the vagina, because that is broken, and is forced-thrown with the urine, and the patient is healed.
Mays si aquesta curacio no es a tu aparelhada per alcuna causa la qual prohibeys de aquela, lahoras lia un fiel dejos la peyra, e autra fiel desus la peyra.	But if this cure is not to your disposal for any cause which prohibits you from that, then tie a thread below the bone, and another thread above the bone.
E aprop encideys sobre la peyra en aquela vergua entre doas liaduras.	And then incise upon the bone in that vagina between two ligatures.
E aprop extratz aquela.	And then extract that.
E aprop deslia le liament e mondifica le sanc congilat, le qual es fayt en la plagua.	And then untie the ligament and modify the congealed blood, which is made in the wound.
E no es necessari liament de fiel dejos la peyra, sino per que no retorne a la vesica, e l’autre liament desus sino, quar quan es desliat le fiel aprop la egrecio de la peyra, la codena retorna a son loc e cobra la plagua.	And it is not necessary the ligament of thread below the bone, but only so that it does not return to the bladder, and the other ligament above, because when the thread is untied the egress of the bone, the codena returns to its place and covers the wound.
E per aquo es a tu necessari quan lias le fiel desus, que tu eleves la codena a las partidas desus, o que retorne deves le tieu compliment, e cobra la plagua ayssi co havem dit.	And for that it is necessary to you when you tie the thread above, that you elevate the codena to the parts above, or that you must return the tie to it, and cover the wound as we have said.
Capitol .lxi.	Chapter .lxi.
De extraccio de peyra de las femnas.	On the Extraction of a Stone from Women.
Peyra en las femnas pauc es engendrada.	Stones in women are rarely produced.
Mays si ve peyra ad alcuna de aquelas, lahoras dificil es la curacio de lu, e es prohibida per tropas manieyras.	But if a stone is found in any of them, then its cure is difficult, and it is prohibited by many methods.
La una de lor es quar la femna fort leu es verges.	One of them is that the woman, if she is very young, is a virgin.
E la segonda es quar tu no trobas femna be scient que descroba si meteyssa al metge quan es casta, o es de las femnas haventz maritz.	And the second is that you do not find a woman well-versed who describes herself to the physician when she is chaste, or of women who have husbands.
La tersa es quar tu no hatrobas femna be sabent aquesta art, majorment la operacio am ma.	The third is that you do not find a woman well-versed in this art, especially the operation with the hand.
E la quarta es que·l loc de la seccio sobre peyra en las femnas es longinc del loc de la peyra, per que indigeys de seccio preonda, e en aquela es temor.	And the fourth is that the place of the section on the stone in women is far from the place of the stone, because you indigeys of preonda section, and in that there is fear.
Mays si necessitat provoca a tu ad aquo, lahoras cove que tu prenguas una femna metga be scient, e pauc es atrobada.	But if necessity compels you to do so, then you must take a woman physician well-versed, and few are found.
Mays si tu es privat de aquela, lahoras cerca metga quast e subtil, o presenta una femna matrona be esenhada en le feyt de las femnas, o femna que en aquesta art ennueys partida del art.	But if you are deprived of that, then seek a skilled and subtle physician, or present a woman matron well-versed in the ways of women, or a woman who in this art is partly of the art.
Donc fay aquela present, e comanda a lu que fassa tot aquo que tu li mandaras, de la enquisicio sobre la peyra al comensament; la qual causa es que reguarde si la femna es verges, lahoras cove que meta lo sieu dit en le cul de lu e quiera la peyra.	Therefore, do this presentation, and command him to do all that you command him, from the inquiry about the stone to the beginning; the reason for which is that he should regard whether the woman is a virgin, then he must put his finger into her anus and want the stone.
Donc si atroba aquela, coarte aquela dejos le sieu dit, e lahoras comanda a lu que inscida sobre aquela.	Therefore, if that is found, force that from her, and then command him to insert into that.
Mays si no es verge, lahoras comanda a la matrona que entrometa lo sieu dit en le conh de la malauta e enquiera sobre la peyra, pus que pausa la sua ma sinistra sobre la vesica, e comprem aquela am bona comprecio.	But if she is not a virgin, then command the matron to insert her finger into the vagina of the patient and inquire about the stone, because she puts her left hand on the bladder, and comprehends that with good understanding.
Donc si atroba aquela, lahoras cove que gradantment maugua aquela de l’orrifici de la vesica a las partidas dejos am somman de la sua vertut entro que pervengua am aquel a la razit de la coyssa.	Therefore, if that is found, then command that gradually she withdraws that from the orifice of the bladder to the parts below with the sum of her virtue, until it reaches the root of the vagina.
E aprop inscida sobre aquela apposicio de la maytat del conh deves la razit de la coyssa de qualque part sia a lu parada e cent la peyra en aquela partida, e·l dit de lu no sia remaugut de la peyra coartan dejos lu.	And then insert into that position of the majority of the vagina, the root of the vagina, from whichever part it is stopped and hold the stone in that part, and the finger of it not be removed from the stone, short of it.
E la seccio sia pauca al comensament; e aprop entrometa lo ray sobre aquela seccio, e si sent la peyra, lahoras ajuste en seccio segon la quantitat la qual sap que la peyra sira getada de aquela.	And the section be little at the beginning; and then insert the ray onto that section, and if you feel the stone, then adjust in section according to the quantity which you know that the stone is thrown from that.
E sapias que las specias de peyra son motas: quar de aquelas es pauca e gran, e leon e aspra, e longua e redonda, e havent ramps.	And know that the species of stones are many: for some are few and large, and lion and sharp, and long and round, and having ramps.
Donc tu sapias quantas specias so de lu per aquo que tu signifiques sobre aquo que vols.	Therefore, you know how many species are of it by what you signify about what you want.
E si tu veus flux de sanc, ajusta en le loc vetriol trissat e te aquela per una hora entro que sia abscindit le sanc, e aprop retorna a la tua operacio entro que la peyra sia fora-getada.	And if you see a flow of blood, adjust in the place vitriol trissat and take it for an hour until the blood is absconded, and then return to your operation until the stone is expelled.
E fay que prepares am tu dels instrumentz les quals e ditz en la extraccio de peyra en les homes, per so que sias ajudat per aquels en la tua operacio.	And do that you prepare with you of the instruments which are said in the extraction of stones in men, so that you may be helped by those in your operation.
E si tu veus flux de sanc, e sabes que la expulcio del sanc es de la arceria que es insciza, lahoras tu pausa polvera sobre le loc e estrenh aquel am pulvils e strictura descent, e no iteras aquo; e layssa la peyra e no extraguas aquela, quar fort leu morira la malauta.	And if you see a flow of blood, and know that the expulsion of the blood is from the artery that is incised, then you put powder on the place and tighten that with poultices and stricture descent, and do not repeat that; and leave the stone and do not extract it, for very soon the patient will die.
E aprop cura la plagua.	And then cure the wound.
Donc cum es cedada la acuitat del sanc aprop alcus jorns, e·l loc se poyreys, lahoras tu retorna a la tua operacio entro que la peyra sia fora-getada.	And when the acuteness of the blood is ceded after some days, and the place can be opened, then you return to your operation until the stone is expelled.
Capitol lxii.	Chapter lxii.
De seccio sobre ernia acoza.	On the Section of a Hernia.
Hernia ayguoza no es sino agregacio de humiditat en le ciphac blanc lo qual es dejos la codena dels genetius contenent le huou, e es nompnat ciphac.	Hernia ayguoza is nothing but an accumulation of humidity in the white membrane which is below the codena of the genitals containing the huou, and it is called ciphac.
E alcunas veguadas es en le propri pannicol le qual a lu preparec natura en la partida del huou, entro que sia cuyat que ja es autre huou; e es la codena del genetiu entre le ciphac blanc le qual havem dit, e no es aquo sino tart.	And some times it is in the proper panniculus which has prepared it nature in the part of the huou, so that it is a cuyat that already is another huou; and it is the codena of the genitals between the white membrane which we have said, and it is not that but tart.
E la generacio de aquest hernia es per debelitat la qual accideys als genetius, per que ad aquels es efundunda aquesta materia, e alcunas vetz accideys per percuscio fayta sobre les genetius.	And the generation of this hernia is for debility which happens to the genitals, so that into those is effused this matter, and some times it happens by percussion made upon the genitals.
E aquesta humiditat es havent motas colors, quar la color de lu o es declinant a citrina o a sanguinent, o rog, o es negra feculenta, o es ayguosa blanqua, e es aquo que es mays.	And this humidity is having many colors, for the color of it or is declining to citrine or to sanguine, or roge, or it is black feculent, or it is ayguosa blanqua, and this is the most.
E les senhals per les quals es saubut on es aquesta agreguacio de aygua so aquestz: quar si es en le ciphac blanc le qual havem dit, lahoras le apostema es redon declinant un pauc a longitut ayssi cum figura de huou, e appar le genetiu, quar la humiditat conte aquel de tota part.	And the signs by which it is known where this accumulation of water is this: for if it is in the white membrane which we have said, then the apostema is round declining a little in length as if a figure of huou, and appears the genitals, for the humidity contains that from all parts.
E si la humiditat es en le propri pannicol, lahoras le apostema es redon am partida del huou e per aysso hom estima que es autre huou.	And if the humidity is in the proper panniculus, then the apostema is round with part of the huou and by this man estimates that it is another huou.
E si la humiditat es entre la codena dels genetius e·l ciphac blanc, lahoras catz dejos le centiment.	And if the humidity is between the codena of the genitals and the white membrane, then catz below the centiment.
E cum tu vols la cognicio de la color de la humiditat, lahoras tu esproa la color de la humiditat en le apostema am entromes cayrat del qual la forma es precedida; e segon aquo que es eyssit en le vestigi del entromes, jutga de aquo que es dedintz lu.	And as you want the knowledge of the color of the humidity, then you probe the color of the humidity in the apostema with entromes cayrat of which the form is preceded; and according to what is seen in the vestige of the entromes, judge of that which is deduced from it.
Donc quan nos vinem a la curacio de lu am ferr, lahoras cove que comandem al malaute que sia fleubotomat si aquo es a tu possibla, e vezes le cos de lu ple.	Therefore, when we come to the cure of him with iron, then we command the patient to be flexible if this is possible, and times the body of him full.
E aprop sia resupinat sobre le sieu dos sobre alcuna causa un pauc auta, e pausa dejos lu motz draps.	And then raise him on his back, on some cause a little higher, and place cloths over him.
E aprop setz tu sobre la part sinistra de lu, e comanda al ministra que segua a la dextra de lu, le qual extenda la sua vergua a hun de dos latz a la codena dels genetius e a la partida del mirac del ventre.	And then sit you on the left side of him, and command the minister to follow on the right of him, the one who extends his hand to one of two sides to the groin of the genitals and to the part of the navel of the belly.
E aprop pren spatum lat e scindeys la codena dels genetius del mieg loc per la longitut entro prop le pentenilh.	And then take a spatula wide and cut the groin of the genitals from the middle place for the length into near the penis.
E sia fayta la seccio segon rectetut engualment distant de la linha que deveseys la pel dels genetius, entro que pervengua al ciphac blanc comprehendent.	And be made the section according to rectum equally distant from the line that goes through the skin of the genitals, until it reaches the white head encompassing.
E excorja aquel, e observa, e guarda te per aysso que tu no inscidas aquel; e la tua excoriacio am la qual aquel excorjas per partida jassia que sia suspenduda am le huou mays e subtilment escruta am la excoriacio segon la quantitat a tu possibla.	And scrape that, and observe, and guard yourself so that you do not cut that; and your scraping with which you scrape by a part of the skin that may be suspended with the most and subtly examine with the scraping according to the quantity as much as possible.
E aprop perfora le ciphac ple de aygua am perforacio ampla, e extratz tota l’aygua.	And then perforate the head full of water with a wide perforation, and extract all the water.
E aprop separa entre doas labias de la seccio am uncis, e exten le ciphac a las partidas desus; e no toques la codena les genetius comprehendent, e inscideys le ciphac en aquela manieyra que es a tu possible.	And then separate between two lips of the section with a hook, and extend the head to the upper parts; and do not touch the groin encompassing, and cut the head in that manner that is to you possible.
E inscideys aquel am la sua totalitat o en pessas, e majorment le sieu latz subtil, quar si tu no perscrutas exquisidament la inscizio de lu, no es fayta segurtat que la aygua no retorne.	And cut that with its entirety or in pieces, and mostly its side subtle, because if you do not scrutinize exquisitely the incision of it, it is not made certainty that the water does not return.
Mays si le huou procezeys de aquela defora de la sua codena en la ora de la tua operacio, lahoras quan tu auras complida la seccio del ciphac, retorna dedintz aquel, e aprop ajusta las doas labias de la codena dels genetius am sutura, e aprop cura aquel ayssi cum las autras plagua, entro que sia sanat.	But if the fluid proceeds from that outside of its groin in the time of your operation, then when you will have completed the section of the head, return inside that, and then adjust the two lips of the groin of the genitals with suture, and then cure that thus as the other wounds, until it is healed.
E si atrobas le huou corromput per autra malautia, lahoras cove que tu lies les vayssels les quals so sore le suspensori, e extrat le huou, e aprop cura aquel am aquo que havem dit.	And if you find the fluid corrupted by another illness, then you must tie the vessels which are on the suspender, and extract the head, and then cure that with the water that we have said.
Mays si l’aygua es agreguada en doas partidas esemps, lahoras sapias que doas son las ernias; donc inscideys aquela partida segon que has feyt en l’autra engualment; e si es a tu vist que sia una opera, lahoras tu la fay.	But if the water is aggregated in two parts simultaneously, then you know that there are two hernias; therefore cut that part according to that which you have done in the other equally; and if it is to your view that it should be an operation, then you do it.
E aprop tu abstergiys le sanc, e entramet en las seccios lana submersa en oli o en oli rozat; e pausa deforo autra lana la qual tu as submersa en vi e oli, e expandeys aquela sobre dos genetius e·l mirac del ventre; e pausa desobre draps doblatz e pulvils, e lia aquels desobre am liament le qual es segon aquesta forma:	And then you cleanse the blood, and introduce into the sections wool submerged in oil or in rose oil; and place before other wool which you have submerged in wine and oil, and expand that over the genitals and the navel of the belly; and place above folded cloths and powders, and tie those above with a bandage which is according to this form:
e aprop sian preses dos draps e sian humplitz de lana carmenada segon aquesta semblansa; e sian faytas las extremitatz am les quals es premut de coto o de lana humida, e sian agreguatz am strectura en le braguier de las braguas, e la una de las extremitatz prengua del cul entro al dos, e la segonda prengua a la partida del pantenilh, e dos extramitatz sobre dos coyssas dejos e dos extramitatz autras sobre dos angonars, e tota extrictura sia ajustada en le braguier de las braguas.	And then take two cloths and be them filled with carded wool according to this semblance; and be made the extremities with which is pressed from cotton or from damp wool, and be added with structure in the waistband of the breeches, and one of the extremities presses from the buttock into the two, and the second presses to the part of the penis, and two extremities over two thighs and two other extremities over two angles, and all structure be adjusted in the waistband of the breeches.
E alcunas veguadas aquesta hernia es medicada artificialment am cauteri en loc de seccio am ferr; e es que tu prenguas cauteri cutellar subtil e que inscidas am aquel la codena dels ginitius, e es ignit segon que havem recomtat entro que sia descubert le ciphac blanc contenent la aygua, e lahoras tu pren cauteri segon aquesta forma:	And some times this hernia is medicated artificially with cautery in place of section with iron; and it is that you take a subtle cautery knife and that you cut with that the groin of the genitals, and it is ignited according to that we have recounted until it is discovered the white head containing the water, and then you take cautery according to this form:
e es asemblat a letra greca.	And it is assembled in Greek letter.
E aprop perfora am aquel ciphac, e es ignit entro que tota la humiditat sia fora-gitada.	And then perforate with that head, and it is ignited until all the humidity is expelled.
E aprop exten le ciphac am uncis, e excorja am uncis, e excorja am cauteri subtil ignit; e inscideys aquel segon que es a tu possible entro que eradiques tot lu; e guarda te del huou que·l foc no·l toque.	And then extend the head with a hook, and scrape with a hook, and scrape with a subtle cautery ignited; and cut that according to that is to you possible until you eradicate all of it; and guard yourself from the fluid that the fire does not touch it.
E sapias que aquesta operacio es pus salva e pus longinqua de flux de sanc, e milhor que operacio am seccio.	And know that this operation is more safe and more distant from the flow of blood, and better than operation with section.
Mays si a tu fa contrarietat apostema caut en la hora de seccio o en hora de cauteri, o flux de sanc, lahoras cove que tu cures qual contrarietat fa a tu per aquo, am curacio la qual conveneys a lu segon que es dit.	But if to you makes contrariety abscess caut in the hour of section or in the hour of cautery, or flow of blood, then you must cure whatever contrariety makes to you for that, with cure which you convene to him according to that is said.
Mays si le malaute es pauruc, e no spera la segonda operacio per la sua horribilitat, lahoras administra perforacio segon que yeu recomti aquo; e es quan es certificat deves tu, per aquo que havem dit de las significacios, que aquela hernia es ayguosa.	But if the patient is fearful, and does not expect the second operation for its horror, then administer perforation according to that we have recounted here; and it is when it is certified you, for that which we have said of the significations, that that hernia is watery.
Lahoras cove que tu fassas sezer le malaute sobre alcuna cezelha elevada, aprop perfora le apostema en la partida pus bassa de lu am spatum lat, e pausa la perforacio segon la longitut del cos.	Then you must make the patient lie on some elevated cushion, and then perforate the abscess in the lowest part of it with a wide spatula, and place the perforation according to the length of the body.
E sia la apercio ampla entro que corro tota l‘aygua.	And be the aperture wide until it runs all the water.
E aprop pausa sobre le loc coto e lia aquel e layssa aquel, per so que corro le romanent de l’aygua.	And then place on the place cotton and tie that and leave that, so that it runs the remaining of the water.
E aprop cura aquel entro que la plagua sia sanada.	And then cure that until the wound is healed.
Mays si contrarietat es a la egrecio de l’aygua en aquela hora tu perforas aquela: e aquo no es fayt sino per aquo quar le pannicol blanc en le orrifici de la plagua fa contrarietat e prohibeys le eyssiment de l’aygua, lahoras cove que tu metas en la plagua pena o instrument am la qual es extrayta l’aygua dels ydropitz, la forma del qual es precedida; o ajusta en la opprecio de la plagua un petit.	But if contrariety is in the outflow of the water in that hour you perforate that: and this is not done except for that which the white panniculus in the orifice of the wound makes contrariety and prohibits the emission of the water, then you must put in the wound a needle or instrument with which is extracted the water from the hydropitz, the form of which is preceded; or adjust in the aperture of the wound a small one.
E sapias que l’aygua retorna, e es agueguada aprop vi meses o enaviro aquels; e cum es agreguada, lahoras sia perforat segon aquela meteyssa manieyra, quar le malaute ayssi passara les sieus dias.	And know that the water returns, and is collected for about six months or around those; and when it is collected, then it is pierced according to that same manner, so that the patient will pass his days thus.
Capitol .lxiii.	Chapter .lxiii.
De seccio sobre hernia carnosa e la curacio de lu.	Of the section on fleshy hernia and its cure.
Sapias que en la seccio sobre aquesta hernia es temor perdusent a pernicia en las majors disposicios; per que a mi es vista la dimissio de lu e esser salvat per aquela milhor.	Know that in the section on this hernia, there is fear of losing it to harm in the greatest dispositions; because to me it has been seen the dismissal of it and being saved by that better.
E yeu so rememorant la operacio en aquela e las specias dels apostemas.	And you are remembering the operation on that and the species of the abscesses.
Donc, dic que l‘apostemas natz en les cos dels quals les genetius so conponutz e es fayt aquo per motas causas: o per superfluitat aguda agra, la qual es efundida als genetius, o per percuscio.	Therefore, I say that the abscesses arise in the bodies of those whose genitals are composed and this is done for many causes: or by acute excess, which is poured into the genitals, or by percussion.
E es la color de la apostema segon la color del cos, e no es atrobat en lu dolor, e es apostema greu.	And the color of the abscess is according to the color of the body, and it is not atrophic in it pain, and it is a grave abscess.
E fort leu es apostema lapificada, del qual la color es fosca, e no es centiment a lu.	And very hard is the abscess lapidified, of which the color is dark, and there is no feeling in it.
E alcunas veguadas es fayt per nodacio de las arcerias, e per imflacio de aquelas ayssi quo ja es perceubut la rememoracio de lu, o per imflacio de venas.	And sometimes it is made by the knotting of the arteries, and by the inflammation of those so that already it is perceived the recollection of it, or by the inflammation of veins.
Mays aquo que es per imflacio de arcerias es conogut per la dispercio de la apostema quan compremas aquela am les tieus ditz; e no cove que aquel toques.	But that which is by the inflammation of arteries is known by the dispersion of the abscess when you compress it with your fingers; and no cover that you touch it.
Mays aquel que es fayt per imflacio de vena no es dispergut de lu alcuna causa deves la compressio am les ditz.	But that which is made by the inflammation of the vein is not dispersed of it any cause, despite the compression with the fingers.
E ja es possible que sobre aquesta specia sia fayta seccio e sobre les autres carns; e es que tu inscida la codena dels genetius, e aprop esten le huou a las partidas desus, e extratz aquel del ciphac blanc, e deliura le suspensori dels vaysels, e ligua les, e inscideys le suspensori pus que tu deliuras aquel de tota partida de las partidas del huou.	And it is already possible that on this species a section may be made and on the other flesh; and that you insert the cord of the genitals, and then extend the bowel to the upper parts, and extract it from the white cap, and deliver the suspensory of the vessels, and tie them, and insert the suspensory more than you deliver it from all parts of the bowel.
Donc si l’huou ja es am aquelas carnadas consolida, lahoras cove que tu extraguas le huou e inscidas aquel.	Therefore, if the bowel is already among those carnations consolidated, then you must extract the bowel and insert it.
E si es adherencia entro alcuna causa del ciphac, o entre aquo que es entre les bayssels, lahoras cove que tu deliures tota aquela adherencia e inscidas aquela per inscizio redonda.	And if there is adhesion for any cause of the cap, or between that which is between the vessels, then you must deliver all that adhesion and insert it by a round incision.
Mays si es nativitat de carn en le loc de la adherencia la qual es detras, lahoras cove que tu inscidas tot aquo que es de lu, e extraguas le huou ayssi cum havem dit.	But if it is a birth of flesh in the place of the adhesion which is behind, then you must insert all that which is of it, and extract the bowel as we have said.
Donc cum es complida la tua operacio, lahoras omple la plagua de lana imfuza en oli rozat e vi; e aprop cura aquela am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	Therefore, when the operation is completed, then fill the wound with wool infused in rose oil and wine; and care for it with the other cure until it is healed.
Capitol .lxiv.	Chapter .lxiv.
De la curacio de hernia que es de vitz.	Of the cure of hernia that is of the vitals.
Vit es apostema envolut per alcuna envolucio semblant a broto am mollificacio dels testiculs, e es fayt dificil movement exercitiu e deambulacio sobre le malaute.	Vit is an abscess enveloped by some wrapping resembling a sprout with softening of the testicles, and it is made difficult movement exercise and walking on the patient.
E en la curacio de aquesta malautia es per temor per aquo del qual es precedida rememoracio.	And in the cure of this disease it is out of fear for that of which it is preceded recollection.
Empero cove que diguam opperacio en aquela segon que fero les primiers.	However, it is necessary that they say operation on it according to that which I have done the first.

And I say that it is necessary that you make the patient lie on a raised cushion; and then peel the suspensory of the testicles to the lower parts; and then take the cord of the genitals with your fingers with the vessels that are probed to the groin; and have those other ministers that you, and extend them with vehement extension.

E aprop excorja de tota partida ayssi quo a tu havem dit en extraccio de arceria las quals so en las templas.	And then excoriate all parts as we have said in the extraction of arteries which are in the temples.
