E sia la borsa en la qual sian pausadas las medicinas de vesica de bestia o de pel de ovelha, e la razit de lu sia un palm.	And be the bag in which are placed the medicines of the bladder of beast or of sheepskin, and the root of it be a palm.
E sia perforada per motz traucs ayssi cum es revolvuda; e si l’espazi le qual es entre les traucs la grossetut del dit.	And be perforated by many holes as it is revolved; and if the space which is between the holes, the thickness of the finger.
E aprop entromet en aquels traucs fiel fort de fiel cru le qual sia de detz fiels, o enviro aquels; e ajusta am aquel la borsa; e quan es pausada en lu la borsa, sia streyt en le cap del cristeri entre dos distingentz am fort costriccio, e aprop cristeriza am aquel quascun trauc: Mays la qualitat de cristerizar am aquel es que tu omples la borsa de la medicina, que sia escalfada segon la quantitat de la tolleransa del malaute; e guarda te que no sia trop cauda ni trop freja.	And then insert into those holes thread strong of thread cru which be of ten threads, or around those; and adjust with that the bag; and when it is placed in it the bag, be straight in the head of the christening between two distinguishings with strong constriction, and then cauterize with that each hole: But the quality of cauterizing with that is that you fill the bag with the medicine, that be scalded according to the quantity of the tolerance of the patient; and guard yourself that it be not too hot nor too cold.
E aprop le malaute sia resupinat sobre le sieu dos, e eleva las suas cambas en sus e pausa dejos lu un cuer sobre le qual ja so les homes o un lansol; e aprop unta la extramitat del cauteri am oli o am album de huou o am mucellage de fenugrec o de semblantz; e aprop entromet aquel en le cul am facilitat, e aprop le ministre prengua la borsa e exprema aquel am doas mas e essemps am vehemencia entro que sia evacuat en le budelh tot aquo que es en le cristeri; e aprop extra le cristeri e le malaute leva las suas cambas a la paret.	And then the patient be laid on their back, and elevate their legs up and place below them a cushion on which already are the men or a pillow; and then anoint the extremity of the cauterizer with oil or with album of egg or with mucilage of fenugrec or of similar; and then insert that into the anus with facility, and then the minister presses the bag and expresses that with two hands and at the same time with vehemence until it be evacuated in the belly all that which is in the christening; and then extract the christening and the patient raises their legs to the wall.
E si la medicina forsa aquel a eyssiment, tengua le tant quant poyra; e si dorm am aquel per tota una nueyt, es mays derier en juvament.	And if the medicine forces that to emission, hold it as much as you can; and if he sleeps with that for a whole night, it is better in recovery.
Mays si tu cristerizas aquel en las malautias de solucio de ventre e l’eyssiment de lu le coyta, lahoras tu itera le cauteri entro que sia sanat.	But if you treat those with the ailments of intestinal solution and its expulsion, then you repeat the cautery until it is healed.
E si en le cul so emorroydas o apostemas ledens, lahoras sia le cristeri mot subtil e leon, dels cristeris am les quals les enfantz so criterisatz.	And if in the anus there are hemorrhoids or festering abscesses, then the cautery should be applied subtly and gently, of the cauteries with which children are treated.
De curacio de las plaguas.	Of the cure of the plagues.
Yeu ja e dit en la divisio de la curacio de las plaguas aquo que convenia al libre, e yeu dic assi la curacio de aquelas am ma e am medicinas segon le conpliment.	And I have already said in the division of the cure of the plagues what was convenient to the free, and I say so the cure of those with my own and with medicines according to the complement.
Donc dic que las plaguas son diversificadas segon aquo en que son faytas las plaguas e segon le loc sobre le qual cazo las plaquas.	Therefore I say that the plagues are diversified according to what by which the plagues are made and according to the place upon which the plagues fall.
E las causas per que motas vetz son faytas las plaguas so ayssi cum getament de peyra, o inscisio d’espaza o de cotel, o percussio am lansa, o am fustz, o am sageta, o semblantz ad aquels de motas causas.	And the causes for which many times the plagues are made are such as a wound from a rock, or an incision from a sword or spear, or a blow with a lance, or with a club, or with an arrow, or similar to those of many causes.
Mays las plaguas que so en les locz del cos so ayssi cum plagua la qual catz sobre le cap, o·l col, o·l pietz, o·l ventre, o·l fitge, e semblantz ad aquels dels membres.	But the plagues that are in the parts of the body are such as a plague that falls upon the head, or the neck, or the feet, or the belly, or the arm, and similar to those of the limbs.
E yeu so recomtant la curacio de alcunas plaguas per que pauses aquela ratiocinacio e regla sobre las autras plaguas.	And I am recounting the cure of some plagues so that you pause that reasoning and rule upon the other plagues.
E yeu comensare de las plaguas del cap simplas, quar la rememoracio de las compostas vindra al comensament del tertz capitol.	And I will begin with the plagues of the head simple, because the remembrance of the composed ones will come to the beginning of the third chapter.
Donc dic que quan accideys en le cap plagua simpla e no es fractura, lahoras considera: si es per getament de peyra o de semblant, e ja ha trinquada la codena tant solament e es gran plagla e temes sobre aquel malaute havinement de apostema caut, lahoras tu te coyta e fleubotoma la cephalica tantost, e no tardas aquo; e extrats ad aquel del sanc segon la quantitat de la vertut de lu si no mes alcuna causa prohibent de fleubotomia, majorment si·l sanc que es eyssit de la plagua es pauc.	Therefore I say that when a simple plague happens in the head and it is not a fracture, then consider: if it is from a wound from a rock or similar, and the wound has already been cleaned and is large and you fear about that patient having an abscess, then you cauterize and perform cephalic flebotomy immediately, and do not delay this; and extract from that of the blood according to the quantity of its virtue if no other cause prohibits flebotomy, mostly if the blood that is extracted from the plague is little.
E sia la flaubotomia del contrari de la partida plaguada; e guardase le malaute de replecio e de vi e de viandas grossas.	And let the flebotomy be on the opposite side of the wounded area; and guard the patient from repletion and from wine and from heavy foods.
Mays si de la minuicio prohibeys alcuna causa, lahoras sia aminorat de la vianda e no apropinque a carn ni a vi.	But if from the ministration any cause prohibits, then let the food be lessened and do not approach meat or wine.
E pausa sobre la plagua, si a lu accideys apostema caut, coto enfus en oli rozat solet o en vi en le qual es stipticat.	And pause on the plague, if to it there happens an abscess cauterize, coat infused in rose oil or in wine in which is steeped.
Mays si est segur de apostema caut, lahoras pausa sobre la plagua, si es recent am le sieu sanc e le ayre no ha mudat aquela la polvera la qual yeu recomtare aprop petit.	But if it is certain of an abscess cauterize, then pause on the plague, if it is recent with its blood and the air has not changed that powder which I will recount soon.
E si le ayre ja ha mudada aquela, lahoras pausa sobre alscus enguentz entro que sia sanada.	And if the air has already changed that, then pause on poultices until it is healed.
Mays si la plagua es gran o es per inscizio d’espaza e de semblantz, e no so ajustadas las labias de lu per puvils, lahoras ajusta aquelas am sutura segon que yeu recomtare de la sutura de lor.	But if the plague is large or is from an incision from a sword and similar, and the lips of it are not adjusted by pulleys, then adjust those with sutures according to as I will recount of the sutures of them.
Mays si la plagua ja es discuberta del os e pen, e no es retencio de lu sino un petit suspensori, lahoras inscideys aquela e aprop cura la plagua am medicinas e restaura la carn aprop en loc de codena, e comanda al malaute que sia pescut de viandas en las quals es groceza: caps e formen coyt e semblantz a lor, entro que sia compost.	But if the plague is already discovered of the bone and skin, and there is no retention of it but a small suspension, then incise that and approach cure the plague with medicines and restore the flesh in the place of the wound, and command the patient to be sparing of foods in which there is thickness: caps and forms cooked and similar to them, until it is composed.
E si atrobas en la codena putrefaccio e no adhereys al os, lahoras tu inscideys tot aquo poyrit e geta aquo, e aprop cura aquo.	And if there is putrefaction in the wound and it does not adhere to the bone, then you incise all that pus and throw it out, and then cure that.
Mays si en aquestas plaguas es arteria o vena de la qual fluxs de sanc pot evenir, e no es abscindida per medicinas, lahoras tu inquier sobre la arteria, e si atrobas aquela no-inscidida, lahoras tu inscideys aquela am spatum, o lia aquela; e si necessitat te provoca que aquo que havem dit no comfereys, lahoras tu cauteriza entro que·l sanc sia abscidit.	But if in these plagues there is an artery or vein from which the flow of blood can occur, and it is not incised by medicines, then you inquire about the artery, and if you find that not incised, then you incise that with a spatula, or tie that; and if necessity provokes that what we have said does not confer, then you cauterize until the blood is stopped.
E si aquestas plaguas son simplas e petitas, lahoras la causa de lor es leugiere; enayssi que tu polverizas sobre aquelas aquesta polvera, quar consolidada aquela denant que l’ayre mude aquelas.	And if these plagues are simple and small, then the cause of them is lighter; in this way that you pulverize over those this powder, because consolidated that before the air changes those.
E la manieyra de la polvera es aquesta: recipe oli de enses partida una, de sanc de drago partida doas, de caus no-extincta partidas tres; sia tot mot trissat e crivellat, e de lu sia la plagua omplida, e sia constrengida per bona constriccio entro que be sobre aquela aderesca, e sia coagulada am le sanc.	And the manner of the powder is this: receive olive oil parted one, of dragon's blood parted two, of cauterized non-extinguished parts three; be all three ground and sifted, and of it be the plague filled, and be constricted by good constriction until well over that adheres, and be coagulated with the blood.
E aprop strengeys aquela desus am pulvils e leyssa aquela, e no la deslias mentre esta ayssi que no es apostemada, quar no es eredicada de lu la medicina entro que sia sanada.	And then strengthens that with pulleys and lessens that, and do not untie it while it is thus that it is not apostatized, because it is not eradicated from it the medicine until it is healed.
E alcuna vetz fa aquo sola cautz, quan no es a tu en present enses e sanc de drago.	And sometimes do this only cauterize, when it is not to you in present olive oil and dragon's blood.
E ja fa aquesta meteyssa operacio en las grans plaguas quan conveneys que sia pausada sobre aquelas e sian streytas, e so plaguas recentz am le lor sanc, las quals le ayre no ha alteradas.	And already do this same operation in the great plagues when it is necessary that it be placed over them and be tightened, and are recent plagues with their blood, those which the air has not altered.
E si le ayre las ha alteradas, e majorment quan es en temps d’estiu, lahoras no es entencio a la posicio de aquesta polvera, mays adonc cura aquelas am aquo que havem dit, enayssi que tu pauses sobre aquelas alcus enguents degistius, o que pauses sobre aquelas pols de la farina del ordi am aygua e mel entro que getan poyredura; e aprop cura aquelas am l’autra curacio entro que sian sanadas.	And if the air has altered them, and mostly when it is in summer time, then it is not understood in the position of this powder, but rather cure those with what we have said, in this way that you pause over those poultices digestible, or that you pause over those powder of barley flour with water and honey until they get pus; and then cure those with the other cure until they are healed.
Mays si accideys am la plagua fractura en os, e es petita, lahoras tu extratz aquo am gesti.	But if the plague fractures a bone, and it is small, then you extract it with forceps.
E yeu diyre la cura de las fracturas del cap en aquo que es envenidor.	And I will say the cure for fractures of the head in that which is poisonous.
De las plaguas del col.	Of the plagues of the neck.
Mays si la plagua accideys en le col, lahoras no es en lu differencia en medicacio, e entre la plagua del cap quan es simpla.	But if the plague occurs in the neck, then there is no difference in medication, and between the plague of the head when it is simple.
Mays si ja le nervi del col es inscis o arteria, lahoras si es nervi, no es en lu engen sino que sia evitada curacio de lu am aquo que fa vehement stipticitat, ayssi cum ziniar e zegi que es vetriol e semblantz a lor quar nozo als nervis e contrazo aquel.	But if the nerve of the neck is cut or artery, then if it is a nerve, it is not in its place but that its cure is avoided with that which makes vehement coagulation, as zinnar and zegi that is vitriol and similar to their kind, no to the nerves and against that.
E no pauses sobre la plagua alcuna causa de tot freja, quar la sustancia dels nervis es freja e la continuacio de lu es am le cervel, le qual es le pus aut de totz les membres.	And do not place on the wound any cause of all cold, because the substance of the nerves is cold and the continuation of it is with the brain, which is the most delicate of all the members.
E si’ aquo am que es curat de medicinas leugieras, ayssi cum es caus lavada am aygua dousa, alcuna veguada enfusa en oli rozat o no-rozat, e thucia quan es lavada am aygua dousa e las autras peyras minarantz segon aquesta manieyra, e enguentz humitz.	And if that is cured with light medicines, as it is washed with sweet water, some herbs infused in rose oil or non-rose oil, and then washed with sweet water and the other herbs minced in this manner, and moistened.
Mays si la plagua es gran, lahoras aministra sutura, o coarta las labias de lu, e aprop cura aquela am pulvils entro que sia sanada.	But if the wound is large, then administer suture, or cut the lips of it, and then cure that with powders until it is healed.
Mays si a la plagua es profunditat o accideys en lu a la pus bassa partida poyredura, lahoras perfora aquela en le loc mays depremegut.	But if the wound is deep or occurs in the lowest part of the body, then perforate that in the most depressed place.
Mays si en la plagua ja es inscisa arteria e es conseguit flux de sanc, lahoras separa o secca aquela, o lia aquela, o cauteriza aquela si necessitat te provoca ad aquo.	But if in the wound already is incised artery and is obtained flow of blood, then separate or dry that, or tie that, or cauterize that if necessity provokes to that.
Mays si ja ha insciditz les spondils del golayro o tot, e so salvadas las venas del col, lahoras tu ajusta las labias de la codena am sutura sobre la cana del golayro e no toques aquel; abantz egala aquel e reduzeys aquel sobre la sua figura natural, e aprop strenh aquel am strectura decent, e leyssa aquela per alcus jorns; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz en les quals es stipticitat e excitacio entro que sia sanat.	But if already are incised the vertebrae of the throat or all, and are saved the veins of the neck, then you adjust the lips of the trachea with suture over the canal of the throat and do not touch that; raise that and return that to its natural figure, and then strengthen that with a decent structure, and leave that for some days; and then cure that with poultices in which there is coagulation and excitation until it is healed.
Mays si la plagua ja en le os a fayta enprecio, lahoras percuireys aquela, e lahoras si en lu ha fragmentz de hos, extratz totz aquels que podes de lor; e aquo que a tu no es apparelhat, leyssa aquo entro que la plagua se poyrisca, e sia separat e la egrecio de lu sia alleujada.	But if the wound already in the bone has made an impression, then strike that, and if in it there are fragments of bone, extract all those that you can of them; and what to you is not apparelled, leave that until the wound is purified, and is separated and the discharge of it is relieved.
E si la plagua es recent lahoras polveriza sobre aquela polvera la qual t’e recomtada.	And if the wound is recent, then pulverize over that the powder which has been recommended to you.
Mays si en la plagua es fayta fistula, lahoras cura aquela am aquo del qual la rememoracio vindra aprop en le sieu capitol.	But if in the wound is made a fistula, then cure that with that of which the remembrance will come near in its chapter.
De las plaguas del col o de semblantz quan fayta entre las spallas e es fayta am spaza o am cotel o am lansa o am semblantz.	Of the wounds of the neck or of similar ones when made between the ribs and is made with a sword or with a dagger or with a lance or with similar.
Si es percussio de lansa o de cotel, e vezes de lu la profunditat, lahoras considera mays si de la plagua yeys ventositat quan le malaute elena; lahoras sapias que la plagua es mortal.	If it is a percussion of a lance or of a dagger, and sometimes of it the depth, then consider more if from the wound there is windiness when the patient is leaning; then you know that the wound is mortal.
E si en lu no es profunditat e la plagua es recent am le sieu sanc, lahoras tu pauses en lu de la primieyra horo polvera, e no strenhas aquel per que no sia le sanc retengut en la profunditat de lu e que retorne al cor e que aucigua le malaute, mays pausa en lu enguent atractiu, e deslia aquela doas veguadas le dia.	And if in it there is no depth and the wound is recent with its blood, then you place in it of the first hour powder, and do not strengthen that so that it is not the blood retained in the depth of it and that it returns to the heart and that it kills the patient, but place in it attractive poultice, and untie that twice a day.
E si l’enguent no es a tu present, lahoras tu pausa en le orrifici de la plagua coto viel per que sucque aquo que yeys de las humiditatz; e fay que le malaute dorma sobre la plagua per que corra aquo que es en lu ajustat.	And if the poultice is not to you present, then you place in the orifice of the wound cotton old so that it sucks that which is of the humidities; and make that the patient sleep on the wound so that it runs that which is in it adjusted.
Mays si ja de la plagua son passatz tres dias o mays e no accideys al malaute spasme ni tremor de cor mal ni strictura de ale, e vezes las autras dispozicios bonas de lu, lahoras sapias que plagua es salva; e adonc cura aquela am calguas e am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanada.	But if already from the wound have passed three days or more and does not occur to the patient spasm nor tremor of heart nor constriction of the throat, and sometimes the other good dispositions of it, then you know that the wound is saved; and therefore cure that with poultices and with the other cure until it is healed.
Mays si la sanacio de lu es excusada, e ja tot temps es uberta, lahoras sapias que ja es fayta fistula; cura donc aquela per le sieu capitol.	But if the healing of it is excused, and already all time is open, then you know that already is made a fistula; cure therefore that by its chapter.
E si la plagua es per inscisio de spaza o de cotel, e es simpla en la superficia del pietz o del dos, lahoras cura aquela am aquo que es precedit de sutura, si es gran, o am polvera, si es petita.	And if the wound is by incision of a sword or of a dagger, and is simple on the surface of the foot or of the back, then cure that with that which is preceded by suture, if it is large, or with powder, if it is small.
Mays si ja ha fayta enprecio en le os, e so ja de lu inscizas pessas, lahoras tu torqua la plagua e coyta ad extrayre aquelas pessas, si so separadas.	But if already has made an impression in the bone, and are already from it incised pieces, then you turn the wound and try to extract those pieces, if they are separated.
Mays si no so separadas, lahoras leyssa las entro que se poyresca la plagua, que la extraccio de lor es alleujada.	But if they are not separated, then leave them until the wound is purified, that the extraction of them is relieved.
E de las autras plaguas accidentz en les autres membres le juvament en curacio es le juvament de aquo que havem dit.	And of the other wounds accidents in the other members the judgment in cure is the judgment of that which we have said.
De las plaguas del ventre.	Of the wounds of the belly.
L’indisposicio la qual accideys en le ventre es o gran, o pauc, o migiera.	The indisposition which occurs in the belly is either great, or little, or medium.
De la gran alcunas veguadas yeys le budel o nervi del budel, per que es fayta intromissio de lor e la sutura de lor esser pus vehement e pus subtil.	Of the great some times there are the intestines or nerves of the intestines, for which there is made intrusion of them and the suture of them being more vehement and more subtle.
E disrupcio petita es fayta dificil per autra manieyra, e siec se que la reduccio de lor es pus dificil, si no te coytes de la intromissio de lor al sieu loc tantost, quar se ubre e es engrossat per que le intrament de lu es fayt difficil.	And little disruption is made difficult by another manner, and if it sees that the reduction of them is more difficult, if you do not try of the intrusion of them to their place as soon as possible, because it opens and is thickened for that the entrance of it is made difficult.
E donc la milhor disrupcio es migiera, quar en aquela no es dificil la reduccio del budel, ayssi cum es dificil en las doas specias denant ditas.	And therefore the best incision is mid-line, because in that one the reduction of the hernia is not difficult, as it is in the two species mentioned before.
E sapias que sutura del ventre es segon quatre manieyras, mays doas suturas son comunas que conveneysso en suturas de las autras plaguas del cors.	And know that the suture of the belly is done in four ways, but two sutures are common that are useful in sutures of other wounds of the body.
E duas autras suturas proprias comunican a las autras plaguas, mays empero so mays proprias en la sutura del ventre.	And two other sutures proper are common to the others, but however they are more proper in the suture of the belly.
E yeu recomti a tu quascuna am exposicio e declaracio.	And I recommend to you each one with exposition and declaration.
Donc dic que quan la plagua es petita e es eyssit alcuna causa del budel per aquela, e es fayt dificil a reduzir aquel, lahoras aquo es en una de doas manieyras: o per parvitat de la disrupcio ayssi cum havem dit, o quan al budel es venguda inflacio per la frigiditat de l’ayre.	Therefore I say that when the wound is small and there is some cause of the hernia by that, and it is made difficult to reduce that, then this is in one of two ways: or by the smallness of the incision as we have said, or when the hernia has come inflammation by the coldness of the air.
E donc quan aquo es ayssi, lahora cove que tu scalfes aquel enayssi que tu submerges una sponga ho drap humit en aygua tebeza sola, o que coguas en aygua squinant, e cyperum, e spic, e embroques am aquela le budel entro que la imflacio sia resolvuda.	And therefore when this is so, then you cover that with a sponge or cloth soaked in warm water only, or that you soak in water with squinting, and cypress, and spice, and embrokes with that the hernia until the inflammation is resolved.
E alcunas veguadas fa aquo vi en le qual ha stipticitat, e es milhor que la aygua sola en resolucio de la imflacio.	And sometimes do this with the one which has astringency, and it is better than the water alone in the resolution of the inflammation.
E donc cum tu vezes la imflacio esser resolvuda, lahoras tu humecta le budel am aygua en la qual es coyta altea e malvas, quar per aquo es alleujat le intrament de lu am pauca causa.	And therefore when you see the inflammation being resolved, then you moisten the hernia with water in which is steeped elder and mallows, because by this it is alleviated the pain of it with little cause.
Mays si es escusat le intrament de lu aprop aquesta curacio, lahoras scindeys la disrupcio un petit am strument am le qual so inscididas emorroydas.	But if the pain of it is excused by this cure, then you split the incision a little with an instrument with which hemorrhoids are incised.
E la curacio primieyra es milhor, quan es propriada que no es seccio, e no sia occupacio a seccar aprop necessitat e defaliment.	And the first cure is better, when it is proper that it is not a section, and that there is no occupation to dry it up by necessity and deficiency.
Del instrument, sec se la forma de lu:	Of the instrument, this is the form of it:
La una partida de lu torta aguda, e l’autra partida no-acuta, e la extremitat subtil, e no sia am la subtilitat de spatum, abantz sia obtusa un pauc.	One part of it is sharp, and the other part is not sharp, and the tip is subtle, and not with the subtlety of a spatula, but rather blunt a little.
E donc cum la plagua es amplificada e yeys fora le budel, lahoras cove que la sua reduccio sia segon la forma de lu natural, en le sieu loc propri, si es possible sobre aquo, quar milhor es.	And therefore when the wound is amplified and the hernia is out, then it is covered that its reduction be according to the form of it natural, in its proper place, if it is possible above that, because it is better.
Mays quan la disrupcio es ampla, e es en la partida pu bassa del ventre, lahoras cove que tu fassas jazer le malaute sobre le sieu dos, e pausa las suas cambas pus autas que·l sieu cap; e si es en la partida pus desus del ventre, lahoras tu pause le cap de lu e·l pietz pus autz que las partidas dejos.	But when the incision is wide, and it is in the lower part of the belly, then it is covered that you make the patient lie on their back, and place their legs higher than their head; and if it is in the upper part of the belly, then you place the head of them and the feet higher than the middle parts.
E semblantment si la disrupcio es en una de las doas partz del ventre, lahoras pausa la tua entencio e la tua consideracio tostemps en aysso per que la partida en la qual es la plagua sia pus auta que l’autra.	And similarly if the incision is in one of the two parts of the belly, then you place your attention and your consideration always in this way so that the part in which the wound is is higher than the other.
E ayssi cove que tu aministres aquo en las plaguas grans e en las plaguas migieras.	And thus it is covered that you administer this in the large wounds and in the mid-line wounds.
E en las plaguas petitas, pausa aquo que es a tu preparat, e aprop fay que·l ministre sia entre las tuas mas pyatados, le qual tengua la disrupcio tota am la sua ma e ajusta las labias de lu, e aprop descuebre de aquela ad aquel que siec la sutura alcuna causa aprop autra.	And in the small wounds, place what is prepared to you, and make it minister between your fingers, which has the incision all with its hand and adjusts the lips of it, and then uncover from that to the one who sees the suture any cause from another.
E aquesta es la manieyra de sutura comuna: una que prenguas la agula, o comte de agula segon la cantitat de la amplitut de la plagua; e aprop layssa de la extremitat de la disrupcio del dit anular, e strenh la agula una, otre que tu no metas fiel en las doas extremitatz de la codena, am doas extremitatz del ciphac que es dejos la codena de las partidas dedintz, entro que fassas aquela penetrar de aquela partida; e tu ja has agreguadas doas extremitatz de la codena e doas extremitatz del ciphac, e so faytas quatre ordes.	And this is the manner of common suture: one that you take the needle, or count of needle according to the quantity of the amplitude of the wound; and then lay it from the extremity of the incision of the ring finger, and strengthen the needle one, or other that you do not put thread in the two extremities of the cord, with two extremities of the  cyphac that is left the cord of the parts of the fingers, until you make that penetrate from that part; and you have already added two extremities of the cord and two extremities of the cyphac, and are made four orders.
E aprop strenh am fiel doble en le circuit de la agula, e alcunas veguadas de doas partz ensemps, e aprop agregua las doas labias e la plagua per agreguacio decent; e aprop layssa la grossitut del dit e fiqua una autra agulha en aquela, e aprop lia aquela am fiel ayssi cum fiest am la primieyra agulha; e no cesses far aquo si es necessitat am las agulhas entro que ajas complida tota la contriccio de la plagua.	And then strengthen with thread double in the circuit of the needle, and sometimes of two parts together, and then add the two lips and the wound by decent addition; and then lay the thickness of the finger and fix another needle in it, and then tie that with thread as fast as the first needle; and do not cease to do this if it is necessary with the needles until you have completed the entire constriction of the wound.
E sian las agulhas migieras entre groceza e subtilitat, quar las agulhas subtils mot leugierament insciden la carn; e las grossas so de dificil intrament en la codena, e donc per aquo cove que sian migieras en subtilitat e grosseza.	And be the needles mid-sized between thickness and subtlety, because the subtle needles lightly cut the flesh; and the thick ones are difficult to enter into the cord, and therefore for that they must be mid-sized in subtlety and thickness.
E no cove que la agulha sia ficada en doas extremitatz de la codena propdana mot, per so que la carn no sia inscidida leugierament e que la plagua se huebra devant la sua consolidacio.	And do not cover that the needle be placed in two extremities of the cord properly not, so that the flesh is not lightly incised and that the wound heals before its consolidation.
E no sian prolonguadas de sutura per que la plagua no sia prohibida de consolidacio.	And do not be prolonged sutures so that the wound is not prohibited from consolidation.
E aprop inscideys las extremitatz de las agulhas per so que no ledescan le malaute deves le sieu dormier; e pausaras sobre la sutura pulvils expanduts de tota partida, les quals tenguan las extremitatz de las agulhas; e layssa aquelas entro que sapias que la plagua ja es consolidada.	And then cut the extremities of the needles so that they do not hurt the patient's sleep; and place on the suture expanded powders of all parts, which have the extremities of the needles; and leave those until you know that the wound is already consolidated.
E aquestas specias de sutura am agulhas en cal manieyra es pus convenient en las plaguas petitas, quar habasta en la sutura de lor una agulha o doas o entorn aquelas.	And these kinds of suture with needles in this manner is most convenient in the small wounds, because it suffices in the suture of them one needle or two or around those.
Mays la segonda sutura es cominal: e es que tu aministres am sutura las quatre extremitatz, de la codena e doas extremitatz del ciphac, en una veguada, am agulha en la qual sia fiel envolopat engual en subtilitat e grosseza.	But the second suture is common: and it is that you administer with suture the four extremities, of the cord and two extremities of the cyphac, in one go, with a needle in which the thread is enveloped equal in subtlety and thickness.
E aprop quan am la agulha auras penetrat aquestas quatre extremitatz, reduzeys la agulha de aquela meteyssa partida de la qual comensest, per so que le fiel retrayt caja de la pus subirana partida a la plagua, per so que la sutura sia segon sutura de drap am la qual les draps so strengutz.	And when you have penetrated these four extremities with the needle, reduce the needle from that same part from which you began, so that the thread drawn back from the upper part to the wound, so that the suture is like a suture of cloth with which the cloths are tightened.
E pausa entre quascuna sutura la quantitat del gros del dit mendre.	And pause between each suture the quantity of the thickness of the little finger.
E aquesta sutura sabo les homes.	And this suture saves the men.
E am tal sutura yeu cozegui la plagua la qual era accidida a un home en le sieu ventre le qual era stat plaguat am un cotel, e era la disrrumpcio de la plagua major de un palm, e era eyssit dels budels entorn dos palms del budel del mieg loc e era la disrupcio en le mieg del membre; e adonc yeu reduzegui aquel depus que le budel havia stat foro la plagua per xxiiii horas.	And with this suture, I sewed the wound that was inflicted on a man in his belly, which had been plagued with a knife, and the disruption of the wound was greater than a palm, and it was seen from the intestines around two palms of the intestine of the lower part and the disruption was in the middle of the limb; and therefore, I reduced it after that the intestine had been pierced for 24 hours.
E la plagua fo consolidada en le spazi de xv dias o entorn, e curegui aquel e es sanat; e aprop aquo visquec per motz ans, e es conversat en las suas disposicios.	And the wound was consolidated in the space of 15 days or thereabouts, and I cured him and he is healed; and after that, he lived for many years, and he was converted to his dispositions.
E les autres metges havian jutgat que no fora sanat; e per miracle foc, quar yeu no curegui aquel am enguent, quar era en loc en le qual enguent no era atrobat ni deguna medicina, mays pausegui sobre la plagua coto viel dos veguadas lo dia e ablucio assiduo am aygua de mel entro que foc sanat.	And the other doctors had judged that he would not be healed; and by miracle, for I did not cure him with ointment, for it was in a place where ointment was not found nor any medicine, but I placed on the wound a clean cloth twice a day and diligent washing with honey water until he was healed.
Mays yeu diyre dos specias de sutura proprias segon narracio de Paraula.	But I say two kinds of sutures proper according to the narration of Scripture.
E es que tu comenses am sutura de la codena, e entrometas agulha de la partida deforo a la partida dedintz.	And it is that you begin with the suture of the rope, and you insert the needle from the outside part to the inside part.
E donc cum la agulha penetra en la codena e en aquel meteys lacertz segon rectetut e en longetut de tot le cos, e layssa la extremita del ciphac en le qual has entromesa la agulha; e fay penetrar en la autra extremitat la agulha de la partida dedintz a la partida deforo en l’autra extremitat del mihat.	And therefore, as the needle penetrates the rope and in that middle laceration according to rectum and length of the whole body, and leave the extremity of the chip in which you have inserted the needle; and make penetrate in the other extremity the needle from the inside part to the outside part in the other extremity of the middle.
E don cum tu auras fayta aquela penetrar, lahoras tu fay aquela penetrar autra veguada en aquela meteyssa extremitat del mihat de la partida deforo a la partida dedintz; e leyssa la extramitat del ciphac que es en aquest latz, e fay penetrar la agulha en l’autra extremitat de la partida dedintz a la partida deforo.	And therefore, as you have made that penetrate, then you make that penetrate another time in that same extremity of the middle of the outside part to the inside part; and leave the extremity of the chip that is in this place, and make penetrate the needle in the other extremity from the inside part to the outside part.
E fay penetrar am aquela la tua penetracio am la qual fas aquela penetrar en le ciphac en la extremitat del mirat la qual es en la partida de lu entro que tot aquel penetre.	And make penetrate with that one your penetration with which you make that penetrate in the chip in the extremity of the mirror which is in the part of it while all that penetrates.
E aprop comensa de aquest meteys costat e cus aquel am la extremitat que es del ciphac en l’autra latz, e extratz la agulha de la codena la qual penetrec, e aprop redutz aquela en aquela codena e cos la extremitat del ciphac que es en l’autra costat am aquesta extramitat del mirat; e extratz aquela de la codena la qual es de part de lu.	And then, beginning from this same side, sew this with the extremity that is of the chip in the other place, and extract the needle from the rope which penetrated, and then reduce that one in that rope and body the extremity of the chip that is in the other side with this extremity of the mirror; and extract that one from the rope which is of the part of it.
E fay aquo una veguada e autra, e fay aquo una veguada aprop autre veguada entro que tu cozes tot aquo que es deforo segon aquel eysemple.	And make this one time and another, and make this one time after another until you sew all that is outside according to this example.
E la suma de aquesta manieyra de sutura es que tu cozes am sutura de pellicies am la qual cozo las pels, enayssi que tu cozes le ciphac una veguada de la part de la extremitat de la codena, e que leysses aquela autra veguada entro que la ajas complida.	And the sum of this manner of suture is that you sew with suture of pellicles with which you sew the hairs, in this way that you sew the chip one time from the part of the extremity of the rope, and that you leave that other time while you make it completed.
Mays la segonda specia de sutura propria la qual dieys eyssament Gualia , e aquest es de sermo de lu e per lu recomtat, es que tu cozas aquela segon semilitut am la qual alcus medicantz cozo aquela, enayssi que agreguan tota partida a la sua compar partida a lu convenient per natura; e aplican la extremitat de autre de lu e la extremitat del mirat al autra extremitat de lu, e aquo es fayt segon que yeu a tu recomti.	But the second kind of proper suture which I call Gualia, and this is of service to it and by it recommended, is that you sew it according to similarity with which some medicants sew it, in this way that they join all part to its corresponding part to it convenient by nature; and apply the extremity of one of it and the extremity of the mirror to the other extremity of it, and this is done according to what I recommend to you.
Cove que tu fiques la agulha en la extremitat del mirat a tu propdana de la partida deforo, e fassas aquela penetrar a la partida dedintz en aquel sol, e leysses dos extremitatz del ciphac; e aprop revolveys la agulha e fay aquela penetrar de foro a la dedintz en dos extremitatz del ciphac.	Cover that you put the needle in the extremity of the mirror to your own from the outside part, and make that penetrate to the inside part in that same one, and leave two extremities of the chip; and then, turn the needle and make that penetrate from outside to inside in two extremities of the chip.
E aprop revolveys aquelas cascunas, e fay penetrar quascunas de la partida dededintz entro a la partida deforo en dos extremitatz del mirat autras que so en le latz contrari.	And then, turn those each one, and make penetrate each one from the inside part into the outside part in two extremities of the mirror others that are in the opposite place.
E aquesta manieyra de sutura es milhor de la sutura comuna leugiera, e es sutura de la qual precedic rememoracio.	And this manner of suture is better than the common suture lighter, and is the suture of which I previously said remembrance.
Aquest es le sermo de Gualia	This is the sermon of Gualia
E mays le diyssero alcus, sutura del ventre es rectificada am dos agulhas, so es que tu entrometas en aquestas a quascunas un fiel, e comensa am intromiccio de agulha de aquo que es deves tu, e fay aquela penetrar entro al autra latz segon sutura de aquels les quals cozo les cuers engualment.	And more, they said to me, suture of the belly is rectified with two needles, so it is that you insert into these each one a thread, and begin with the introduction of needle of that which you must, and make that penetrate into the other place according to suture of those with which they sew the skins in the same way.
E sapias que quan disrupcio es en le mieg loc del ventre, lahoras la sutura de lu es pus difficil que dels autres locs del ventre.	And know that when the disruption is in the middle part of the belly, then the suture of it is more difficult than of the other parts of the belly.
Mays le juguament de medicacio de plagua es jutgament de las autras plaguas.	But the judgment of medication of the wound is judgment of the other wounds.
La qual causa es quar quan tu consieguas la plagua recent am le sieu sanc denant que l’ayre altera aquela, e reduses le budel e cozes aquela e aptas aquela decentment, lahoras pausa sobre aquela polvera encarnativa.	Which cause is because when you obtain the recent wound with its blood before the air alters it, and reduce the intestine and sew it and adapt it decently, then it rests upon that carnified powder.
E si le ayre ja ha alterada la plagua, lahoras pausa sobre aquela alcus enguentz les quals so a tu presens entro que fassan peyra dura e cajan les fiels, e sian consolidatz ciphac e mirat; e aprop cura aquela ayssi cum es la curacio de las autras plaguas entro que sia sanat.	And if the air has already altered the wound, then it rests upon that some ointments which are at your presence until they make hard and the threads are pulled, and the chip and mirror are consolidated; and then, cure it as is the cure of the other wounds until it is healed.
Mays si a tu no so presens las medicinas, lahoras pausa sobre aquela tantost, pus que comensa a getar brac, coto viel, e permuta aquel dos veguadas le dia, ayssi cum a tu e ensenhat, entro que sia sanat, quar tu no indigeysses de autra medicacio en motas disposicios quan las plaguas so simplas.	But if you do not have the medicines, then pause there for a while, because it begins to sweat, old sweat, and changes that two times a day, just as I have taught you, until it is healed, so that you do not need other medication in many arrangements when the plagues are simple.
Mays si tu temes que la plagua comunique en lesio als membres principals, lahoras cove que tu submergas lana leon en oli de trempada qualiditat, o en oli rozat, e pausa aquela en le circuit dels locs que so entre les angonas e dejos las aysselas.	But if you fear that the plague will communicate to the main limbs, then you must submerge a lion's mane in good quality olive oil, or roasted olive oil, and place that on the area between the armpits and leave the armpits.

Rememoracio de las plaguas quan accideysso en le budel.	Remembering of the plagues when they happen in the intestine.
Quan accideys disrupcio en le budel e es petita, lahoras es possibla que sia resteurada en alcus homes, per aysso quar yeu vi aquel le qual era stat plaguat en le sieu ventre am percussio de lansa et era la plagua de la part dreyta del stomac, e la plagua era antiquada e fayta fistula, e eyssic de lu gestio e ventositat.	When a disruption happens in the intestine and it is small, then it is possible that it may be restored in some men, because I saw that one who was plagued in his belly by a lance thrust and it was the plague on the right side of the stomach, and the plague was old and made a fistula, and it was from him passage and flatulence.

And already some experienced ones have said that when a plague happens in the intestine, and it is small, then it must be bound in this manner: and it is that you take earthworms of large heads; and then adjust the two lips of the plague and place an earthworm of those that has the mouth open over the two lips of the plague; therefore when it grabs onto those and tightens its mouth, cut off its head, because it adheres and is not dissolved.
E aprop pausa autra formigua prop la primieyra, e no cesses aquo a far am formiguas una aprop autra segon la quantitat de tota la plagua. And it is already possible that the intestine may be bound with a subtle file which is made of the intestine of a beast annexed to it, because it is more in a needle; and it is that you take the extremity of these files of intestine, and it be well skinned, and then bind the extremity of it with a file of linen, enveloped, and then introduce that file into needles and cover with it the intestine, and reduce that in the disruption.
E aquesta manieyra de sutura am formiguas no es sino segon via de fiducia e d’esperansa.	And this manner of suturing with earthworms is not but according to a way of trust and of hope.

De curacio de zuchem e fistula.	Of the cure of zoster and fistula.
Sapias que tota plagua e apostema quan se envilheseys e se Antiqua, e es fayt ulcus, e no es consolidat e geta braç tot temps e no es abscindit, lahoras, en qualque membre sia, universalment es nompnada fistula e nos la apelam aquela azukem.	Know that every plague and abscess when it is inflamed and becomes old, and is made an ulcer, and is not consolidated and sweats all the time and is not cut off, then, in whatever member it may be, universally it is called a fistula and we call that one zoster.
E fistula segon veritat es nodacio feutrada, dura, blanqua am la qual no es dolor e a la qual es conquavitat ayssi cum es conquavitat de pena de ausel; e per aysso nompnat aquela alcus rizatz, id est pena.	And fistula according to truth is a hard, white, furrowed nodule, with which there is no pain and which has a cavity like the cavity of a bird's bone; and for this reason, that one is called by some "rizatz," that is, bone.
E es en alcus homes humida, la qual geta brac; e fort leu la humiditat es abscidida en alcunas horas.	And it is in some men humid, which sweats; and very soon the humidity is cut off in some hours.
E alcunas veguadas aquesta humiditat es mota, e es pauca, e es grossa, e es subtil.	And some times this humidity is much, and is little, and is thick, and is subtle.
E yeu ja he denant dit en la divisio, lahoras cum yeu diyssi las plaguas, que tot ulcus que no es sanat ni no es en lu nuda carn, no es aquo sino per una de ix causas: de las quals la una es o per pauquesa de sanc en le cos; o per malicia de lu; o quar entre lu e las labias es carn dura prohibent nativitat de carn; o quar es de mota legesa; o quar aquel ulcus en si meteys es poyrit e la materia que es a lu tramesa es de mala qualitat; o quar la medicina es enconvenient en la curacio de lu; o quan corrupcio catz en la regio, e es pestilencia; o per proprietat de regio ayssi cum endeve a Saragossa , en la qual es fayta difficil degestio de las malautias, e es tardada en aquela sanacio de apostema per natura; o quar en lu es os un, o motz osses.	And I have already said in the division, then as I said the plagues, that every ulcer that is not healed nor is in naked flesh, it is not this but for one of these causes: of which one is or because of the lack of blood in the body; or because of the malice of it; or because between it and the lips is hard flesh prohibiting the birth of flesh; or because it is of much legesa; or because that ulcer in itself puts itself is putrid and the matter that is to it transmitted is of bad quality; or because the medicine is inconvenient in the cure of it; or when corruption catches in the region, and it is pestilence; or by property of region as it happens in Zaragoza, in which it is made difficult digestion of the diseases, and is delayed in that healing of abscess by nature; or because in it is a bone, or many bones.

E cove assi que yeu fassa a tu saber la curacio de fistula la qual es fayta per via de operacio am ma.	And so that I may make known to you the cure of a fistula which is made by way of operation with a knife.
E sapias que fistula accideys en totz les membres del cos; quar de aquelas son fistulas que perveno a las venas grantz e arterias, o als nervis, o al ciphac, o al budel, o a la vesica, o ad alcuna de las costas, o ad alcu dels spondils del dos, o ad alcuna de las juncturas compostas per composicio ayssi quo de la ma e del pe; e de aquelas so que dan a lu propinquitat del membre principal e de semblantz.	And know that fistulas occur in all the members of the body; for some of them are fistulas that reach the great veins and arteries, or the nerves, or the skull, or the intestine, or the bladder, or any of the ribs, or any of the vertebrae of the spine, or any of the joints composed by composition as such that from the hand and the foot; and those that give to them proximity of the main member and of similar things.

And therefore of these fistulas that are according to this manner are of the diseases of difficult healing, and do not receive cure, and occupation with that is work and ignorance.
