And it was not necessary to iterate in the operation of him and the section of him, but for the disposition of the fragility of him and for the paucity of his tolerance and fear of death, because to him it happened at all hours for superfluity of evacuation syncope evil.
E donc sanat es per sanacio entiera, e nada es en loc de os carn dura; e es fayta bona la disposicio de lu en le sieu cors e retornec la vertut de lu; e es conversat en las suas disposicios e no fec a lu contrarietat en ambulacio ni nocument en denguna causa.	And therefore, it healed by entire healing, and nothing is in the place of bone, hard flesh; and it is made good the disposition of him in his body and returned the virtue of him; and it is converted in his dispositions and did not make to him contrariety in ambulation nor harm in any cause.
Mays si es os eminent en loc del cors ja trauquat, lahoras cove que tu secces aquel segon aquesta manieyra: e es que tu prenguas liament e strenh aquel en la extremitat de aquel os eminent, e comanda ad alcu que extenda aquel en sus; e pausa aquel liament de lana pus gros del primier liament; e aprop lia aquel sobre la carn que es dejos le os, e exten la extramitat de lu per que atires la carn a las partidas dejos, e tu descuebras la carn sobre le loc le qual voles serrar per que la serra no leda la carn.	But if the bone is eminent in the place of the body already drawn, then when you cut that according to this manner: and that is that you take a ligament and strengthen that in the extremity of that eminent bone, and command to someone that extends that upward; and place that ligament of wool thicker than the first ligament; and then tie that over the flesh that is left the bone, and extend the extremity of it so that you stretch the flesh to the parts below, and you uncover the flesh over the place which you want to sew so that the saw does not injure the flesh.
E pausa fust o taula dejos le os decentment, quar quan tu fas aquo no es prohibida la serra que no secce la carn corrumpuda.	And place a board or table below the bone decently, for when you do this, it is not forbidden the saw that does not cut the corrupted flesh.
E cove que sia la serradura sobre le loc corrumput petit a petit, quar si es en la concavitat del os corrupcio e no appar en la sua apparicio al sentiment, e forssa a serratura de lu autra veguada.	And cove that the sawing be upon the corrupted place little by little, for if it is in the concavity of the bone corruption and does not appear in its appearance to the touch, and force the sawing of it another time.
E si le os es corrumput e no-eminent, abantz es la una partida continuada am la autra, e la corrupcio es al mieg loc o en partida de lu, lahoras tu descuebre la carn de totas partz tota; e aprop pausa fust dejos, e aprop serra aquel de la primiera partida la on es la corrupcio entro que sia continuada la serratura del autra partida.	And if the bone is corrupted and not eminent, it abates one part continued with the other, and the corruption is in the middle place or in a part of it, then you uncover the flesh of all parts altogether; and then place a board below, and then saw that of the first part where the corruption is until the sawing is continued of the other part.
E sia la serradura segon le loc de la corrupcio un petit, segon que havem dit.	And be the sawing according to the place of the corruption a little, as we have said.
E si la corrupcio es en la junctura, inscideys aquela junctura corrumpuda, e serra le os la on es continuat del autra part.	And if the corruption is in the joint, incise that corrupted joint, and saw the bone where it is continuous from the other part.
E si de la corrupcio es en la continuacio de doas juncturas, lahoras no es en lu razio sino engen.	And if the corruption is in the continuation of two joints, then it is not in it reason but engine.
E si la corrupcio es en le pecte de la ma o del pe, es mot dificil; empero cove que tu inquieras la corrupcio en qual manieyra appareys a tu, e que abradas aquela, e mondes aquela segon quascuna disposicio la qual es a tu possibla, e am cascum engen sia rectificat a tu, quan no fa a tu contrarietat vena o nervi.	And if the corruption is in the breast of the hand or foot, it is very difficult; however, as you inquire about the corruption in what manner it appears to you, and that you open it, and cleanse it according to each disposition which is to you possible, and in each case, let it be rectified to you, when it does not make to you contrariety vein or nerve.
E sapias qual es inscididors e las serras a inscidir aquestz osses son motz segon le situament dels osses, e la preparacio de aquels, e la grosseza de aquels, e la subtilitat e la grandeza e la parvitat de aquels, e la duricia e la lor raritat; per que cove que tu prepares a tota specia de operacio estrument convenient ad aquela opperacio.	And know which are the saws and the chisels to cut these bones are very much according to the situation of the bones, and the preparation of those, and the thickness of those, and the subtlety and the greatness and the smallness of those, and the hardness and their rarity; for that whenever you prepare to all species of operation instrument convenient to that operation.
E sapias que aquela operacio significa a tu sobre la specia del strument del qual indigeysses; quan am tu es gran studi e lonc e conoyssensa de las manieyras de aquesta art, e testimoni de manieyras de malautias, quar lahoras ja tu las avias per tu meteys aquo que es convenient a lu dels sturmentz a tota malautia.	And know that that operation signifies to you about the species of the instrument of which you indigeysses; when with you is great study and long and connoisseurship of the ways of this art, and testimony of ways of maladies, for that hour already you had by you that which is convenient to him of the instruments to all malady.
E yeu so a tu formant en la fi de aquest capitol le nombre dels instrumentz les quals pausaras cum eyssimples am les quals proceziras a la tua prohibicio la qual experimentaras sobre las autras.	And you so to you forming at the end of this chapter the number of the instruments the which you will put as simple with the which you will proceed to your prohibition the which you will experiment on the others.
Forma de serra:	Shape of saw:
Forma de autra serra:	Shape of other saw:
Forma de autra serra:	Shape of another saw:
Forma de autra serra gran:	Shape of another large saw:
Forma de ray:	Shape of chisel:
Sia le cap de aquest ray segon la forma de cap de clau stellat, e les puntz de lu sian segon la forma dels puntz alstefegi.	Let the head of this chisel be according to the shape of the head of a star-shaped key, and the points of it be according to the shape of the points of the awl.
E no conveneys sino que am aquel sian confricadatz les caps de las juncturas quan so corrumpudas, o es la boca gran ampla.	And it does not convene but that with that [the chisel] they be confractured the heads of the joints when they are corrupted, or is the mouth wide and ample.
Forma de razori major dels autres:	Shape of a razor larger than the others:
Forma de razori menor:	Shape of a smaller razor:
Forma de razori lat:	Shape of a broad razor:
Forma de serra autra decentment fayta: sia fayt arc de lu pus sobira e la acuitat de lu de ferr, e le membre de lu de boys punhal descentment fayt.	Shape of another saw decently made: let it be made with an arch of it as much as possible and the sharpness of it of iron, and the member of it of a boy's dagger decently made.
Forma de lu:	Shape of it:
Forma de razori en la qual ha concavitat:	Shape of a razor which has a concave:
Forma de razori autra subtil:	Shape of another subtle razor:
Forma de autra razori de curvada extremitat:	Shape of another razor of curved extremity:
Forma de rasori petit semblant a tenta:	Shape of a small razor resembling a tentacle:
Forma de incisori am le qual so inscidit les osses:	Shape of an incisor with which the bones are cut:
Forma de inscisori autra minor:	Shape of another, smaller incisor:
Forma de un autra inscissori; aquest semblant a ray, e la extremitat de lu es cum serra, e es exhibit en motz locs en la razio dels osses:	Shape of another incisor; this one resembling a chisel, and the extremity of it is like a saw, and it is exhibited in many places in the marrow of the bones:
Forma de ray lo qual conveneys a rasio de aquel que es perforat dels osses:	Shape of a chisel which is convenient to the marrow of those bones which are perforated:
E la extremitat de lu es triangulada e de aguda extremitat.	And the extremity of it is triangular and of a sharp extremity.
E es fayt de ferr de India , e semblantment cove que totas las causas que havem ditas de rasoris e de inscissoris e de serras.	And it is made of Indian iron, and similarly as all the causes that we have said of razors and incisors and saws.
De inscizio extremitatz e de la serratura dels osses.	Of incision extremities and the serration of the bones.
Las extremitatz se poyresso o per causa intrinseca o per causa extrinseca, o cum tu auras medicat aquela corrupcio per curacio de aquelas medicinas e la curacio no comfereys, o vezes la corrupcio anar deves le membre la qual no percuteys denguna causa, lahoras cove que tu inscidas aquel membre entro aquo la hon acossec la corrupcio, per que le malaute evasesca per aquo de mort o de malicia que es major defeliment del membre.	The extremities can be either by intrinsic cause or by extrinsic cause, or as you will have medicated that corruption by cure of those medicines and the cure does not convene, or sometimes the corruption goes from the member which you do not strike any cause, then when you incis that member into that which the hon acossec the corruption, so that the patient escapes by that of death or malice which is a greater defect of the member.
E le senhal de aquel al qual accideys, es que·l membre es fayt negre entro que sia cujat que foc la ja comburit, o se poyreys aprop la negror entro que la poyredura aquela ane entro aquel membre que siec lu e que prengua tot le cors; e donc coyta te am inscizio de aquel.	And the sign of him to whom it happens, is that the member is made black before it is cured that fire has already burned it, or it may be approached the blackness before the puss of that one enters into that member that it seizes it and that it nourishes all the body; and therefore, take care to incision of that.
E semblantment si es causa de la corrupcio percussio de alcunas causas venenosas ayssi cum de scorpio mari o de vupera o de rutela e de semblantz.	And similarly if it is a cause of the corruption by percussion of some venomous causes as well as from a sea scorpion or from a viper or from a similar one.
E si la corrupcio o la percussio es en la extremitat del dit, lahoras tu inscideys le dit e no dones spazi a la corrupcio per que ane entro a la ma.	And if the corruption or the percussion is in the extremity of the finger, then you incise the finger and do not give space to the corruption so that it enters into the hand.
E semblantment si accedeys a la ma, lahoras tu inscideys aquela de la razit del focil, e no dones spazi a la corrupcio entro que prengua en le focil del bras.	And similarly if it happens to the hand, then you incise it from the root of the wrist, and do not give space to the corruption so that it nourishes in the wrist of the arm.
E si envezeys aquel, lahoras inscideys le bras entro al coyde en la junctura.	And if instead of that, then incise the arm into the armpit at the joint.
E si passa otra la corrupcio e la vezes enviro le coyde, lahoras en aquel es la mort del malaute; e aministrar autra causa otra aquo en curacio es quantitat de vertut.	And if instead of that, the corruption passes and sometimes encircles the armpit, then in that is the death of the patient; and administer another cause another for that cure is a quantity of virtue.
E semblantment fay del pe quan corrupcio envezeys le dit del pe, lahoras tu inscideys aquel entro ad un dels nozes.	And similarly do of the foot when corruption encircles the toe of the foot, then you incise it into one of the toes.
E si pren en la pente del pe, lahoras tu inscideys tot le pe.	And if it takes in the heel of the foot, then you incise the whole foot.
Mays si pueja entro al denol, lahoras tu inscideys la camba entro a la junctura del denol.	But if it enters into the thigh, then you incise the thigh into the junction of the thigh.
E si la corrupcio ja es pervenguda sobre le denol, lahoras en lu no es engen sino dimissio, e layssar le malaute a la mort.	And if the corruption has already reached the thigh, then in it there is no engendered but dismissal, and leave the patient to death.
E la manieyra de inscidir le membre o de serrar lu es que tu strenhas le liament en la partida pus dejos la qual voles inscidir, e strenh autre liament sobre le loc; e extenda le ministre un liament a las partidas dejos, e extenda le ministra autra liament en sus; e tu separa la carn la qual es entre dos liamentz ain spatum lat entro que sia descuberta tota la carn; e aprop sia inscidit o serrat.	And the manner of incising the member or of sawing it is that you strengthen the ligament in the part furthest from which you want to incise, and strengthen another ligament over the place; and extend the minister a ligament to the parts below, and extend the minister another ligament above; and you separate the flesh which is between two ligaments, then a broad spatula, so that all the flesh is uncovered; and then it is incised or sawed.
E cove que sia pausat drap de li de totas partidas per so que no toque le loc sa, e que vengua al malaute lesio ajustada e apostema caut.	And so that it be placed cloth of it from all parts so that it does not touch the area, and that it comes to the patient lesion adjusted and cauterized abscess.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc quan obras, lahoras tu cauteriza le loc coytadament, o pausa sus lu alcunas polveras restrenhentz le sanc; e aprop retorna a la tua medicacio entro que sia complida.	But if blood flow occurs when working, then you cauterize the area carefully, or place on it some powders that restrain the blood; and then return to your medication before it is complete.
E aprop lia le membre plaguat am liament al u convenient, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And then bind the affected limb to the one convenient, and care for it until it is healed.
E yeu recomti a tu aquo que endevenc a un home en le sieu pe, aquest meteys accident le qual yeu e a tu recomtat, le qual es quar accidic a lu negror en le sieu pe am adustio que era asemblada a combustio de foc.	And I recommend to you that which befalls a man in his foot, this same accident which I have told you, which is that a blackness occurs to him in his foot with a burning that was assembled like the burning of fire.
E aquela corrupcio accidic primierament en le sieu dit entro que tendec tot le pe.	And that corruption occurs first in his toe before it extends to the whole foot.
E adonc aquel home preparec per si meteys pus que vic la curacio anar al membre am la vehemencia de lu que atrobec de dolor e de adustrio de lu, e el inscidic aquel pe entro a la junctura, e foc sanat.	And therefore that man prepares himself to put on himself pus that he sees the cure going to the member with the vehemence of it that it atrophies from pain and burning of it, and the insidious foot goes into the joint, and fire heals.
Lonc temps accidic a lu aquela meteyssa corrupcio en le dit de la ma indic.	Long time occurs to it that same corruption in the toe of the hand I indicated.
E adonc venc a mi, e so me perforsat repercutir aquela superfluitat am aquo que pausegui sobre la ma de las medicinas, aprop la mundificacio del cos de lu; e no es repercussa la superfluitat e comensec anar al autra dit entro que comensec en la ma.	And therefore it comes to me, and so I am pierced to repercuss that superfluity with what I place over the hand of the medicines, and then the purification of the body of it; and it does not repercuss the superfluity and it begins to go to the other toe before it begins in the hand.
E el apelec me a inscidir la ma de lu, e yeu no volgui far aquo sperant sobre la repercussio de aquela superfluitat, e mays que temegui deves la inscizio de la ma de lu mort, quar la vertut del malaute era sobre cazement.	And he implores me to cut his hand, and I do not want to do that hoping on the repercussion of that superfluity, and more that I fear that the incision of his hand will be death, because the virtue of the malady was over the case.
E pus que el se desperec de mi, es retornat en la sua terra e pervenguec a mi que aquel home preparec e inscidic la sua ma tota, e es sanat.	And because he departed from me, he returned to his land and I came to know that that man prepared and cut his hand entirely, and he was healed.
E no he adhuzida aquesta narracio sino per que sia adjutori sobre aquo que catz de aquesta malautia, e que sia significacio per la qual sia significada e segon la qual sia obrat.	And I have not added this narration except so that it be an aid on that which catches of this malady, and that its signification by which it is signified and according to which it is acted.
De cura sinuum et qualitate clisterizationis cum medicinis.	Of the cure of the intestines and the quality of clysters with medicines.
Quan accideys apostema en alcus membres carnozes e·l spazi de l’apostema es prolonguat entro que fa colleccio de sania, e aprop es romput e perforat, e es eyssida de lu la sania, e roman le loc vuoyt quays cum si era vayssel, e la codena que es desobre lu ayssi cum drap subtiliat, e no es pervengut a deriera corrupcio, e no inprimeys en le os o en nervi ni en liament, es apelat sinu, e no es nompnat fistula.	When an abscess occurs in certain fleshy members and the space of the abscess is prolonged until it makes a collection of pus, and then it is ruptured and perforated, and pus is extracted from it, and the place remains empty as if it were a vessel, and the skin that is above it is as fine cloth, and it has not reached the back corruption, and has not imprinted on the bone or on the nerves or on the ligament, it is called a sinus, and it is not named a fistula.
Mays empero si le spazi es prolonguat entro que la corrupcio enprema en alcun membre, lahoras es appelada fistula e no zukem.	But however if the space is prolonged until the corruption presses on some member, then it is called a fistula and not a sinus.
E la cura de lu es que inscidas aquela codena tota ayssi cum es revolvut, e majorment quan es subtiliada e es fayta cum drap, e comfizas que no adhereys al loc per la sua corrupcio.	And the cure of it is that you cut that skin entirely as if it were revolved, and mostly when it is fine and made like cloth, and that it does not adhere to the place because of its corruption.
Mays si tu speras que la codena adheresca e que aquela corrupcio no aja conseguit per deriera consecucio, e en la codena ha spassitut de cara, lahoras tu cura aquel am clisteri.	But if you hope that the skin adheres and that that corruption has not achieved a posterior consequence, and in the skin there has passed through the front, then you cure that with clysters.
E es que consideras al sinu, e lahoras si es gran, e·l brac que yeys es de fetent odor, lahoras clisteriza aquel am medicament egipciac le qual es de oli e vi agre e ziniar recebent partidas enguals, e sian ajustadas en un vayssel, e sian coytas sobre le foc entro que’l medicament se fassa rog e pervengua a specitut de mel.	And it is that you consider the sinus, and then if it is large, and the brac that you see is of a fetid odor, then you clysterize that with Egyptian medicine which is of oil and strong wine and ziniar receiving equal parts, and they are placed in a vessel, and they are boiled over the fire until the medicine becomes thick and reaches the consistency of honey.
E aprop tu pren de lu aquo que es necessari e dissolveys lu am aygua e mel; e clisteriza am aquel le sinu, e strenh le orrifici de lu, e layssa la medicina en lu per la quantitat de doas horas.	And then you take from it what is necessary and dissolve it with water and honey; and clysterize with that the sinus, and strengthen the orifice of it, and leave the medicine in it for the quantity of two hours.
E aprop extratz aquela am sprecio; e fay aquo per tantz dias entro que sia mundificat le sinu e sia remauguda la pudor.	And then you extract that with a spoon; and do this for so many days until the sinus is purified and the stench is removed.
E alcunas veguadas es clisterizat am aygua de cendre, quan no es a tu prezent aquest medicament; e es que tu prenguas la cendra de vitz, e met sobre lu aygua; e aprop cola aquela e clisteriza aquel am ela entro que te confizes que·l sinu lahoras es ostat.	And sometimes it is clysterized with ash water, when the medicine is not present to you; and it is that you take the ash of vitz, and put water over it; and then you boil that and clysterize with it until you confess that the sinus is then healed.
E si le malaute no ha tollerancia sobre le medicament egipciac ni l’aygua de la cendre, lahoras clisteriza aquel am aygua e mel e quays sia mesclat ziniar trissat, e clisteriza aquel am vi e mel mesclat, quar de proprietat de mel es que mondifique e lave, e le vi fa adherir le sinu, e majorment quan en le vi ha superfluitat de stipticitat e de siccitat.	And if the patient does not have tolerance on the Egyptian medicine or the ash water, then clysterize that with water and honey and that it be mixed with crushed ziniar, and clysterize that with wine and honey mixed, because of the property of honey is that it purifies and washes, and the wine makes the sinus adhere, and especially when in the wine there is superfluity of astringency and dryness.
E cum tu fas aquo alcunas veguadas e te comfizes que·l sinu ja es remaugut, lahoras clisteriza aquel am aquo que fa naysser la carn en lu.	And as you do this sometimes and you confess that the sinus is already removed, then clysterize that with water that makes the flesh grow in it.
E es que prenguas de enguent dyafinicon e dissolveys aquel am oli rozat e vi stiptic; o que clisterizas aquel am alcunas medicinas e enguentz autres que hajan las proprietatz les quals ja he yeu scritz en le tractat dels enguents.	And it is that you take of  dyafinic  and dissolve it with roasted oil and astringent wine; or that you clysterize that with some medicines and other enguents that have the properties of which I have already written in the treatise of the enguents.
E si le orrifici del sinu es streyt en le qual no es recebuda la canula del clisteri, lahoras tu le amplifique aquel am ferr petit a petit, e pausa en lu calgua envolopada en enguent egipciac o en enguent basilicon entro que sia amplificat.	And if the orifice of the sinus is narrow in which the clyster nozzle is not received, then you enlarge that with a small iron little by little, and put in it a poultice enveloped in Egyptian enguent or basilicon enguent until it is enlarged.
E semblantment si le orrifici es ample, lahoras tu agregua las labias de lu am sutura e layssa de lu quantitat en la qual intre le clisteri ses addicio.	And similarly if the orifice is wide, then you add the lips of it with sutures and leave of it the quantity in which between the clyster there is addition.
E si le orrifici de lu del qual corr le brac es elevat a las partidas desus, lahoras secca aquel en le pus bas loc que es en lu per que le brac corra entro dejos, quar quan le brac es coartat en la preondeza de sinu la carn esser en lu engendrada.	And if the orifice of him from which the arm comes is elevated to the parts above, then dry that in the lowest place that is in him so that the arm runs below, for when the arm is constricted in the depth of the sinew the flesh is generated in it.
E si no es a tu possible seccar le sinu entro al enviro del os pus bas segon que voles, lahoras te perforssa que prepares le membre am preparacio per la qual corr de lu le brac leugierament segon que es a tu apparelhat e que no sia en lu retengut alcuna causa del brac.	And if it is not possible for you to dry the sinew within the environment of the lowest bone according to your will, then pierce it so that you prepare the limb with the preparation by which the arm runs lightly according to what is fitted to you and that no cause of the arm be retained in it.
E pren medicinas consolidativas que sian pausadas sobre le sinu convenientz ad aquo que vols exxten aquelas sobre drap de li.	And take solidifying medicines that are placed on the sinew convenient to that which you want, extend those on a piece of cloth.
E le drap sia de tan gran quantitat cum fa la comunicacio de tot le sinu; e aprop inscidey am las forfexs en le dreyt del orrifici del sinu un trauc pus ample un pauc que l’orrifici del sinu; e aprop exten sobre autre drap de li dels enguentz leons segon la quantitat del trauc, e pausa le sobre aquel per posicio longinqua del orrifici del sinu per que sia aleujat le eyssiment del brac de lu e no ostes le drap gran sino aprop alcus dyas una veguada.	And the cloth be of such a quantity as it makes the communication of the whole sinew; and then cut with the scissors in the right of the orifice of the sinew a tract more ample a little than the orifice of the sinew; and then extend over another cloth of the lion's wool according to the quantity of the tract, and place it over that by a long position from the orifice of the sinew so that it be removed the swelling of the arm from it and do not show the great cloth but a little after some days once.
Mays aquel que es sobre le orrifici del sinu, le qual remauguas en tota hora per so que yesca aquo que es ajust en lu del brac.	But that which is over the orifice of the sinew, the which you remove every hour so that what is adjusted in it of the arm may escape.
E per que sapias si aquo que corr de lu del brac es mot o pauc, o es digest, o es no-digest.	And so that you know if what runs from the arm is much or little, or is digested, or is not digested.
E am aysso tu considera le loc de aquel sinu, si en lu sent le pacient dolor o no, e si es en lu apostema.	And thus you consider the place of that sinew, if in it the patient feels pain or not, and if it is in it an abscess.
E cum la tua medicacio es prolonguada en la tal manieyra, e vesas la matiera que es gitada sobre le orrifici del sinu ja adhereys, o se apropria adherencia, lahoras le mayti tu le deslia o le tertz dia, e quan deslias la plagua, lahoras muda le drap per autre e renova le enguent.	And as your medication is prolonged in this manner, and you see the matter that is thrown over the orifice of the sinew already adheres, or approximates adhesion, then the third day you untie it, and when you untie the poultice, then change the cloth for another and renew the enguent.
Mays si del sinu aprop lon spazi yeys virus subtil, lahoras no te desperes de la adherencia de li, quar la sanacio de lu se apropria, quar so alcus homes en les quals tarda generacio de carn en las lors plaguas, e de aquels so en les quals es fayt le contrari de lu.	But if from the sinew a long space appears a subtle virus, then do not despair of its adhesion, for the healing of it approaches, for some men in whom a late generation of flesh in their wounds, and of those it is done the contrary of it.
E si del sinu aprop motz dias es yssit brac indigest, lahoras sapias que·l sinu no adhereys; e si es tardada la adherencia del sinu e es la causa prolonguada, lahoras tu ajusta en exsiccacio de las medicinas, e si las medicinas so humidas en lor substancia e en la sua vertut, son seccas ayssi cum enguent dyafinicon, quan es en lu ajustada superfluitat de addicio de zegi.	And if from the sinew after many days a digested arm is emitted, then know that the sinew does not adhere; and if the adhesion of the sinew is delayed and is the prolonged cause, then you adjust in the drying of the medicines, and if the medicines are humid in their substance and in their virtue, they are dried as a diaphana enguent, when in it is adjusted superfluity of addition of zegi.
E le mays derier am le qual es curat, es que prenguas de enguent dyafinicon e sia dissout en oli rozat, e sia sobre lu vojat vi antic engual en la sua substancia, e aprop comfeys aquel am lu, e usa de aquel.	And the last of the ones cured, is that you take of diaphana enguent and dissolve it in rose oil, and on it pour a little wine vinegar in its substance, and then mix that with it, and use of that.
E ja fa semblant en aquela accio, quan no y a brac, enguent dyafinicon, mel quan es coyt entro que sia engrossat, e usa de lu; o que prenguas mirra e aloen e enses, e trissa tot e polveriza sobre le mel quan es sus le foc, e aprop lineys aquo sobre drap e strenh aquel sobre le sinu; e lineys aquel am le mel le qual has cuoyt entro que es engrossat, e polveriza sobre drap e strenh aquel.	And already it seems in that action, when there is no arm, diaphana enguent, honey when it is cooked until it is thickened, and use of it; or that you take myrrh and aloe and incense, and grind all and pulverize it over the honey when it is on the fire, and then line it with water over cloth and strengthen that over the sinew; and line it with the honey which you have cooked until it is thickened, and pulverize it over cloth and strengthen that.
E alcunas veguadas so administratz am lu aristologia longua e razitz de lili celesti (e es lili celesti) e farina de errs e centaurea, e usa de aquels simples o ajustatz, trissa aquels e cribela e polveriza sobre le mel le qual he recomtat; e husa de lu.	And sometimes are administered with it the long and roots of celestial lily (and it is celestial lily) and flour of wormwood and centaurea, and use of those simples or adjust them, grind them and sift them and pulverize them over the honey which I have recommended; and use of it.
E si es prolonguat le sinu, e no es sanat per aquesta curacio, lahoras sapias que la corrupcio es en le preon de lu, e ja fa enquisicio en les osses o en les autres membres durs o als liaments; lahoras tu le cura am curacio fistular, ayssi cum desus es dit.	And if the sinew is prolonged, and is not healed by this cure, then know that the corruption is in the depth of it, and already make inquiry in the bones or in the other hard members or in the ligaments; then you cure it with fistular cure, as above is said.
De curacio de panarici et unguis attritae et incisione digiti additi et sectione.	Of the cure of panari, and ingrown toenails, and the addition of a finger incision, and section.
Panarici es apostema le qual nays dejos la ungla del dit pous de la ma o del pe, e fort leu nays en les autres ditz, e cum es prolonguat e la sua curacio es mens prezada, o es apostemat de apostema caut, o es corrumput, e gieta brac entro que corrodeys la razitz de la ungla, e fort leu corromp aquela tota, e fort leu perve la sua corrupcio al os entro que es a lu odor fetent, e es fayta la extremitat del dit lada, e la color de lu es fayta fusca.	A panari is an abscess that rises from under the nail of the finger or foot, and it often arises in the other fingers, and as it is prolonged and its cure is less prized, or it is an abscess of a caut abscess, or it is corrupted, and throws out a arm until it corrodes the root of the nail, and often corrupts that whole, and often it transmits its corruption to the bone until it is a fetid odor, and the extremity of the finger is made, and the color of it is made dark.
E donc quan tu auras aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu inscidas am ferr tota la superfluitat que es romasa de la ungla e aprop cauteriza la plagla aprop aquo, quar cauteri mot es juvatiu en aysso.	And therefore when you have that with the water that we have said in the division and do not mix your cure, then you must cut with iron all the superfluity that is remaining from the nail and then cauterize the wound with water, for cauterization is very useful in this.
Mays si le os es sa e la ungla es sana, e las addicios de la ungla vuoydas ja compremen las carns a las partidas dedintz, e comensan lu punger e ledeysso aquela, lahoras cove que tu pauses ray subtil dejos le angle de la ungla que pungeys la carn, e impelleys aquela sus e inscideys aquela carn am facilitat, e pausa sobre aquo que roman de la carn de las medicinas comburentz corrosivas entro que sia tot remaugut; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	But if the bone is sound and the nail is healthy, and the additions of the nail voids already compress the flesh to the sides of the finger, and begin to sting it and let it out, then you must put a fine ray under the angle of the nail that stings the flesh, and push it up and cut that flesh with ease, and place over that which remains of the flesh of the medicines corrosive comburents until it is all removed; and then cure this with enguent until it is healed.
Mays si la corrupcio ja enprem en le os, lahoras cove que tu inscidas le os aquel e le extraguas, car nul temps no es sanat que sia en lu le os corrumput.	But if the corruption has already entered the bone, then you must cut the bone that and extract it, for no time is healed that there is corrupted bone in it.
E si vezes la corrozio e la corupcio anar en le dit, lahoras tu inscideys aquel en un dels nozes segons que es premesa la sua rememoracio, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And if you see the corrosion and corruption going into the wound, then you cut it in one of the nuts according to how it is pressed the memory, and then take care of it while it is healing.
Mays si a la ungla endeve percussio o atricio, e endeve en aquela dolor vehement, lahoras cove que tu al comensament fleubotomes le malaute, e aprop secca la ungla am spatum agut am seccio transversa desus en jus, e guarda te que la seccio no pervengua entro a la carn que es dejos la ungla, quar tu faras accidir al malaute dolor vehement, e sira causa a nativitat de la carn ajustada superflua en le loc; e aprop cura aquel loc am aquo que ceda dolor.	But if the nail is struck or rubbed, and there is pain in that area, then when you begin to treat the patient, you dry the nail with a sharp spatula, making a transverse cut from top to bottom, and be careful that the cut does not reach into the flesh that remains under the nail, because you will cause the patient great pain, and it will be the cause of the birth of excessive flesh in the area; and then take care of that place with water that soothes the pain.
Mays dit ajustat, le qual es nat en las mas de alcus homes, fort leu es carnos tot, e fort leu so en lu osses, o fort leu es en lu ungla.	But this adjusted flesh, which is born in the hands of some men, is very strong in some, very strong in the bones, or very strong in the nail.
E alcus de lu son natz en la razit de la junctura, o es la nativitat de lu en alcus nozes dels ditz.	And some of them are born at the root of the joint, or the birth of them in some of the nuts of the hands.
Mays aquel que es nat en alcus nozes del dit no se mau, e aquest que es nat en las juncturas fort leu es maugut.	But that which is born in some of the nuts of the finger does not harm, and that which is born in the joints is very harmful.
E de aquels que son natz carnoses, la seccio es leugiera, e es que tu inscidas aquel deves la sua razitz am spatum lat.	And of those that are born fleshy, the section is lighter, and that you cut it according to its root with a broad spatula.
Mays de aquel que es nat en la razitz de la junctura, la curacio es dificil; e donc guarda te de la abscizio de lu.	But of that which is born at the root of the joint, the cure is difficult; and therefore beware of the abscess of it.
Mays en aquel que es nat en dit deves les nozes, cove que tu inscidas al comensament la carn de lu am inscizio redonda entro al os, e aprop serra am una de aquelas serras convenientz ad aquo, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	But in that which is born in the finger nuts, when you begin to cut the flesh of it with a round incision into the bone, and then saw it with one of those saws suitable for water, and then take care of it while it is healing.
Mays consolidacio la qual accideys als ditz entre lor motas veguadas o per nativitat del home que nays enayssi, o per consolidacio de plagua o per combustio de foc, o per semblantz, adonc cove que secces aquela consolidacio entro que les ditz retorno a la sua forma natural.	But consolidation which happens to the fingers either between the many movements or by the nature of the man who was born that way, or by the consolidation of plague or by the burning of fire, or by similar things, then you must remove that consolidation while the fingers return to their natural form.
E aprop pausa entre lor draps de li enfuzes en oli rozat per que no sian consolidatz leugierament, e separa entre aquels, o pausa entre aquels una lamina de plom subtil entro que sia consolidat segon que cove.	And place between their cloths, immersed in oil rubbed with a little, so that they are not consolidated lightly, and separate between them, or place between them a thin sheet of lead while it is consolidated as it should.
E semblantment si accideys consolidacio en alcus ditz am la palma, lahoras tu secca aquela consolidacio segon que es preparada e conveneys a la figura del membre.	And similarly if consolidation happens in some fingers with the palm, then you cut that consolidation according to how it is prepared and convenient to the figure of the limb.
De inscizio de vices, so son varicas.	Of incisions of vices, they are varicose.
Vices so son varicas, e so venas envolutas grossas plenas de superfluitatz melencolicas las quals veno en motz dels membres del cors, e le major adveniment de lor en las cambas, e majorment en las cambas dels itinerantz e dels laborantz e dels portantz.	Vices are varicose, and they are veins convoluted thick and full of melancholic superfluities which come in motion in the limbs of the body, and the major advent of them in the legs, and most in the legs of the travelers and the laborers and the carriers.
Adonc cove que tu administres purguacio del cors de colera negra alcunas veguadas am expulcio fort, e aprop sangna le pacient de la vena basilica.	Therefore, you must administer purgatives of black bile some times with strong expulsion, and then bleed the patient from the basilica vein.
Mays la curacio de lor am ferr es segon dos manieyras: la una es que sia inscizas e sia atirat aquel sanc negre, e l’autra manieyra es que sia elevada la vena e sia extrayta tota.	But the cure of them with iron is according to two manners: one is that it is incised and that black blood is thrown out, and the other manner is that the vein is elevated and all of it is extracted.
La seccio de lu es segon aquesta manieyra: embroca al comensament la camba am aygua cauda mot entro que le sanc gros sia resolvut, que es feculent de la camba, e aprop strenh la camba del malaute a la partida pus sobirana de la coyssa entro a la partida dejos del denol am una benda, e aprop secca la vena en un loc, o en dos, o en tres am seccio ampla, e aprop eleva le sanc negra am la tieua ma de la partida dejos de la camba entro en sus, e desus en jus, entro que del sanc sia yssida la quantitat que voles e que vezes habastar, e la qual tollera la vertut del malaute.	The incision of it is according to this manner: first embrocate the leg with warm water so that the thick blood is dissolved, which is feculent of the leg, and then stretch the leg of the patient from the most sovereign part of the groin to the part below the knee with a bandage, and then cut the vein in one place, or two, or three with a wide incision, and then elevate the black blood with your hand from the part below the leg upwards, and downwards, until the quantity of blood that you want and that seems sufficient is extracted, and which will take the virtue of the ailment.
E aprop lia aquela, e comanda a lu que abstengua de las viandas colera negra engendrantz.	And then bind it, and command him to abstain from the foods that engender black bile.
E itera la curacio per fleubotomia quan las venas so umplidas e aquo notz al malaute.	And repeat the cure by phlebotomy when the veins are full and that night to the patient.
Mays la elevacio de lor es segon aquesta manieyra: tu que razas la camba del malaute, si en lu so motz pels, e aprop met le en banh e embroca la camba de lu am aygua cauda entro que s’enrogesesca e las venas sian exuberadas; o que sia exercitat per exercici fort, si banh no es a tu present, entro que·l membre sia scalfat.	But the elevation of them is according to this manner: you that raise the leg of the patient, if in it there are movements, and then put it in a bath and embrocate the leg of it with warm water until it reddens and the veins are exuberant; or that it be exercised by strong exercise, if the bath is not present to you, until the limb is scalded.
E aprop secsa la codena en le dreyt de la vena per seccio en le lonc o en le derier de lu deves le denol, o en le pus bas de lu deves lo talo.	And then cut the vein in the right of it by incision in the long or in the back of it of the knee, or in the lowest part of it of the ankle.
E aprop uobre la codena am uncis e excorja la vena de tota part entro que appara al sentiment, e es deves la appericio de lu que vezes aquela roga declinant a negror.	And then open the vein with pincers and scrape the vein from all parts until it appears to the touch, and it is of the appearance of it that you see that color declining to blackness.
E donc cum evazeys e de la codena tu vezes aquela blanca quays sia corda.	And then when you evacuate and from the vein you see that white that is cord.
E aprop tu met dejos aquela le ray entro que sia elevada e sia gitada de la codena, e sospen aquela am onci orp leon.	And then you put below it the ray until it is elevated and is taken from the vein, and suspend it with a lion's horn or onion.
E aprop secsa autra seccio aprop aquela seccio per tres ditz, e aprop excorja la codena de la partida desus de la vena entro que apparia.	And then cut another incision near that one for three fingers, and then scrape the vein from the part below the vein until it appears.
E aprop eleva aquela e inscideys aquela en deriera seccio deves le talo, e aprop extratz aquela e eleva aquela entro que sia yssida per la seccio segonda, e aprop extratz aquela de la seccio que es sobre aquela.	And then elevate that and cut it in the back incision of the ankle, and then extract that and elevate it until it is extracted by the second incision, and then extract that from the incision that is above it.
E fay aquo entro que extraguas aquela de la seccio que es pus sobirana o pus auta de totas las seccios, entro que tota es yssida; e lahoras inscideys aquela.	And do this until you extract that from the incision that is most sovereign or highest of all the incisions, until all is extracted; and then cut it.
E si no obezeys a tu ad extrayre e elevar, lahoras intromet una agulha am fiel fort doble e ligua aquela e extratz la, o intromet dejos lu le ray e revolveys la tua ma a tota part entro qu’en sia getada.	And if it does not obey to you to extract and elevate, then introduce a needle with a strong double thread and tie it there and extract it, or introduce it below and turn your hand to every part until it is thrown out.
E guarda te que no sia inscidida; quar si es trencada, es fayt a tu dificil elevar aquela mot e es vengut sobre le malaute per aquela nocument.	And guard yourself that it not be incised; for if it is broken, it is made difficult for you to elevate that part and it has come upon the patient for that harm.
E cum aquela tota auras fora-gitada, lahoras pausa sobre le loc de la plagua lana submerssa en vi e oli rozat e oli no-rozat, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And when that whole aura is thrown out, then place over the area of the plague wool soaked in wine and oil rubbed and oil unrubbed, and cure that until it is healed.
E si la vit es contrayta havent tortuositat a la qual sia envolucio a las partidas, e no es segon rectitut segon que havem dit, lahoras cove que tu fendas sobre aquela a tota partida de tortuositat de lu e als locs de envolucio de lu, e aprop suspen aquela am uncis entro que eleves aquela tota.	And if the gut is contracted having tortuosity in which it is wrapped in the parts, and it is not according to rectitude according to what we have said, then cover that which you do on that whole part of tortuosity of it and the places of its wrapping, and then suspend that with hooks until you elevate that whole.
E guarda te deves la tua seccio que no inscidas la vena e que no plagues aquela, quar dificil sira a tu elevar aquela; e serva la tua prudencia en aquela.	And guard yourself that your section that you do not cut the vein and that you do not harm that, for difficult it will be for you to elevate that; and serve your prudence in that.
Forma del inscident am le qual es seccada vit:	Form of the incision with which the gut is cut:
Forma de unci orp:	Form of a hook orp:
No es a lu accuitat ayssi cum als uncis ni es de aguda extremitat per so que no plague la vena; e es de grossa flexibilitat leon, quar si era subtil, inscidira la vena per la sua subtilitat; habantz es en lu superflua grosseza ayssi cum havem dit.	It is not to it pointed like the hooks nor is it of sharp extremity so that it does not harm the vein; and it is of gross flexibility lion, for if it were subtle, it would cut the vein by its subtlety; it has in it superfluous thickness as we have said.
De extraccio venae cruris.	Of extraction of the vein of the leg.
Aquesta vena es engendrada en las cambas en terras caudas ayssi cum al- Ategi en terra de Arabics e en las terras de India caudas e aridas de pauca teneritat e en las quals no nays erba ni aybre.	This vein is generated in the legs in hot lands as in the Ategi in the land of Arabs and in the lands of India hot and arid of little humidity and in which there is no grass nor any shrub.
E fort leu es engendrada en autres locs del cors otra las cambas.	And it is strongly generated in other places of the body other than the legs.
E la gestacio de lu es de putrefaccio que ve dejos la codena ayssi cum venen dedintz le cors serpentz e vermps e scarides e verms engendrantz entre la codena e la carn.	And the gestation of it is of putrefaction that comes from the bone as if venom is from the intestines of the serpent and worms and scarabs and worms that generate between the bone and the flesh.

E adonc cum appar de lu la extremitat, lahoras cove que tu envolvas sobre aquela una pessa de plom del qual sia le pes de una drac. entro a ii drac., e noza aquela e layssa le plom suspendut de la camba.	And therefore when it appears from him the extremity, then you must wrap around that a piece of lead of which the weight is of a dragon. Within two dragons, and no more, and tie that and leave the lead suspended from the leg.
E tantas veguadas cum yeys de lu alcuna causa a las partidas defora, envolveys aquo em plom e noza aquel.	And as many times as you see of it any cause to the parts outside, cover that with lead and bind that.
E si mot es prolonguat, lahoras tu inscideys una partida de lu e envolopa le romanent; e no inscidas aquela de razit entro que sia fora yssida, quar si inscideys aquela es contrayta e intra en la carn e fa accidir apostema e poyredura en le loc e ulceracio mala.	And if the part is prolonged, then you cut a part of it and cover the remaining; and do not cut that of root until it is out, for if you cut that it is contracted and enters into the flesh and causes to occur abscess and purulence in the place and bad ulceration.
Per que cove que sia tractada suaument e sia extrayta petit a petit, entro que sia fora-gitada del derier de lu e no remangua de lu alcuna causa en le cors.	Because that which must be treated gradually and extracted little by little, until it is thrown out from the back of it and no remains of it any cause in the body.
E de aquesta vena es yssit en alcus homes que es en la sua longitut de v palms e de detz e ja es pervengut a mi que yssic un de xx palms.	And of this vein is issued in some men that is in their length of v palms and ten and already has come to me that it issued one of xx palms.
E si es inscidida en la hora de la sua medicacio, lahoras intromet lo ray en le trauc de lu e perfora aquela am lonc trauc am le cors, entro que sia evacuat tot aquo que es en la materia, e administra putrefaccio del loc per alcus dias am medicinas; e aprop cura aquela per la curacio de apostemas.	And if it is incised at the time of its medication, then introduce the ray in the tract of it and perforates that with a long tract with the body, until it is evacuated all that is in the matter, and administer putrefaction of the place for some days with medicines; and then cure that by the cure of abscesses.
E aquesta vena alcunas veguadas ha motz ramps, e majorment quan apar a la junctura del pe o en le pe, e veno a lu motz orrificis, e es yssit de quascu orrifici ram.
