E aquo es per que la ventoza sia umplida e sia pus gran, so es aygua cauda sola o aygua en la qual sian cuytas herbas ad aquo convenientz.	And this is so that the cupping glass is filled and is larger, so it is water poured alone or water in which herbs have been boiled for the purpose appropriate.
Forma de ventoza aministrada am foc: sia la amplitud del orrifici de dos ditz, segon que nos la havem formada; e la quantitat del preon sia la maytat de un palm; e sia en lo latz de lu, en le loc que es en le circuit, la maytat de lu, le trauc sia petit segon la quantitat que intre en lu una agulha.	Form of cupping glass administered with fire: its orifice is two fingers wide, as we have formed it; and the quantity of the resin is the majority of a palm; and it is in the place of it, in the place that is in the circuit, the majority of it, the track is small according to the quantity that enters it a needle.
Sia fayta de eram rog o citri, de grosses marges, leon, enguals e terses per so que no leda le membre deves la sua posicio sobre lu.	Let it be made of a strong, thick, leather, lion, equal and smooth so that it does not damage the limb of its position upon it.
E sia al mieg de lu vergua transversa de eram o de ferr, on es pausada candela am lo foc.	And in the middle of it, a transverse strip of leather or iron, on which a candle is placed with the fire.
E ja sia aquesta ventoza gran major de aquela la qual havem recomtat; e la pauca mendre de aquela segon las malautias e la etat de aquel que usa de aquela.	And already this cupping glass is larger than the one we have described; and the less of it according to the illnesses and the state of the one who uses it.
E las ventosas dels efantz e extenuatz so autres que las ventozas dels joves e de grosses corssas.	And the cupping glasses of the infants and the emaciated are other than the cupping glasses of the young and of robust bodies.
E la qualitat de pausar aquesta ventoza am foc sobre le membre es que extenda la meca am foc de lenha decentment denant una pauca candela de cera, e pausa aquela sobre le mieg de la vergua transversa en le mieg loc de la ventoza, per que le foc sia accendut enviro la partida dejos per que no sia comburit le cors del malaute.	And the quality of placing this cupping glass with fire on the limb is that it extends the fire with wood decently in front of a small candle of wax, and place it on the middle of the transverse strip in the middle place of the cupping glass, so that the fire is ignited around the departed so that the body of the patient is not burned.
E aprop sia pausada sobre le membre del malaute, e le dit sia sobre le trauc que havem dit, entro que quan tenem las ventozas e non indigem que osten le dit e que yesca la vapor sobre aquel trauc, lahoras la ventoza sira tantost dissolvuda.	And then it is placed on the limb of the patient, and the finger is on the track that we have said, because when we have the cupping glasses and do not indicate that we show the finger and that the vapor escapes through that track, then the cupping glass is immediately dissolved.
E prop igneys la meca segon la sua manieyra, e itera aquela si indigeyssas de aquela.	And prop it up the fire according to its manner, and repeat that if it is indicated of it.
Mays en ventosa que es aministrada en la malautia de plauressi, am aygua, en la qual no ha vergua transversa ni trauc, e no es aministrada sino que sia umplida de aygua, e es pausada sobre le membre tant solament.	But in the cupping glass that is administered in the illness of pleurisy, with water, in which there is no transverse strip nor track, and it is not administered unless it is filled with water, and it is placed on the limb alone.
E aquesta es la forma de lu: E aquesta ventoza quant plus es gran, tant es milhor, per que puya recebre gran quantitat de aygua.	And this is the form of it: And this cupping glass as much as it is larger, so much better, because it can receive a large quantity of water.
Capitol .xcvii.	Chapter .xcvii.
Sanguissuguas no so administradas en motz membres sino en les membres en les quals non es possible posicio de ventosas, per la parvitat de aquels, ayssi cum le pot e gingiva e semblantz a lor; o en membre denudat de carn, ayssi cum le dit e·l nas e lors semblantz.	Bloodletting is not administered in most limbs but in the limbs in which it is not possible to position cupping glasses, because of the smallness of those, such as the mouth and gums and similar to them; or in a limb denuded of flesh, such as the finger and the nose and their similar.
E la qualitat de usar de aquelas que si has trobadas sanguisugas que so en las ayguas dossas de poyredura mundas.	And the quality of using those that have been found leeches that are in the waters of muddy ponds.
E aprop sian layssadas le dia e la nueyt en aygua dossa entro que sian famolentas, e que no romangua alcuna causa en le ventre de aquelas; e aprop sia evacuat le cors en le comensament am fleubotomia e am ventozas; e aprop fregua le membre del malaute entro que s’enrojezesca; e aprop sian pausadas sobre lu.	And then they are laid in water in the day and the night until they are famished, and that no cause remains in the belly of those; and then the body is evacuated at the beginning with phlebotomy and with cupping glasses; and then the limb of the patient is rubbed until it reddens; and then they are placed upon it.
E cum son umplidas e caso.	And as they are filled and case.
E si es possible succio del loc am ventoza, es mays derier en juvament.	And if it is possible suction of the place with cupping glass, it is more beneficial in healing.
E sino, lahoras lava le loc am vi agre e aprop am mota aygua; e sia freguat e expremut.	And if not, then the place is washed with strong wine and then with much water; and it is rubbed and squeezed.
E si es prolonguat le cors del sanc aprop le cazement de las sanguissuguas, e es aquo resudan, lahoras tu enfon un drap de li en aygua freja, e pausa aquel de sobre entro que sia abdida la resudacio.	And if the bleeding of the body is prolonged after the placement of the leeches, and this is the result, then you put a cloth of linen in cold water, and place it on top until the bleeding is stopped.
E si le sanc es multiplicat, lahoras polveriza sobre lu vitriol trissat, o guallas e semblantz a lor de las causas stipticas, entro que·l sanc sia abscidit; o sian pausadas sobre le loc las maytatz de favas excocicadas, e sian layssadas entro que las favas aderescan al loc, e es le sanc abscidit.	And if the blood is multiplied, then you pulverize on it vitriol trias, or galls and similar to them of the stippling causes, until the blood is stopped; or cupping glasses are placed on the place, and they are laid until the beans adhere to the place, and the blood is stopped.
E cove, si es necessaria, iteracio de sanguissuguas, quan es possible mudar aquelas.	And however, if necessary, repetition of leeches, when it is possible to change those.
E si las sanguissuguas son prohibidas de suspenssio, lahoras sia freguat le loc am sanc recent o fique una agulha en les locs entro que yesca sanc; e aprop sian pausadas, quar aquelas quan sento alcun sanc tantost adarysso.	And if the leeches are prohibited from suspension, then the place is rubbed with fresh blood or a needle is left in the places until blood escapes; and then they are placed, because those when they feel some blood immediately adhere.
E quan voles que cajan, polveriza sobre aquelas un pauc de aloen trissat, o sal, o cendre, e cazo tantost.	And when you want them to cough, sprinkle a little crushed aloe, or salt, or ash, on those, and then cover them.
Ayssi comensa lo prolec de la tersa partida: de restauracio.	Thus begins the text of the third part: of restoration.
Aquest capitol es motas veguadas necessari en la art de medicina; e es restauracio de fractura e de dislocacio accident en les osses.	This chapter is very necessary in the art of medicine; and it is about the restoration of fractures and dislocations that occur in the bones.
O, filh, sapiatz que jactan se de aquest capitol les fols metges e les vulguars e aquels que degun temps no reguardero les libres dels Antics ni legiro de aquels una letra.	Oh, son, know that these foolish doctors and those who have never looked at the books of the ancients or read even a letter from them boast about this chapter.
E per aquesta causa es fayt que aquesta manieyra dels scients in terra nostra es privat; e yeu no ho e obliat en aquo degun temps be de tot; e no he adhibit aquo que apres, sino per longitut de lectio dels libres dels Antics e studi sobre le entendement de aquels, entro que extrayssi la sciencia de aquels.	And for this reason, it is that this manner of the learned in our land is deprived; and you must not forget this at all; and I have not adopted this, but rather through the length of reading the books of the ancients and study over the understanding of those, until I extracted the science from them.
E aprop adirigui a experiment e studi en la longitut de la mieua vida.	And therefore I turn to experiment and study throughout the length of my life.
E yeu ja he de aquo descrit en aquest capitol tot aquo que conte la mieua sciencia e sobre le qual es passat lo mieu experiment; pus que agui abreujat aquo a vos autres e deliuregui aquo de occupacio de elonguacio; e abreujegui aquo en la fi de abreujacio; et e monstrat aquo en la fi de declaracio; e formegui en aquo motas formas dels sturmentz que so administratz en aquel, cum es fayt per addicio de declaracio, ayssi cum he fayt en dos capitols precedentz.	And I have already described in this chapter all that my science contains and on which my best experiments have been conducted; because I have now shortened it for you others and delivered it from the occupation of elongation; and I have shortened it at the end of shortening; and I have shown it at the end of declaration; and I have formed many forms of the instruments that are administered in it, as it has been done by addition of declaration, as I have done in the two preceding chapters.
Capitol primier.	First Chapter.
Summae et collectiones ex esse fracturae ossium, ex eis quarum praemissio necessaria est, antequam incipiamus rememorationem membrorum fraftorum et diversorum si uniuscuiusque.	Summaries and collections from the essence of bone fractures, from which a preliminary statement is necessary before we begin the remembrance of fractured and diverse members of each one.
Cove donc que diguam en le prohemi de aquest capitol las summas del sermo; e les capitols al entendament dels quals en le comensament es forsat le artifexs e a stacio sobre la veritat de aquels; so es vos e aquels que so promptz que sapian o aprenguan aquesta art nobla autres de vos.	Therefore, I say that in the beginning of this chapter, the summaries of the sermon; and the chapters to the understanding of which at the beginning the artificers are forced and stand on the truth of those; so it is for you and those who are quick to know or learn this noble art, others than you.
E donc dic que quan accideys a alcu fractura o dislocacio o torcio o cazement, lahoras cove que tu te coytes al comensament am fleubotomia o aleyar aquel, o quascu ensemps, si no prohibeys alcuna causa, ayssi cum debelitat de vertut, o es aquel al qual accideys effant, o viel en decrepitat, o es temps de vehement calor, o de vehement freg.	And therefore I say that when you encounter a fracture or dislocation or sprain or wound, then you must at the beginning, apply a flebotomy or to drain that, or both at once, if no cause prohibits it, as the weakness of virtue, or the one to whom you encounter is a child, or old in decrepitude, or the time of vehement heat, or of vehement cold.
E aprop sia content en vianda sieua de erbas frejas e de carns de auzels e de crabotz; e prohibem carns grossas e umplir si de viandas e de tota vianda que umple las venas de sanc, entro que siras segurat de apostema caut, e si no temes efusio de materia al membre.	And then be content in his food of fresh herbs and of birds' meat and of crabs; and forbid thick meats and fill him with foods and all foods that fill the veins with blood, until you are sure of a cauterized abscess, and if you do not fear effusion of matter to the limb.
E lahoras retorne le malaute al sieu regiment primier am le qual corr costuma de lu.	And then return the patient to his first regimen to which he is accustomed.
E donc cum le os trencat comensa esser restaurat, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia pascut de viandas nutritivas de nutriment mot e gros e greu en les quals sia viscositat, ayssi cum so viandas faytas de froment cueyt am aygua, e ris, e caps, e pes, e ventres de vacas, e huous, e peys fresc, e vi gros e semblants ad aquels, e am aquest regiment es fayta coagulacio de fractura pus leugierament e miels.	And therefore, as the broken bone begins to be restored, then the patient must be fed with nutritious foods of nourishment, thick and heavy, in which there is viscosity, such as foods made of cooked wheat with water, and rice, and heads, and fish, and bellies of cows, and eggs, and fresh poultry, and thick fat and similar to those, and with this regimen is made coagulation of fracture more lightly and better.
E sapias que les osses trinquatz quan so en les homes que so en la primiera vilura e en los decrepitz, no es possible que sian continuatz e sian consolidatz segon lur natura per la exsiccacio dels membres de lor.	And know that the bones that are broken in men who are in the first youth and in the decrepit, are not possible to be continued and consolidated according to their nature by the drying of their limbs.
E son consolidatz e continuatz segon lor natura tot temps per la exsiccacio de aquels membres, e so continuatz e consolidatz aquels que so de lor en la fi de la lenitat, ayssi cum les osses dels petitz effantz.	And they are consolidated and continued according to their nature all the time by the drying of those limbs, and they are continued and consolidated those that are of them at the end of the youth, as the bones of the small children.
Mays empero natura ajusta e amnecteys sobre le os trencat de tota partida alcuna causa semblant a glut en le qual es grossitut que adhereys e strenh aquel entro que so ensemps conglutinatz e liatz ensemps, entro que venen la fi de fortitut e de fermesa, ayssi cum foc al comensament, entro que denguna causa no prohibeys aquel de las suas obres.	But however, nature adjusts and amnestied over the broken bone of every part any cause seeming to glut in which there is thickness that adheres and strengthens that until it is at the same time conglutinated and tied together, until they come to the end of fortitude and firmness, as fire at the beginning, until no cause prohibits it from its works.
E per aquesta causa es necessari que pauses las viandas del malaute, viandas en las quals so gravitat e viscozitat e grosseza, ayssi cum havem dit.	And for this reason, it is necessary that you pause the patient's foods, foods in which there is heaviness and viscosity and thickness, as we have said.
Mota diversitat de fractura segon diversitat del membre.	Many varieties of fracture according to the variety of the limb.
E sapias que las specias de fractura son diversas segon la diversitat dels membres, quar fractura del os de la camba es diversa de la fractura del os del cap; e la fractura del os del pietz es divers de la fractura del os del dos; e semblantment totz les autres membres son diverses entre lor.	And know that the species of fracture are diverse according to the variety of the limbs, for the fracture of the bone of the leg is diverse from the fracture of the bone of the head; and the fracture of the bone of the foot is diverse from the fracture of the bone of the hand; and similarly all the other members are diverse among themselves.
E yeu venc am rememoracio de tota specia de fractura, expausada en le sieu capitol distincta del autre.	And I come with remembrance of every species of fracture, explained in its distinct chapter from the other.
Mota diversitat de fractura en si meteyssa.	Many varieties of fracture within themselves.
E son diversificadas las specias de fractura del os en lor meteyssas; quar es fayta fractura arcuada otra aquo que accidan en lu stellas; e alcunas veguadas es fayta fractura segon la longitut del os: e so las fracturas de lu satagia e astelhas e addicios procedentz e no-procedentz, ayssi cum es fayt en la pena quan es preparada a escriure, e es fractura am plagua e disrupcio en le cap, e es fractura fissura petita.	And they are diversified the species of fracture of the bone in their own; for there is made an arched fracture another that happens in stars; and sometimes it is made a fracture according to the length of the bone: and in the fractures of the shaft and stars and additions proceeding and non-proceeding, as it is done in the pen when it is prepared to write, and is a fracture with plaque and disruption in the head, and is a small fissure fracture.
E a tota specia es engen o turment propri en restauracio de lu segon que vindra rememoracio de lu distincta en les sieus locs.	And to every species is engendered or proper torment in its restoration according to what will come remembrance of it distinct in its places.
Mota senhal de fractura del os.	Many signs of fracture of the bone.
E per aquo es conoguda fractura del os: es tortuositat de lu, e de aquel eminencia e appericio de lu al sentiment, e so de lu quan compremes aquel am la tua ma.	And by this is known a fracture of the bone: it is the twisting of it, and from that prominence and appearance of it to the touch, and so of it when you compress it with your hand.
E donc quan no es en le loc tortuositat apparent ni so no es feyt deves le tieu tocament quan toques le os am agitacio e le malaute no atroba gran dolor, lahoras no es aqui fractura.	And therefore, when there is no apparent twisting in the place, nor is there any feeling made when you touch the bone with agitation, and the patient does not feel great pain, then it is not here a fracture.
Habantz es possible que sia tortuositat o petita fissura, adon no cove que tu mauguas aquel am la tua ma e am compressio de tot; habantz pausa sobre lu de las medicinas de las quals ve rememoracio aprop aquel moment le qual conveneys al loc; e aprop sia streyt per strictura subtil.	It is possible that it is a small twisting or fissure, in which case you must feel it with your hand and with compression of the whole;  and place on it of the medicines of which a recollection is made at that moment, which convenes to the place; and then be strict with a subtle constriction.
E sapias que·l loc quan es arcuat e no es scindit en dos o otra aquo que no accidan en lu satagie, cum es remauguda tota partida de la sua compar, lahoras cove que comenses de la tua hora a rectificacio de lu habantz que a lu accida apostema caut.	And know that the place when it is arched and not split in two or otherwise that does not happen in it stagnation, as it is remauguda whole part of its comparison, then you must begin from your hour to the rectification of it, having that it happens after pus caut.
E si a lu accida apostema caut, lahoras layssa aquel per alcus dias entro que cesse le apostema; e aprop engualha aquel segon quascuna manieyra que podes de levitat e de engen.	And if it happens pus caut, then leave it for some days until the pus ceases; and then bandage it according to whatever manner that you can of lightness and of ingenuity.
E sapias que restauracio de lu e agulacio de lu es pus leugiera que del os en le qual accideysso sathagie.	And know that the restoration of it and the healing of it is lighter than of the bone in which it happens stagnation.
E aprop strenh aquel segon que vindra la rememoracio de lu.	And then strengthen it according to what will come the recollection of it.
Mays si en le os so satagias, lahoras es necessaria extencio de aquest membre trencat de doas partz, si es la ma o le pe; o am la tua ma si le membre es petit; o am doas cordas o am una corda e la ma.	But if in the bone there is stagnation, then it is necessary extension of this broken limb from two parts, if it is the arm or the leg; or with your hand if the limb is small; or with two cords or with one cord and the hand.
E sia la tua posicio am la qual pauses le membre loc engual segon la sua figura natural, mentre que las partidas so extandudas del membre trenquat, lahoras te perforsa que fassas retornar aquelas addicios am engen e segon quascuna manieyra que poyras en lor locs.	And be the position with which you pause the limb there, engual according to its natural figure, while the parts are extended of the broken limb, then you pierce that you make return those additions with ingenuity and according to whatever manner that you can in their places.
E guarda te segon la tua forssa que no accida sobre le malaute per la tua operacio delor ni lesio; e perforsa te segon le tieu poder que tu appliques la un os am l’autre son companho segon lors milhors formas.	And guard yourself according to your strength that it does not happen to the patient by your operation pain nor lesion; and pierce yourself according to your power that you apply one bone to the other's companion according to their best forms.
E cove que en aquela hora aprofitablament tu toques am la tua ma aquel, e si vezes aqui alcuna causa diversa, rectifiqua aquel e enguala aquel per la quantitat de la tua vertut.	And then you must profitably touch with your hand that, and if you see here any different cause, rectify that and bandage it according to the quantity of your virtue.
E exquiva vehement extenssio e compressio, ayssi cum fan mots fols metges que motas veguadas fan accidir apostema caut per la sua operacio, o fan accidir contraccio en le membre ayssi cum havem vist aquo per la operacio de lor motas veguadas.	And avoid vehement extension and compression, as such as do foolish doctors that with many times they make happen pus caut by their operation, or make happen contraction in the limb as we have seen that by the operation of their many times.
E aprop annecteys, aprop equacio e decent operacio e strictura de aquel membre, e repaus e tranquilitat; amoneste le malaute sobre aquo e fay le squivar que no maugua aquel en la hora de las suas vigilias e del sieu dormir, e ves la sua revolucio e agitacio, e deves la sua egestio, e deves totz les sieus movementz am tota la sua vertut; e aguarda se que la posicio del membre sia posicio am la qual sia asegurada la dolor, la qual causa es quar quan sent en la disposicio de la posicio del membre delor o lesio; lahoras cove que permutes aquel ad autra disposicio de aquela am la qual non senta dolor; e guarda am aquo que la posicio de lu aquela sia dreyta e engual, per so que al membre non accida tortuositat quan es restaurat.	And then annex, a proper equation and decent operation and constriction of that limb, and rest and tranquility; admonish the patient about this and make him swear that he does not hurt it in the hour of his vigils and of his sleep, and see his revolution and agitation, and you must his digestion, and you must all his movements with all his virtue; and wait until the position of the limb is a position with which is secured the pain, which cause is that when he feels in the disposition of the position of the limb pain or lesion; then you must change that to another disposition of that with which he does not feel pain; and guard with this that the position of it that be straight and equal, so that to the limb does not happen twisting when it is restored.
E la qualitat de la strictura del membre tranquat es aquela que yeu recomti; per que sapias que·ls membres trencatz so diversificatz en lor parvitat e en lor grandeza e en la forma de aquels.	And the quality of the constriction of the tranquil limb is that which I recommend; for that you know that the broken limbs are diversified in their smallness and in their greatness and in the form of those.
E de aquels que son petits ayssi cum le bras e·l dit e·l focil e semblantz ad aquels, lahoras cove que la envolucio sia de drap mol subtil.	And of those that are small as the arm and the hand and the foot and similar to those, then you must the envelopment be of very fine cloth.
Mays aquels que so grosses ayssi cum la cuoyssa o la camba, cove que en aquels sia envolucio lada e dura, quar la liadura lada connecteys le membre gran e strenh aquel de tota part am strictura engual, enayssi que en lu no intre macula.	But those that are gross as the thigh or the leg, then you must in those be envelopment wide and hard, for the wide bandage connects the great limb and strengthens that of all parts with equal constriction, so that in it no macula enters.
E aprop comensa, aprop la tua evacuacio de equacio, pausar liament convenient ad aquo, sobre le loc de aquela fractura am tres envolucios o quatre segon que·l membre mereys; e strenh la tua ma un petit am le liament.	And then, as you begin, your evacuation of equation, pause ligament convenient to that, over the place of that fracture with three envelopment or four according to the member merits; and strengthen your hand a little with the ligament.
E aprop ve am aquel a la partida pus sobirana del loc de la fractura, e strenh mens que no foc la tua strictura am la qual has strengut le loc de la fractura.	And then see to that at the part pus sovereign of the place of the fracture, and strengthen less that no focus your constriction with which you have strengthened the place of the fracture.
E aprop elongua te am envolucio del loc de la fractura un pauc, e mollifiqua la strictura petit a petit, entro que prenguas del loc sa una gran partida.	And then lengthen yourself with envelopment of the place of the fracture a little, and mollify the constriction little by little, until you take from the place a great part.
E aprop pren una autra benda e envolveys aquela autra veguada sobre le loc trenquat am envolucio, e aprop ve am las envolucios a la partida pus dejos de la fractura; e sia la tua operacio en la strictura de la envolucio e en mollificacio de aquela segon que havem dit en la envolucio primieyra desus.	And then take another bandage and envelop that other time over the broken place with envelopment, and then see to the envelopment at the part further from the fracture; and be your operation in the constriction of the envelopment and in the mollification of that according to what we have said in the first envelopment below.
E aprop pausa entre las volucios de stopa leon o drap am le qual sia engualada la tortuositat de la fractura, si en lu es tortuositat; e sino, no pauses en lu alcuna causa.	And then pause between the envelopment of stopa leon or cloth with which is equalized the twisting of the fracture, if in it is twisting; and if not, do not pause in it any cause.
E aprop pausa sobre lu autra benda, e aprop enguala sobre aquestas envolucios stelhas decentment faytas tantost, si en le loc no es imflacio o apostema caut, e lahoras pausa sobre lu aquo que sede le apostema aquel e que oste la imflacio; e layssa aquela per alcus jorns; e lahoras tu strenh sobre lu las stelhas.	And then pause upon it another bandage, and then bandage over these envelopment stars decently made as soon as, if in the place there is no inflammation or pus caut, and then pause upon it that which settles the pus and that os the inflammation; and leave that for some days; and then you strengthen upon it the stars.
E sian las stelhas de la maytat de canna lada raza, e be formada saviament; o sian de fust de pi; o de ramps de palma ; e sia le ample de quascuna stelha segon aquesta forma e aquesta figura:	And be the stars of the majority of wide reed race, and well formed wisely; or be of pine stick; or of palm ramps; and be the ample of each star according to this form and this figure:
Empero cove que la astelha que es pausada sobre aquela fractura sia pus grossa e pus lada un petit que las autras astelhas, e la longitut de la stela segon qu’es legut al membre en magnitut e parvitat; e aprop strenh sobre las astelhas am autra benda segon la tua primieyra strictura; e aprop lia desus am fiel decentment segon que havem dit de strictura, e es que sia la tua strictura segon le loc de la fractura mes, e quant mes es alonguat de la fractura, es mendre la strictura.	However, the splint placed on that fracture should be thicker and a little wider than the other splints, and the length of the splint according to how it is laid on the limb in magnitude and smallness; and then strengthen over the splints with another bandage according to your first stricture; and then tie it above with a firm bandage according to what we have said about stricture, and it is that the stricture should be according to the place of the fracture more, and as much as the fracture is longer, the less the stricture.
E cove que les fils sian migiers en grossesa e subtilitat, e sian de li mol; e si les fils so grosses, ayssi cum yeu he vist per la operacio de alcus fols pausantz les lors fils de cordas de li tort, e es error gran, quan catz la strictura fora equalitat.	And it is necessary that the threads be moderate in thickness and subtlety, and be of wool; and if the threads are thick, as I have seen in the operation of some fools putting their threads of cords of the rope, and it is a great error, when the bandage is not of equal tightness.
E eyssament fils subtils no so convenientz, quar tu no consaguiras per strictura am aquels aquo que voles, e no cove que entre astela e astela haja mens de un dit.	And excessively fine threads are not convenient, because you will not be able to make a good bandage with them, and there should be at least one finger's width between each splint.
E si le malaute es ledit per las extremitatz de las stelas aprop la strictura en les locs sas, lahoras pausa dejos aquelas de stopa leon o lana carmenada entro que aquo no li fassa lesio.	And if the patient is said to be in pain at the ends of the splints near the bandage, then place some wool or carded wool between them so that it does not cause injury.
Alcunas veguadas fractura es am plagua, e accideys disrupcio en la codena, e yeu vindre am rememoracio en aquela en le capitol segon singularitat.	Sometimes a fracture is accompanied by a plague, and an accident happens in the bone, and I will come with a remedy in that in the chapter on singularity.
E sapias que ges tot membre trencat no es streyt am stelhas al primier dia; la qual causa es quar le membre, quan es gran, no cove que pauses sobre lu stelhas sino aprop v dias o vii o mays, segon la tua seguratat de adveniment de apostema caut.	And know that a broken limb is not immediately splinted on the first day; the reason for this is that the limb, when it is large, should not be placed on splints but rather after about five or seven days, or more, depending on your certainty of the arrival of a boil.
E aquesta es la manieyra dels emplaustres am les quals les Antics restauravan, les quals so pausatz sobre fractura e dislocacio e torcio.	And this is the way of the splints with which the Ancients restored, which were placed over fractures and dislocations and twists.
Manieyra de emplaustra comu abruejat de restaurament de fractura, convenient a motas compleccios e majorment a las femnas e als efantz, quar es de aquo sobre le qual no ventz calor ni freg: e es que prenguas de polvera de moli, e es la medula de la farina que pen deves le movement de la mola en las paretz del moli.	A method of splinting as a way of restoring a fracture, convenient for many ailments and especially for women and children, because it does not allow for heat or cold to reach it; and it is that you take from the powder of ground flour, and it is the medulla of the flour that remains from the movement of the mill on the sides of the mill.
E comfeys aquel ayssi cum es, sino que cribelles aquel am album de huou, e pausa la comfeccio de lu no-spessa ni subtil; e aprop usa de aquela.	And make it as such, except that you sift it with the album of egg, and place the confection of it not thick nor subtle; and then use that.
Autra manieyra de emplaustre restaurant fractura e dislocacio e torcio: recipe de assafetida, de lapdanum, de acacia, de enula, e migrach, que es razit de milgraner salvage, de totz ana drac. x; de mirra e aloen ana drac. v; alochil ana drac. xx; totz sian trissatz e cribellatz e sian mesclatz am aygua alichil o am album de huou si la compleccio del malaute es scalfada; e aprop usa de aquest emplaustre, quar es de bona composicio e restaura les osses trencatz leugierament, e confereys a motz homes.	Another way to plaster a fracture, dislocation, and sprain: Take asafoetida, lapdanum, acacia, enula, and migrach, which is the root of wild millet, of each a dragon's weight x; of frankincense and aloes a dragon's weight v; alochil a dragon's weight xx; all to be ground and sifted and mixed with boiled water or with egg white if the patient's complexion is sallow; and then use this plaster, for it is of good composition and restores bones broken slightly, and confers strength to many men.
Autra manieyra de emplaustre le qual comfereys a fractura e torcio: recipe migrach e met de altea blanca ana drac. x; de mirra e de aloen ana drac v; de acacia drac. vi; de bol armenic drac. .xx.	Another way to plaster a fracture and sprain: Take migrach and powdered white althea a dragon's weight x; of frankincense and aloes a dragon's weight v; of acacia a dragon's weight vi; of Armenian bole a dragon's weight .xx.
Totz sian trissatz en mortier am mota contricio, e sian cribellatz, e sian comfitz am aygua o am album de huou e sia administrat.	All of them should be crushed in a mortar with much contrition, and sifted, and composited with water or egg albumen and be administered.
Manieyra de emplaustre a juncturas e osses separatz de lors locs, e seda dolor accident en aquels e a fissuras e fractaduras: sia presa lana sutza e sia submersa en vi agre e oli cuyt e sia pausat sobre le loc.	A way of splinting to joints and separated bones in their places, and to soothe pain in those and in fissures and fractures: take woolen cloth and submerge it in strong wine and boiled oil and place it over the area.
Mays en aquest emplastre no es vertut de restauracio, de apostema caut e expelleys dolors propriament.	However, in this plaster there is no virtue of restoration, but it soothes boils and expels pains properly.
Autra manieyra de emplastre que restaura os trancat: pren fuelas de figuier sort e fuelas de papaver salvatge; contereys tot e fay emplastre de lor.	Another way of plaster that restores broken bones: take fig tree leaves and wild poppy leaves; pound them together and make a plaster from them.
Manieyra de emplastre abreujat aministrat deves la restauracio de fractura de os e quan tu voles resolucio del romanent de apostema: recipe razitz de altea, de camamilla e flors de violes, de farina de ers, de totz ana partida .i.; sian totz trissatz e sian cofitz am vi, si·l membre no es scalfat.	A way of plaster that, when administered, helps with the restoration of bone fractures and when you want resolution of the remaining boil: take root of althea, chamomile and violet flowers, and ground ergot, of all one part. They should all be crushed and composited with wine, if the limb is not pale.
Mays si es scalfat, lahoras comfeys aquel am aygua de coliandre humit o am aygua e usa de lu.	However, if it is pale, then make it with moist coriander water or water and use it.
Autra manieyra de emplastra pus fort en resolucio que aquest primier, quan accideys apostema dur deves la restauracio del membre: recipe de razitz de altea e de semensa de li, e de balaustia, e mellilot, majorana, flors de viol, de camamilla, de totz ana partida i engual; totz sian trissatz e sian cofitz am aygua de sauze o am aygua dousa o am vi, tot aquo segon la qualitat del membre e le repaus de la color de lu.	Another way of plaster, stronger in resolution than the first one, when a hard boil occurs and needs restoration of the limb: take root of althea and seeds of  li, and balm, melilot, majorana, violet flowers, chamomile, of all one part equal; all should be crushed and composited with  elderflower water or sweet water or wine, all according to the quality of the limb and the rest of its color.
Mays Ypocras no diyssec en le sieu libre que sia pausat sobre le membre trenquat deves la restauracio de lu sino cerot fayt de cera e de oli e no autre causa; e recomtec que sia migier entre grossitut e subtilitat.	But Ipocras does not say in his book that it should be placed on the broken limb for its restoration, but rather that it should be made of wax and oil and nothing else; and he recommends that it should be moderate in thickness and subtlety.
Mays a Gualia es vist que sian pausatz sobre le membre trencat deves la restauracio de lu e las causas en las quals es exsiccacio am petit de caliditat so ayssi cum mirra, enses e semblantz a lor de aquelas causas que havem recomtadas.	But Gualia has seen that they should be placed on the broken limb for its restoration, and the causes in which it is dryness with a little heat are like myrrh, incense, and similar to those causes that we have recommended.
Manieyra de emplastre que comfereys a lesio e dolor: recipe migat, de cezes, de pels de home inscizes o pena de auzel, e de altea, e sal, partidas enguals; sian trissatz e cribellatz e sian cofitz, e sia fayt emplastre.	Method of plaster that comforts the lesion and pain: take flour, of chickpeas, of human hair cut or feathers of bird, and of althea, and salt, parts equal; be sifted and crimped and be cooked, and be made plaster.
Mays la quantitat segon la qual cove que romangua la liadura e aprop sia disliada, es que consideres si no es accidit dolor ni pruziment ni le os es trencat no es maugut de son loc, lahoras tu no deslies de motz jorns.	May the quantity according to which cover that remains the bandage and then be untied, is that you consider if no occurs pain nor tingling nor the bone is broken no is bad of its place, then you no untie of many days.
E si accideys al loc dolor vehement o prusiment o imflacio, lahoras tu te coyte o deslie aquel en la hora, e osta le emplastre de lu.	And if there occurs to the place violent pain or tingling or inflammation, then you tie or untie that in the hour, and take the plaster from it.
E pren drap de li e spongia marina leon humida, e submergeys aquela en aygua tebeza, e am aquela lava le loc entro que cesse aquel pruziment e la dolor sia sedada; e aprop layssa repausar le membre per una hora; e aprop pausa sobre lu lana sutza submersa en vi agre e oli o oli rozat, e lia sobre lu per una nuoyt entro que sias segur de apostema caut, e que repause la imflacio del membre, e sia remauguda la dolor de lu.	And take cloth of linen and sponge of sea lion wet, and submerge that in tepid water, and with that wash the place until that tingling and pain be calmed; and then let the member rest for an hour; and then place over it wool cloth submerged in vinegar and oil or rose oil, and tie over it for a night until you are sure of abscess caut, and that rests the inflammation of the member, and be calmed the pain of it.
E aprop itera aquela strictura subtil e emplastre petit e no·l strenhas per la tua constriccio primieyra, e subtilia am aquel entro que sia sanat.	And then iterate that stricture subtle and plaster small and do not tighten it for your first constriction, and more subtle with that until it be healed.
E si vezes que le apostema e la rogor e la dolor e la imflacio e tots les accidentz ja so remaugutz de tot, e indigeysses de emplastre e de strictura, lahoras tu itera aquel ayssi cum has fayt al comensant engualment.	And if you see that the abscess and the rage and the pain and the inflammation and all the accidents already are calmed of all, and indigested of plaster and of stricture, then you iterate that thus as you have done at the beginning equally.
E si no accideys al membre alcuna causa de aquelas que havem ditas, lahoras no deslies aquel sino aprop tres dias o quatre o v o .vii.; e alcunas veguadas tot aquo es layssat per xx dias segon que a tu appar per la desliadura del membre, ayssi cum havem dit, entro que la fractura adhereys, e se acosta a la coagulacio de la carn sobre aquel.	And if there occurs to the member no cause of those that have been said, then you do not untie that but to three days or four or five or seven; and some times all that is left for twenty days according to what to you appears for the unbinding of the member, thus as we have said, until the fracture adheres, and it approaches to the coagulation of the flesh over that.
E lahoras ajusta en la strictura mays que en la tua strictura primieyra tota, e ayusta en la engrossacio de la vianda del malaute, segon que es precedida la rememoracio de lu.	And then adjust in the stricture more than in your first constriction all, and adjust in the thickening of the food of the patient, according to that is preceded the recollection of him.
Mays si tu vezes le loc de la fractura ja desiccar e extenuar mays que no cove, lahoras sapias que·l nutriment es prohibit pervenir ad aquel; e donc embroca aquel am aygua tebeza deves tota veguada que delias aquel; e sia aquo en totz tres dias; e alleuja la strictura un petit, e per aquesta operacio corr al membre le nutriment, e es sanat leugierament.	But if you see the place of the fracture already dry and extend more than it should, then you know that the nourishment is prohibited to arrive to that; and therefore embroil that with tepid water you must every time that you untie it; and be that in all three days; and alleviate the stricture a little, and for this operation run to the member the nourishment, and be healed lightly.
Mays aquo que fan les fols restauradors de la fractura del membre autra veguada quan no es restaurat al comensament, segon que cove, e es restaurat segon tortuositat, es error segon la operacio de lor, e temor gran, e si fos dreyturier aquo agrandit les Antics en lors libres e agueran am aquo obrat.	But that which do the foolish restorers of the fracture of the member another time when it is not restored at the beginning, according to that it should, and it is restored according to tortuosity, is error according to the operation of theirs, and great fear, and if it were straighter that which enlarged the Ancients in their books and they had acted with that,
E yeu no he vist ad alcu de lor aquo far, per que es pus razonable que aquo no fassa.	And I have not seen to any of theirs that do that, for that it is more reasonable that that not be done.
Capitol segon: De fractura quan accideys en le cap.	Chapter second: Of fracture when it occurs in the head.
Las specias de fracturas son motas, e las figuras de lor son diversas, e las causas son distinctas, quar de fracturas alcuna es fayta per percussio de spaza, e la percussio osta tot le os entro al ciphac, le qual es dejos le os, ayssi cum fay ayssa en le fust, e per aquo aquesta specia es nompnada ascial; o la spaza inscideys alcuna partida del os, e inscideys la carn de lu e no passa la inscizio entro al derier de lu; e aquesta specia de fractura es nompnada levatio absoluta.	The species of fractures are many, and their figures are diverse, and their causes are distinct, for of fractures some is made by percussion of space, and the percussion hinders all the bone within the skull, the which is left the bone, thus as it is done in the shaft, and for this reason this species is called ascial; or the space incides some part of the bone, and incides the flesh of it and does not pass the incision within the back of it; and this species of fracture is called elevation absolute.
E la plagua de aquestas doas fracturas o es gran o pauca, e de fractura que es contricio o atricio; e causa de lu es percussio am poyra o cazement sobre peyra, e a lor semblantz.	And the plague of these two fractures or is great or little, and of fracture that is compression or attrition; and cause of it is percussion with force or falling upon stone, and to their similitudes.
E aquesta fractura o es penetrant que ja apropinqua al pannicol le qual es dejos le os; o es en la facia del os, e la plagua de aquestas doas fracturas o es gran o pauca.	And this fracture or is penetrating that already approaches to the pannicle the which is left the bone; or is in the face of the bone, and the plague of these two fractures or is great or little.
E de fractura es que es ameguada en le os, en la subtilitat del cabel petita, e per aquo es nompnada aquesta specia fractura capillar.	And of fracture is that which is made in the bone, in the subtlety of the hair small, and for that reason this species is called fracture capillary.
E es fractura que es fayta o per cazement o per percussio de peyra e a lu semblantz, que fa intrar alcuna lamina del os a las partidas dedintz, e es fayta en le loc concavitat ayssi cum accideys als payroles de eram quan accideys a lor percussio e es partida de lor intrada a las partidas dedintz.	And is fracture that is made either by falling or by percussion of stone and to its similitudes, that makes enter some lamina of the bone to the parts within, and is made in the place concavity as it occurs to the payroles of ram when it occurs to their percussion and is part of their entrance to the parts within.
E majorment es fayt aquo en les cors de osses humitz, ayssi cum so caps de efantz.	And mostly is done that in the bodies of bones humid, as it is heads of infants.
E so a totas aquestas specias fracturas satagias, so son pessas ayssi cum stelhas separadas.	And to all these species fractures satagias, so are pains as it is stars separated.
E yeu vindre am reremoracio de tot aquo en son loc.	And I will come with recollection of all that in its place.
E conoyssem totas aquestas specias de fractura per deteccio sobre aquelas e per inquisicio de lor am tentas e ostament de carn corrumpuda que es sobre lor.	And we shall know all these species of fracture by detection upon those and by inquiry of them with tentacles and ostentation of corrupted flesh that is upon them.
E specia capillar es conoguda per aysso que es descubert sobre le os, e es abstergit, e linit sobre lu am tentha, quar la fractura appar negra.	And the species capillary is known for that which is discovered upon the bone, and it is abstergit, and lined upon it with tentacle, for the fracture appears black.
Mays en la curacio de fractura considera al comensament les accidentz del malaute, e lahoras si tu vezes per los accidentz que signifique per significacio manifesta sobre paor, ayssi cum es vomit de colera, e extencio, e perdement de entendament, e abscizio de votz, e sincopi, e febre acuta, e eyssiment dels huels e rogor de aquels, e semblantz a lor dels accidentz en las majors disposicios, ses dopte no es sanat.	But in the cure of fracture consider at the beginning the accidents of the patient, and then if you see by the accidents that signify by manifest signification upon pain, as it is vomiting of cholera, and extension, and loss of understanding, and abscess of voice, and syncope, and acute fever, and emission of the heels and rage of those, and similitudes to theirs of the accidents in the major dispositions, suppose that it is not healed.
E si vezes accidentz no-correntz tu speras salut, lahoras tu comensa la curacio de lu.	And if you see accidents not-flowing you hope for health, then you begin the cure of him.
La qual causa es quar si es vengut a tu le plaguat en le comensament cum es plaguat e aquo es en les dias de ivern, lahoras cove que tu studias en le ostament del os denant le dia xiiii segon tota disposicio.	The cause is that if it has come to you the afflicted at the beginning as it is afflicted and this is in the days of winter, then you must study the condition of the bone before the 14th day according to all disposition.
E si es en les dias d’estiu, lahoras cove que te coytes ostar le os denant le vii dia, habantz que aquo que es dejos le os sia corromput del pannicol, e que accidescan les accidentz que havem recomtatz.	And if it is in the days of summer, then you must study the bone before the 7th day, because that which is left of the bone should be corrupted by the panniculus, and that the accidents that we have recounted may occur.
E si la fractura ja es pervenguda al pannicol cubrent le cervel, e es am partidas menudas e atricio, lahoras cove que inscidas la partida conminuta e atrita, segon que yeu recomtare a tu.	And if the fracture has already reached the panniculus covering the brain, and it is in small pieces and attrition, then you must insert the minute and rubbed piece, according to what I will recount to you.
E es que tu razas le cap del malaute plaguat, e descuebres sobre le os segon costuma e manieyra a tu possible segon la figura de la plagua, e que sia leugier sobre le malaute.	And you raise the head of the afflicted patient, and uncover over the bone according to custom and manner as you are possible according to the figure of the plague, and that it be light on the patient.
E si accideys a tu deves la deteccio del os, fluxs de sanc o apostema caut, lahora tu te oppausa a lu am aquo que cove, e es que huemplas le loc de draps infuzes en vi e oli rozat, e fassa repausar la plagua entro que sia sedat le apostema, e sies segur de fluxs del sanc; e aprop comensa en la circuicio del os e en la ablatio de lu.	And if it happens to you to detect the bone, flows of blood or pus, then you oppose it with what you have, and that you fill the place with cloths infused in wine and rubbed oil, and make the plague rest until the pus is seated, and it is sure of the flow of blood; and then you begin in the circuit of the bone and in its ablation.
E aquo sia segon una de dos manieyras de operacio.	And this is according to one of two ways of operation.
E la una manieyra es que tu inscidas le os am inscisori de streyt tal, e aquesta es la forma de lu: E aprop administra un autre inscissori aquest, un pauc pus lat que aquel; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	And the one way is that you insert the bone with a straight incisor, and this is the form of it: And then administer another incisor this one, a little wider than that; and this is the form of it:
E aprop administra mays le inscissori pus lat que·l segon.	And then administer more the incisor wider than the second.
E cove que sia deves tu nombre de inscissoris diverses, dels quals alcus so pus latz que alcus autres; e alcus de lor so pus breus que·ls autres e sian en le derier de acuitat de las suas extremitatz, e sian de ferr indi o felod.	And you must have you a number of various incisors, of which some are wider than others; and some of them are shorter than others and are in the rear of the sharpness of their extremities, and are of Indian iron or steel.
E usa de lor am facilitat en percussio sobre le inscissori per so que no concutesca le cap e leda aquel.	And use of them with facility in percussion upon the incisor so that it does not strike the head and damage it.
E si le os es fort, dur, lahoras cove que perfores en le circuit de lu denant que tu administres los inscissoris am les taravels, les quals so nomnatz taravels no-profundantz.	And if the bone is strong, hard, then you must perforate in its circuit before you administer the incisors with the drills, which are called non-profund drills.
E no so nomnatz ayssi sino quar aquels no pausan le terme de l’os del test ad aquo que es aprop lu, per so quar al taravel es redonda extremitat o marge sobre aquel que es dejos le cap de lu agut semblant a marge o a cercle petit, le qual prohibeys esser submergit e passar la spissitut del os.	And they are not called thus but because those do not reach the term of the bone of the skull to that which is near it, because the drill has a round extremity or margin on that which is left the head of it sharp resembling a margin or a small circle, which prohibits being submerged and passing the thickness of the bone.
E es convenient que tu prenguas de aquestz taravels gran nombre dels quals quascu convenesca a la spicitut de quascun os, entro que sia a tu present en tottz testz del cervel la extremitat del qual sia aguda, la quantitat en longitut e brevitat sia segon la quantitat de spicitut de aquest test.	And it is convenient that you take of these drills a large number of which as many as convenient to the thickness of each bone, so that it be to you present in all tests of the skull the extremity of which be acute, the quantity in length and shortness be according to the quantity of thickness of this test.
E aquesta es la forma de tres specias de teravels: La qualitat de perforar en le circuit del os trencat es que pauses le teravel sobre le os e revolvas aquel am les tieus ditz entro que sapias que l’os ja es penetrat; e aprop permuda le terevel ad autre loc, e pausa aquo que es entre tot trauc la quantitat de la grosseza del ray o enviro aquo.	And this is the form of three species of drills: The quality of perforating in the circuit of the broken bone is that you pause the drill on the bone and revolve that with your fingers until you know that the bone is already penetrated; and then change the drill to another location, and pause that which is between all the tract the quantity of the thickness of the ray or about that.
E aprop inscideys am inscissoris aquo que es entre quascun trauc del os, e fay aquel pus subtil que podes sobre aquo en fi de levitat, ayssi cum havem dit, entro que erradiques le os, o am la tua ma, o am alcuna autra causa per alcus sturmentz les quals auras apparelhatz ad aquo, ayssi cum tanalhas e forceps subtils.	And then insert with incisors that which is between each tract of the bone, and make that as subtle as you can over that in the end of lightness, as we have said, until you eradicate the bone, or with your hand, or with some other cause for some instruments which you will have prepared to that, as such as tongs and subtle forceps.
E cove que tu guardes am tota cautela que l’inscissori no toque alcuna causa del ciphac.	And you must guard with all caution that the incisor does not touch any cause of the brain.
E donc cum auras circuit le os perforan, e sira separat del ciphac si es continuat am lu, e auras aquel extrayt, cove que razas e enguales aquel en la asperitat de lu de aquo que es en le os am autra sturment semblant a inscissori, mays empero cove que sia pus teon e pus subtil que les autres inscissoris.	And therefore, as you will have circuited the bone, and if it is continued with it, and you will have that extracted, you must raise and smooth that in the roughness of it of that which is in the bone with another instrument resembling an incisor, but however, you must have it more thin and more subtle than the others incisors.
E si roman alcuna partida dels osses petitz e satagias, lahoras pren aquela am facilitat am aquo que es deves tu dels sturmentz; e aprop aquo cura la plagua am lichinis e enguentz les quals havem ditz.	And if any pieces of the small bones and splinters remain, then take that with facility with that which you must of the instruments; and then cure the plague with liniments and ointments which we have said.
E l’autra manieyra de operacio es leugiera, longinqua de paor, la qual diyssec Gualia e la lauzec per gran lausor; e aquest es le sermo de lu: necessari es a tu en le comensament que comenses descobrir la partida del os del loc en le qual es la fractura pus vehement e pus manifesta, entro que quan auras descubert aquela partida e auras pausat dejos lu la extremitat de aquest inscissori lent e alegre del qual aquesta es la forma:	And the other way of operation is lighter, farther from pain, which says Gualia and the lauzec for great lausor; and this is the sermon of it: Necessary is to you at the beginning that you begin to discover the part of the bone of the place in which is the fracture most vehement and most manifest, until when you will have discovered that part and you will have placed below it the extremity of this incisor lent and light of which this is the form:
E es que la partida lenticular es leon e no inscideys alcuna causa, e la partida aguda es de lu en dos latz avantz en longitut, ayssi cum vezes; que la partida lenticular sia ajustada al ciphac am la facia de lu inscident aguda en le os.	And it is that the lenticular part is lion and do not insert any cause, and the acute part is of it in two parts forward in length, as sometimes; that the lenticular part be adjusted to the brain with the face of it inciding acute in the bone.
E aprop percuteys sobre le inscissori de una partida am un petit malhet entro que inscidas tot le os am facilitat ayssi cum es revolvut, e tu sias segur del pannicol que no accida en lu accident que temas en denguna manieyra, e si le medicant14 era le pus fol de totz les homes e le mays ignorant de lor; certament, e si era dorment.	And then strike upon the incisor of a part with a small mallet until you insert the whole bone with facility as it is revolved, and you are sure of the panniculus that no accident occurs in it that you fear in any way, and if the medicant14 were the most foolish of all men and the most ignorant of them; certainly, and if he were asleep.
Lahoras si romania alcuna causa annexa al os del pannicol en alcus locs de os, inscidira aquel de lu am la extremitat del inscissori aquel lenticular, e deliuraria aquel de lu am facilitat, quar es deliurat de lu ses nocument e ses paor.	Now if there is any cause annexed to the bone of the panniculus in certain places of the bone, cut that of it with the extremity of the lens-shaped incision, and deliver that of it with ease, for it is delivered from it its pain and its fear.
E si fractura del os no penetra entro al pannicol, e aquo que es abscidit o es ostat del os es la facia de lu, e roman en lu asperitat e satagias subtils, lahoras cove que razas aquela asperitat e erradiques aquelas satagias am razoris subtils per les quals tu has preparat le nombre, de diversas quantitatz per que sia a tu possible administrar de aquels en tot loc les pus convenientz de lor e le pus dreyt de aquels segon aquo en que te perduzeys la tua operacio aquel os trencat e la figura de lu.	And if the fracture of the bone does not penetrate into the panniculus, and what is cut or taken from the bone is its fascia, and there remain in it roughness and subtle stitches, then when you remove that roughness and eradicate those stitches with subtle razors, with which you have prepared the number, of diverse quantities so that it may be possible for you to administer those in every place the most convenient of them and the most right of them according to what in which you are directing your operation of that broken bone and its figure.
E cove que administres en la tua razio am la qual razes le os al comensament le pus lat de aquels razoris, e aprop usa aprop lu del pus subtil de lu, e no cesses far aquo segon continuitat entro que pervenguas ad aministrar le pus teon e·l pus subtil de totz aquels.	And when you administer in your ratio with which razors you root the bone at the beginning the most blunt of those razors, and then use the most subtle of it, and do not cease doing so according to continuity until you reach to administer the most coarse and the most subtle of all those.
Mays en quascuna de las autras fracturas petitas capillars e fractura subtil, cove que administres cura segon aquo que perduseys ad rectificacio de lu.	But in any of the other fractures, petited capillary and subtle fractures, when you administer care according to what you direct to the rectification of it.
E es causa que no es ameguada sobre totz les quals han studi en aquela art.	And it is a cause that it is not befriended over all those who have studied in that art.
E stec sobre aquo que nos scriut havem mostrat en grans fracturas.	And stick on what we have written have shown in great fractures.
E si le pannicol es retangut quan tu erradiques le os, lahoras cove que prenguas drap de li segon la quantitat de la plagua, e submergeys aquel en oli rozat, e pausa aquel sobre le orrifici de la plagua; e aprop pren autre drap doblat o triplicat e submergeys lu en vi e oli rozat e pausa aquel sobre drap prim e fay aquo al pus leugierament que podes sobre aquel, que no graves le ciphac; e aprop administra sobre aquel liament lat, e no strenhas aquel sino per quantitat que tengua la plagua tant solament.	And if the panniculus is cut when you eradicate the bone, then when you take cloth of it according to the quantity of the wound, and submerge that in rose oil, and place that over the orifice of the wound; and then take another cloth folded or tripled and submerge it in wine and rose oil and place that over the first cloth and do this as lightly as you can, so that you do not hurt the scalp; and then administer over that bandage, and do not tighten it except for the quantity that the wound has so only.
E layssa aquel am aquesta cura per un dia o per dos entro que sias segur de apostema caut; e aprop deslia aquel e aprop aministra medicinas am las quals es superflua siccitat, ayssi cum razitz de lin e farina de errs, e polvera de enses e de aristologia, e de semblantz ad aquels.	And leave that with this care for a day or for two until you are sure of the pus cauter; and then untie that and then administer medicines with which is superfluous dryness, as such as root of flax and flour of herbs, and powder of incense and of aristolochia, and of similar to those.
E es que tu fassas de aquestas medicinas polvera que sia pulverizada sobre la plagua, ayssi cum son secas; e universalment, administra en aquel tota medicina de proprietat de la qual es que abstergesca e no mordique.	And it is that you make of these medicines powder that is pulverized over the wound, as such as they are dried; and universally, administer in that all medicine of property of which it is that it abstergesca and do not bite.
E guarda te segon la tua vertut que la plagua en la tua curacio sia neta; e no sia en lu surdicia de enguent ni autra; ni no layssas agreguar virulencia en lu; quar quan es ajustada sobre le pannicol del cervel, corromp aquel e poyreys aquel, e accideys sobre le malaute aprop aquo malicia maligna.	And guard yourself according to your virtue that the wound in your cure be clean; and not be in it filth of rinsing nor other; nor let add virulence in it; for when it is adjusted over the panniculus of the brain, it corrupts that and you can that, and it happens over the patient as much as evil malice.
E accideys en le ciphac del cap, cum de lu es mondificat le os e majorment quan es menspresada la cura de lu, e es negror en la superficia de lu; e donc considera lahoras si accideys al malaute les accidentz que havem ditz, sapias que es parnicios ses tot dopte.	And it happens in the scalp of the head, as of it is modified the bone and most when it is less cared for, and it is blackness on the surface of it; and therefore consider then if it happens to the patient the accidents that we have said, know that it is pernicious its whole adoption.
E si no accideys negror sino de la medicina que es pausada desus, e es en vertut de aquela medicina que fassa aquela negror, lahoras cove que tu prenguas de mel una partida e de oli rozat partidas .iii., e am aquels linieys un drap, e aprop pausa aquel sobre le ciphac; e aprop cura aquel am las specias de curacio que conveneys entro que sia sanat.	And if it does not happen blackness but of the medicine that is placed over it, and it is in virtue of that medicine that makes that blackness, then when you take of honey one part and of rose oil parts iii., and in those lines a cloth, and then place that over the scalp; and then cure that with the species of cure that convenes until it is healed.
Capitol .iii.	Chapter III.
De restauracio del nas quan es trincat.	Of the restoration of the nose when it is broken.
Sapias que no es trencat del nas sino doas partidas ensemps pus sobiranas, o una de aquelas alcunas veguadas, per so quar en lu has dos osses, quar la partida dejos es cartillaginosa, e no es trencada e no accideys a lu sino atricio e tortuositat e sinuitat.	Know that the nose is not broken but two parts together, or one of those some times, for that in it you have two bones, for the partition left is cartilaginous, and it is not broken and does not happen to it but attrition and tortuosity and sinuosity.
Mays si es trencada la una de las doas partidas de lu, lahoras cove que tu intrometas le dit petit en le sieu nas, e que engualhas aquela fractura dedintz am le tieu dit indic, e am le dit pous defora, entro que retorne le nas segon la sua figura natural.	But if one of the two parts of it is broken, then when you introduce the said little one into its nose, and that you equal that fracture within with your said index, and with the said point outside, until the nose returns according to its natural figure.
E sia fayt aquo per tu am facilitat, e guarda te que no caja per aquela tua operacio sobre le malaute delor.	And be done that by you with ease, and guard yourself that no cage by that your operation over the patient pain.
E si la fractura es en la pus sobirana partida del nas, e le dit no perve ad aquela, lahoras cove que sia equat am la extremitat del ray en le qual sia petita grossitut.	And if the fracture is in the most sovereign part of the nose, and the said one does not reach to that, then when it be equal with the extremity of the ray in which it is little thickness.
E si la fractura es en doas partidas, lahoras tu fay le semblant de aquo.	And if the fracture is in two parts, then you do the semblance of that.
E coyta te am restauracio de lu en le primier dia de la fractura, si es possible; e sino, lahoras aprop le vii o·l x deves le repaus del apostema caut.	And guard yourself with the restoration of it in the first day of the fracture, if it is possible; and if not, then the vii or x of days the rest of the pus cauter.
E aprop entromet en la extremitat del nas una meca de drap de li, si la fractura es en una partida, o metz doas calguas, si la fractura es en doas partidas, e sia en la calgua grossitut de tanta quantitat que umpla le trauc del nas.	And then introduce into the extremity of the nose a piece of cloth of it, if the fracture is in one part, or put two splints, if the fracture is in two parts, and be in the splint thickness of so much quantity that fills the trough of the nose.
E diysso alcus dels antics restauradors que las calguas sian enfundudas en boder, e sian permudadas en tot dia, mays no es vist a mi; habantz cove que la meca sia enfunduda en album de huou comfit am polvera de moli; e aprop layssa la qualgua entro que l’os sia fermat e sia endurazida la cartillage.	And I say some of the ancient restorers that the splints be enclosed in border, and be changed in every day, but it is not seen to me; it ought to be that the piece be enclosed in album of comfit with powder of moli; and then leave the one until the bone be joined and be hardened the cartilage.
E alcunas veguadas sia entromes en le nas, en loc de calgua, pena de auca pus que es envolopada de drap de li leon; e sia que ja te la fractura del nas pus vehement e que le malaute no sia prohibit de inspiracio.	And some times be introduced into the nose, in place of splint, a pain of auca pus that is enveloped of cloth of lion; and be that already you the fracture of the nose more vehement and that the patient not be prohibited of inspiration.
E aquesta causa no es a tu necessaria; e si voles, fay aquo, e si voles, fay calguas.	And this cause is not necessary for you; and if you want, do this, and if you want, do that.
E si accideys autra veguada apostema caut, emplastra le nas am cerot o am coto enfus en vi agre e oli rozat, o am diaquilon.	And if another abscess happens after cauterization, apply a plaster to the nose with cerot or with a cloth soaked in strong wine and rose oil, or with diachylon.
Mays si no accideys apostema caut, lahoras cove que emplaustres aquel defora am farina de sizami e am polvera de enses cofitz am album de huou; e aprop pausa sobre lu stopa leon, e no lies le nas am alcuna causa.	But if no abscess happens after cauterization, then cover that with a plaster of sesame flour and powdered quince seeds with egg white; and place a linen cloth on top of it, and do not touch the nose with any cause.
Mays si so trencats les osses del nas am fractura petita o so conminuitz, lahoras cove que scindas sobre aquels, e extraguas aquels am insturmentz que conveno ad aquels; e aprop cos la scissura, e cura aquela am aquo que encarna e consolida, e am emplastres ad aquo convenientz.	But if the bones of the nose are broken with a small fracture or are splintered, then cover those, and extract them with instruments that are suitable for those; and close the fissure, and cure that with what hardens and consolidates, and with plasters suitable for that.
E si accideys plagua dedintz le nas, lahoras cove que cures aquela am calguas e administra canulas de plom entro que sia de tot sanat.	And if plague happens in the nose, then cover that with cauterizations and administer lead tubes while it is entirely healed.
Capitol .iiii.	Chapter .iiii.
De restauracio de la mandibula quan es trincada.	Of the restoration of the jaw when it is broken.
Quan la mandibula dejos es rompuda e la fractura de lu no es am plagua, reguarda lahoras si la fractura es deforas tant solament, e no es trencada en dos e es curvada a las partidas dedintz, lahoras la sua cognicio es leugiera.	When the jaw is broken and the fracture of it is not with plague, look then if the fracture is only outward, and not broken in two and curved at the parts inside, then the knowledge of it is lighter.
E cove donc, si la fractura es en la part dreyta, que tu intrometas le tieu indic senestre en la boca del malaute; e semblantment si la fractura es an la mandibula senestra, lahoras intromet le dit indic de la ma dreyta; e impelleys am aquel la gilbositat de la fractura dedintz am facilitat a las partidas defora, am la tua autra ma de la partida defora del os; am aquel decentment equa aquelam.	And therefore, if the fracture is on the right side, that you introduce your left finger into the mouth of the patient; and similarly if the fracture is on the left jawbone, then introduce the right finger; and push with that the looseness of the fracture inside with ease to the outside parts, with your other hand from the outside of the bone; and with that decently equal that.
E si la fractura de la mandibula ja es separada en doas, lahoras cove que administres extensio de doas partz segon rectitut entro que sia possibla la equacio de lu. E comanda al malaute que use de repaus e tranquilitat, e pausa la vianda de lu sorbicios leons.	And command the patient to use of rest and tranquility, and place the food of him soft and lean.
E si extimas que ja es alterada la figura en alcuna manieyra, lahoras tu te coyta e deslia aquel al tertz dia; e aprop rectifica aquo que ja es alterat de lu e emplaustra aquel am polvera de moli, am album de huou, o am farina de cisami, pus que tu auras ostat le cerot de lu, e pausa sobre le emplastra lana leon.	And if you estimate that already is altered the figure in any manner, then you get it and untie that on the third day; and then rectify that which is already altered of it and plaster it with powdered wool, with egg white, or with sesame flour, because that you will have removed the cerot of it, and place on top of the plaster wool.
E adonc cum sta annex e ajustat aquel emplastre sobre lu, e la disposicio del os no es alterada, layssa aquel, que no le deslies entro que sia sanat e strenh la fractura; quar motas veguadas aquesta fractura es streyta en tres sempmanas.	And therefore, as it stands annexed and adjusted that plaster on it, and the disposition of the bone is not altered, leave that, that you do not untie it while it is healed and strengthens the fracture; because many times this fracture is straightened in three weeks.
E si autra veguada accida apostema caut, lahoras administra aquo que havem dit motas veguadas en la sedacio de lu entro que sia sanat, e sia remaugut aquel apostema.	And if another time happens abscess after cauterization, then administer that which we have said many times in the sedation of it while it is healed, and be cured that abscess.
E si la fractura es am plagua, lahoras considera si es pessa del os separada o satagias, lahoras tu te subtilia que ostes aquelas satagias am aquo que conveneys ad aquo en la remocio de aquelas dels sturmentz.	And if the fracture is with plague, then consider if it is a piece of the bone separated or splinters, then you subtilize that you remove those splinters with that which is convenient for it in the removal of those from the instruments.
E si le orrifici de la plagua es streyt, lahoras tu le amplifique am le fleubotomi segon la quantitat de la tua necessitat.	And if the orifice of the plague is strait, then you enlarge it with the fleubotomist according to the quantity of your necessity.
E aprop quan tu auras ostat aquelas satagias, e de aquelas no sira remaugut re, lahoras tu cos le orrifici de la plagua si es ampla; e sino, pausa sobre aquela un dels emplaustres que conveneysso ad aquo e encarnan aquela, entro que sia sanada.	And after you will have removed those splinters, and of those there is no remaining cured, then you close the orifice of the plague if it is wide; and if not, place on that one of the plasters that is convenient for it and harden that, while it is healed.
Capitol .v.	Chapter .v.
De restauracio de la furcula quan es trinquada.	Of the restoration of the clavicle when it is broken.
Motas veguadas es trencada la furcula de la partida denant deves le muscle, e aquela fractura es fayta en una de tres manieyras.	Many times the clavicle is broken at the part in front of the muscle, and that fracture is made in one of three manners.
Quar o es trencada, o seperada, o es seperada en doas partz otra que no accidan satagias; e es leugier a la restauracio de lu; o es ayssi que accideysso en lu satagias, e es dificil a restauracio de lu; o es ayssi que la fractura es am plagua.	Because it is broken, or separated, or is separated in two parts other that do not happen splinters; and it is easy to the restoration of it; or it is thus that happens in it splinters, and it is difficult to the restoration of it; or it is thus that the fracture is with plague.

And if you cannot pull the extremity of the clavicle to the outside parts, because it is reached to the preon, then cover that the patient be resupinated over his neck, and place on top of the muscle of it a cushion medium in greatness.

E si es retenguda en le os, lahoras tu ingenia inscisio de lu am un dels inscissoris les quals has apparelhatz ad aquo, pus que havias pausat dejos la furcula le sturment que serve le ciphac; e es sturment de fust o de ferr del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And if it is held in the bone, then you make an incision of it with one of the scissors which you have prepared for this, because you have placed below the collarbone the instrument that serves the chisel; and it is an instrument of wood or iron of which this is the form of it:
E es semblant a culier del qual aquesta es la concavitat; e sia la sua latitut segon aquo que has necessitat de lu, segon la grandeza del os o la pauqueza de lu.	And it is similar to a chisel of which this is the concavity; and its width according to what you need of it, according to the greatness of the bone or the smallness of it.
Mays la longitut de lu sia segon que es a tu possible a la operacio; que haja doas extremitatz ayssi cum vezes, e la una extremitat sia ample e l’autre streyta.	But the length of it be according to what is to you possible in the operation; that it have two extremities as thus, and one extremity be wide and the other narrow.
E si la disrupcio de la plagua la qual has inscidida quan has extraytas la satagia del os es ampla, e yest segur de apostema caut, lahoras tu ajusta las doas labias de la plagua am sutura.	And if the disruption of the plaque which you have incised when you have extracted the splinter from the bone is wide, and there is sure of pus caut, then you adjust the two lips of the plaque with suture.
E si la disrupcio es pauca, o temes apostema caut, lahoras tu uemple la plagua am draps e pulvils segon la quantitat de la scissura de la plagua.	And if the disruption is little, or you fear pus caut, then you plug the plaque with rags and powders according to the quantity of the cut of the plaque.

Mays la strictura del os quan es ses plagua e ses seccio, es que pauses emplastre fayt de farina de moli am album de huou, e pausa sobre lu stopa leon, e aprop pausa la spera dejos le titillic de lu, si indigeyssas de aquela, e aprop pren humemate, so es torca la qual teno les Sarrazis , que sia mot longua, e sia latitut de lu de un palm o entorn aquel; e aprop pausa pulvils duplicatz sobre la stopa e l’emplastre; e aprop pren una stela de taula subtil de la qual la latitut d’ela sia de tres ditz e en longitut semblantment; e aprop envolopa aquela en drap, e aprop envolopa aquel drap am la stela en lo loc sobre le loc de la fractura; e aprop pausa humemati ayssi cum es revout, e revol aquela sobre le col de lu e dejos le titillic de lu sa e dejos le titillic de lu malaute, e reduzeys aquela sobre tota partida, e quan vezes que la strictura de la fractura am strictura descent, e es aquo que no es occultat sobre tu.	But the stricture of the bone when it is its plaque and its section, is that you place a plaster made of flour of mill with album of egg, and place on it linen cloth, and then place the sphere below the nipple of it, if you are indigeyssas of that, and then take humidity, so is the which has the Saracis, that it be mot long, and its width of it of a palm or around that; and then place doubled powders on the linen cloth and the plaster; and then take a tile of subtle board of which the width of it is of three digits and in length seemingly; and then envelop that in cloth, and then envelop that cloth with the tile in the place over the place of the fracture; and then place humidity as it is revout, and revolve that over the neck of it and below the nipple of it and below the nipple of the patient, and reduce that over all part, and when times that the stricture of the fracture with stricture descends, and this is what is not occult to you.

Spatula tart es trencada en le loc lat de lu e no so trencatz de lu sino les marges.	The spatula tart is broken in the side of it and not broken of it but its margins.
